Expected to receive a credit on our bill instead, but after leaving restaurant, in checking with the member of our party who had treated everyone, learned that our server had not deducted anything from bill. Not very professional or customer friendly.

column4: 7 W. Carrillo St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: After reading so many great reviews, decided to try Roy for a birthday celebration. In addition to ordering two other satisfactory though unexceptional entrees (caprese salad and salmon), we ordered their Harris Ranch filet mignon; this turned out to be tough and almost inedible. Returned the steak to server with explanation of same. Server offered to have another steak prepared in its place. However, concerned that the quality might be similarly low, we declined. Expected to receive a credit on our bill instead, but after leaving restaurant, in checking with the member of our party who had treated everyone, learned that our server had not deducted anything from bill. Not very professional or customer friendly.

We love Ruth's for that special romantic evening. We went recently for or two year anniversary. Amazing streak and we lived the spicy lobster appetizer! Extremely convenient parking with the valet service that they will just add to your bill. Expect on spending close to$200 for a couple if you have drinks and appetizers. I love the Manhattan.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Airport)
column4: 7720 Jones Maltsberger Concord Plaza San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: Still the best steakhouse in town. First on our list for special occasions.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - San Antonio (Downtown)
column4: 1170 E. Commerce Street Sunset Station St. Paul Square San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: As requested, we had the priviate dining area downstairs and it was just perfect for the business that neeed to be conducted! Thank you for your extra efforts!
An important Family Special Event From the momment we walked through the door we were treated that way.The view is impressive

We sat outdoors, overlying a pleasant streetscape in downtown Santa Barbara. The tables had oilcloth and the menus were worn. However, the food was excellent. I had the seafood enchiladas with tomatillo sauce. Other entrees at our table were fish tacos and a beef burrito. The margaritas were excellent as well.

From start to finish the meal was fantastic! We had superb service and the food was exceptional. And the views from any seat in the restaurant are breathtaking. Sanderlings has become our new favorite eatery in the area. We can't say enough good things about the restaurant...it's definitely worth the visit...a real treat!
The scampi pasta was amazing! Great service
Loved Saucebox and cannot wait to go back.

It is a hotel restaurant attached to the Marriott Riverfront. When I arrived a few minutes early for my reservation, they told me that they were closing because they didn't have enough diners. So much for that.

column1: Schooners Coastal Kitchen & Bar ___ Monterey Plaza Hotel & Spa
column13: Our dinner was the highlight of our trip, driving up the coast through Sonoma county. Had filet for 2, window table where we got to watch sea otters, excellent wine and fantastic service. Thanks for making our 27th anniversary so special.

column4: 2543 Lake Tahoe Boulevard South Lake Tahoe, CA  96150
column13: We enjoyed our first visit to Scusa. The staff was very friendly and the food was wonderful. This was a birthday celebration and a wonderful surprise desert was provided. We will be back!

column4: 4035 N Loop 1604 W, Ste 102 San Antonio, TX  78257
column13: 6th dinner visit with friends. Good, dependable, but not a standout. However, everyone left happy.

column4: 100 Ocean View Ave. Pismo Beach, CA  93449
column13: Very nice view, nice atomosphere. The food, not so great, as follows: I ordered the pork chop, it was OK,, but a little tough. My nephew ordered the salmon, it was good. My wife and my nephew's wife ordered the pan fried "snapper". My wife is from a country that lives on fish. They were very disappointed. There was no way it was snapper. It was not tilapa (Red Lobster tries this all the time), but it was NOT snapper. Cod possibly. It was very similar to the fish you would find in a fast food sandwich. Both of them left over half the fish uneaten. They would not let me complain, they believe it is not polite (cultural issue).

column4: 30 E. Ortega St. Santa Barbara, CA  93101
column13: Food was excellent, thoroughly enjoyedthe experience. Looking forward to eating there again.
We were able to sit outside on a lovely evening. The services was some of the best we have experienced in Portland. I had the rack of lamb and he had the cioppino, both were outstanding.

Shadowbrook has been a long time favorite of ours for the special occasion. The service and food were excellent with a very nice menu selection and specials. Both of our entrees were exceptional and very satisfying. The pricing was also very reasonable especially for the quality of the food and service.

column1: Sides Hardware and Shoes - A Brothers Restaurant
column4: 2375 Alamo Pintado Avenue Los Olivos, CA  93441
column13: Sides is like having an Ad Hoc in the Santa Ynez Valley. Food is inventive and always well prepared and presented. Lisa is a terrific server. Only shortcoming is that they do not keep white wine cool enough before bringing to the table. Has to chill some before opening.

This is more than a 'scenic' view. This is one of the most breathtaking views on earth. The service was excellent, we arrived early for our reservation, and they seated us as soon as dinner service started. While waiting, we sat in the outdoor area by the bar and watched dolphins and whales through binoculars they provided. The restaurant seems to hang off a cliff overlooking the ocean. The food was excellent also, and very well presented.

I normally enjoy Silk and conside myself a semi-regular there. The food is good and the cocktails are tasty. But the service just gets slower and slower every time I go. On the most recent visit the server announced on our arrival that it was "a bit slow for a first Thursday". Despite it being slower than they had anticipated, the service was still glacial. Drinks took 15 minutes to arrive, and the food was a long time coming too.Come on, Silk. You have a decent product here: yummy food and drinks. But you really have got to fix the service. It's not just slowness. Your people really just aren't on the ball, and walk past tables multiple times when drinks glasses are empty or plates need clearing. Time for retraining I think.
Silo, is a beautiful restaurant, we were impressed with its looks, atmosphere and food. We will recommend it to our friends and make it a place we will frequent as well. Great first impression.

This is my second time at Silo and it still did not disappoint. The service was good, great ambiance and parking on a Sunday was MUCH better than a Friday/Saturday dinner. Both meals I've had were wonderful, so it was easy to overlook the dessert not being up to par. However, they have made a permanent customer. It definitely is in the top 5 list of restaurants that I would choose for a special occasion of if I am craving a high quality meal.
After waiting 1 1/2 hours for our dinner, we left this eatery. We did manage to snag a pretzel or 2 and someone did open our wine.
Great food, with some smaller dishes for smaller appetites.

The food hit some real high notes and some rather low notes. And service was strange for a restaurant of this quality. We ordered appetizers --- bacon beignets which were out of this world --- and a watermelon platter also delicious. Before we could finish these treats, our entree's had arrived! We hadn't finished our cocktails yet! We had selected to split (per our server's suggestion) a large portion of beef. While delicious and delicately flavored, perfectly cooked, there was a significant amount of inedible connective tissue that made for an expensive and yucky addition to the corners of our plates. A moment of judicious butchery before cooking perhaps? And mashed potatoes seemed no salt/butter. How do you serve bland potatoes?
Nice food / wine pairings. Staff is very knowledgeable. Iespecially Monday night's hot jazz live music.

column4: 6873 North Lake Blvd. Tahoe Vista, CA  96148
column13: Delicious food (as always) Ben was an excellent waiter...Can't wait to return next time we're in the Tahoe area.
A fantastic "total package" restaurant with a strong emphasis on service and customer care
It being our first time to a Stanfords we had a great time and service was awesome.

column4: 1440 N Jantzen Beach Ctr Portland, OR  97217
column13: We left because service was very slow. Perhaps it was too busy for the amount of help available for a hot Wednesday night. Stanford's is usually a nice place to go.

column4: 14801 Kruse Oaks Blvd Lake Oswego, OR  97035
column13: We had a wonderful dinner--we were seated in an area where we were able to visit and talk and laugh and appreciate very much, the care the host took to fulfill our request for just such a table. All our needs were met and our dinner was delicious. Thank you very much.
Perfect table and location. Just what I asked for.

The strawberry and Pixie tangerine shortcake with basil syrup was so spectacular that I will assume the restaurant was just having an off night otherwise. Our first courses were not the sum of their parts. The yellowing argula didn't help my wife's salad any. Fortunately my dessert could overcome the tepid coffee served with it. The wine list- SPOILER ALERT, hope you like Lafond!- was abbreviated, but more international than many other choices in the area. On the plus side, mark ups are minimal with Lafond wines priced at almost exactly what they sell for in the tasting room. Service seemed indifferent, so like a good South Park, I randomly inserted the word "marklar" into some sentences with the waitress. No one seemed to notice.

column1: Sterling's Seafood Steakhouse at Silver Legacy Resort Casino
column13: WE HAD DINNER HERE FOR OUR 29TH ANNIVERSARY - JUST HAPPEN TO STOP IN RENO. EXCELLENT EVERY TIME!! OUR WAITER ERIC AND ASSN'T MGR, CARLOS WERE SUPERB!!! THANKS FOR THE SPECIAL TREATMENT AND THE DESSERT!!! LOVE YOUR WINE SELECTIONS!

column4: 17900 S Clackamas River Dr Carver, OR  97045
column13: I'M SORRY THEY WERE A LITTLE OVERWELMED WITH PEOPLE LAST WED. NIGHT. WE WERE THERE FOR MY DAUGHTER'S BIRTHDAY AND THE FOOD WASN'T UP TO PAR. MY DINNER ARRIVED AFTER MY FAMILY WAS FINISHED EATING. I WOULD HAVE NOT CHARGED FOR IT. MAYBE, IN THE FUTURE, THEY MIGHT OFFER THIS. STONE CLIFF IS STILL GOING TO BE ON OUR LIST OF NICE PLACES TO GO.
Mother's Day - food was less than normal, not bad but not great either. Service was also sporadic - good for a while then non-existent then good again.

Ambiance is nice, but kind of noisy--better for large groups. Would recommend more for drinks and apps than dinner. Dinner meals are average, not great for the price. Burgers are probably most reasonable.

column4: 1201 N Loop 1604 W #101 San Antonio, TX  78258
column13: Customer service was outstanding! The place was packed and we still had very timely service. The staff was very accommodating. Great atmosphere for adults and children. Live entertainment was awesome. Overall we loved the environment. We will be back.

column4: 900 San Ysidro Lane Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: The Stonehouse restaurant is located in the San Ysidro Ranch Hotel. The best thing about the Stonehouse is the outdoor patio dining, the ambiance and the service.

I find the idea of sitting and watching the chef prepare our food and talk to us about what he's doing. He changed the menu at the last minute because of what he found at the farmers market. He is very passionate about food and would recommend this to anyone who is a foodie or wants a personal brunch experience.
Food was great but service was slow and lacked enthusiasmOveral an average experienceStill a great place for everyday eating

column4: 203 South Saint Mary's San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: Great sushi and great service - thank you Daniel!!

column4: 999 E. Basse Road Ste. 186 San Antonio, TX  78209
column13: Sushi Zushi is our go-to option when we don't feel like making dinner. Food is good, consistent, and servers are always nice, we've never had a problem. I will say the Lincoln heights location is usually pretty noisy which is good if you have a group. One dissapointing dish we ordered, which doesn't happen much, was an appetizer of seared tuna crusted with pepper. Came with little hint of pepper and none of the sauce that was supposed to be on it, and was a pretty small portion.

column4: 17103 La Cantera Parkway San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: Looking out the picture windows while sipping my wine, I felt like I was on vacation in Europe. Made a dinner of three appetizers which was more than enough but I wanted to try lots of dishes. Unobtrusive but friendly server gave excellent advice on my selections. Looking forward to dining here again.
Some tables too close together. Makes for crosstalk and lack of privacy for a special event.
Great setting outdoors. Enjoyable wine and salad. Meat overcooked and not enjoyed. Hold your sever to your request if the kitchen fumbles it!
Great outdoor seating for a hot Portland night! Food and service wonderful.

Tamarack Junction Steak House was the best way my husband and I could've celebrated his birthday. The service was perfect, the food was so delicious, and the prices were very reasonable for the quantity and quality. By far, the best fine dining experience I've ever had.
I took my girlfriend here for our 3 yr anniversary. We really enjoyed the music and the menu. You have a great variety of food. Very enjoyable!
Annpther great dining experience

We love Taste! The food is always fantastic and the service outstanding. We have been coming to Taste for several years now and always look forward to our meal! The butterscotch pudding is to die for and I LOVE their chicken dijonaise.

column1: The Ahwahnee Hotel Dining Room - Ahwahnee Hotel
column13: Especially good service. A most delightful dining experience. Food was excellent.

This was our 2nd visit to Restaurant at the Ballard Inn. Same as last time, we were not disappointed at all. With exception of the duck dish, we ordered entirely different items from last time. Lamp chop is still delicious but cooked in different way w/ different ingredient from our 1st visit. Filet Mignon was tender like butter - melted in our mouth. And for someone who doesn't usually like sorbet, I just love the homemade sorbet from the Ballard Inn Restaurant - texture was thick, creamy, and refreshing. Can't wait for our next visit! Each time we go, my husband collects the nicely printed "menu of the day" w/ Chef Kazali's autograph! ;)
Wonderful food in an area with limited options. We've eaten there numerous times while staying at Salishan Resort and the food and service are always consistently great.
Great meal. If you're with a group that is game to get the whole menu, I would recommend it highly. It's a great way to taste everything and have a lot of fun doing it.
Great food and excellent service.

Very disappointing food. Two of us had the prime rib, and both meals seemed "warmed-up" via microwave, and not freshly sliced prime rib. (Also both were supposed to be cooked medium, but both were served well done"). The third guest had the fish and chips and liked them. Generally, the price of the meals are too expensive for the quality of food served.

Went with a friend to enjoy a lazy,summer evening on the outdoor pation. Waitstaff picked up on our laid back attitude and were attentive yet unobtrusive during the meal. Gazpacho ceviche appetizer was on point. Had a steak which did not disappoint in terms of quality or quantity.
Great meal- quality meat and satisfying portions. The service was welcoming and thoughtful. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.

We stayed in the hotel and had read many nice things about this spot. It wasn't a bad place at all, just not as good as we had read about or hoped it would be. It's a lovely restaurant with good views out over the bay and wharf. Like the hotel the room design is a mixture of high tech and contemporary nautical themes. The room works. We were treated great by the hostess, who got us the best table in the restaurant. Our server was very good and paced the meal well but the food was not what we hoped it would be. I started with the flight of sparklers, 4 sparkling wines, which our otherwise great server neglected to differentiate. That was OK, we guessed and later, when we asked her, she confirmed that our guess as to which wine was which, was
Had requested a window seat having been there before and this was provided for us.
The fish is always outstanding. Probably the best in San Antonio.

column4: 2360 Gruene Lake Dr New Braunfels, TX  78130
column13: Greeted and welecomed in a very professional fashion. We were seated in an area which I had asked for as a "quiet and cozy" and as it turns out, most of the area we were in was just that.The server was "Davey", she was very knowledgeable on the menu and kept us well attended to.Our company here in town has used this restraunt before on other business venues, but for a personal outing, it serves quite well.
It was very enjoyable. I particularly liked that it was quiet. I could converse with my party very easily.

Delicious food and great, lively atmosphere, but the service was so bad I don't think I could go back. Really, really slow to respond to simple requests, servers didn't seem to care and would even try to avoid/ignore signals that we had questions/needed help, and food took forever (and we were there on a quiet Sunday night).

One of the best dining experiences we've ever had. It was our anniversary dinner, and we were treated like royalty. Very friendly staff. Loved every minute of it. No negatives at all. Very ingenious food, brilliantly prepared. Kudos!
It's a quiet little spot with a focus on serving great tasting food to finicky people. They do gluten-free with flair. Only EVOO. The mango chicken is the best chicken I've had in forever.
Just a solid place given that it is run by an association. Friendly staff, and very solid food!

column1: The Lodge Restaurant at Black Butte Ranch
column4: 12930 Hawks Beard Black Butte Ranch, OR  97759
column13: We have had some excellent meals at the Lodge Restaurant (we are owners at BBR, and have eaten there many times), but this was not one of them. My wife and daughter shared the pork tenderloin, and neither of them liked it. They also each had a cup of the special soup, and, again, were not impressed. I had a special, pasta with lobster mushrooms, which was really poor--I couldn't finish it. The tomato/mozzarella salad was excellent; we had good wines by the glass. Service was fine. My daughter had to sit with sun in her face.

column4: 14855 Blanco Rd,  Suite 110 San Antonio, TX  78216
column13: Our server G was the best and we would go back on a night he was working any day! The food was great have been to two other melting pots and this one might be my new favorite!

Took my wife too the Oregon coast for her birthday and spent a couple nights enjoying the sights and sounds of Portland. Looking for a cool place for brunch our last day and found the Original and what a find. Cool place, great people and outstanding food. Food is off the chart and the polenta cakes my wife had were to die for. Keep up the good eats.Don D - Colorado Springs CO.

I was very pleased with the exceptional service and the food was outstanding. We celbrated my wife's birthday there and they were very attentive to the occassion. I would definatly recomend this restaraunt if you are looking for a great dining experience.

Great food and service. I so miss The Cajun Cafe, NW 21st and Lovejoy, from years ago (the 80's maybe?)...I was VERY young then but remember it as being consistently so good! Hope Parish is around for a long time with more yummy Cajun dishes!

We were staying in Bend for a concert and thought The Phoenix would be a good restaurant to hit up on our way. The wait staff was very attentive and friendly and the food was delicious. We ordered off the 3 course menu and got quite a bit of food. My husband had the salmon piccata and I had the fish and chips. They brought us fresh baked bread and we would definitely when vacationing in Bend again.

column1: The Prime Rib Grill - Eldorado Hotel Casino
column13: We chose this restaurant for my daughter's 21st birthday dinner. We had 14 people and had amazing service. I had the prime rib dinner and it was really good. The salad bar is a great find as well. We would come back again and again. Thank you so much!!!

column4: 220 Old Mammoth Road Mammoth Lakes, CA  93546
column13: They had no idea we even had a reservation.

column1: The Restaurant at JUSTIN Vineyards & Winery
column13: I had a lovely lunch at the Restaurant at Justin Winery! It was a beautiful day to sit outside and have lunch while enjoying the great view of the vines. I had the White Wine flight and the Orrechiette Pasta with Sausage and Mushrooms. The entrees took a long time to come out, but luckily it was nice out it wasn't a big deal. The food was amazing and the wine was delightful!
Had an amazing meal at Ventana Inn. Service was excellent and the food was delicious as was the incredible wine selection. Sit outside and enjoy!

column4: 8200 SW Scholls Ferry Rd Beaverton, OR  97008
column13: The server was really nice. He took our picture when we asked, brought us free champaigne for our anniversary, and provided great service. The food was delicious and the guy who was giving us water kept our glasses full. Great experience

column1: The Vintage Room at The Reserve Golf Course
column13: We sat outside this visit and the view was fantastic!! The food was not quite as good as usual but it was still a great dining experience......

In all fairness, a busy day at the beach but restaurant seemed understaffed. Prices were high for the portion of food. The Cedar Plank salmon tasted like the washed plank it was on instead of like salmon...would not recommend it on a busy night.

It was good, not outstanding. Perhaps the food we ordered was not representational. Salad with bitter lettuces was so, so. The dessert with chocolate ice cream and a coconut macaroon was so, so. However, the Trout and the Tuna Nicoise were very good.The restaurant is extremely noisy.
Poor and slow service. Very few choices on the menu.

column4: 10205 SW Washington Square Rd Tigard, OR  97223
column13: Great food and our waitress was absolutely amazing. Very quick service and wit. She was a joy and every person in our group of 6 had a fantastic meal.

All the flavors and food combinations I would never prepare at home because they just don't seem to blend, UNTIL you put it in your mouth! OMG the taste of everything is amazing! A must every time I'm in Paso!

My experience there was somewhat colored by the noise level; but that was coming from the harbor and not the restaurant. So much for things out of the restaurant's control. Now to specifics: The food was simply amazing. Risotto is a difficult thing to make. They made it look easy; it was perfect. The steak was perfectly prepared, spiced just right and exactly the right temperature(true medium rare)- tender, juicy and virtually melted in the mouth. The chicken was simply perfect. This restaurant is probably worth 5 Michelin stars... I wonder if they've been rated... and the prices were commensurate with the setting, the quality and the ambiance. I'll be back.

Still is a great restaurant in the wine country. The new chef carries on the excellent reputation of this place. The menu is relatively short but provides a nice array of imaginative options. And the wine list is a show case of the area.

column4: 301 E. Houston St. San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: 2nd time eating here. Food was good but not exceptional. Bar service is slow. Waitstaff is polite, pleasant & attentive but unpolished ... clearly they are lacking in training.

We went there for a birthday celebration. Made reservations and did not have to wait. It was surprisingly slow for a Saturday night at 7pm. Drink selection was limited due to a water advisory so that put a damper on our cocktail selection--no fault of the restaurant. I ordered a lemon chicken fettuchini dish which was not bad but not spectacular either (a little bland tasting with not alot of chicken).

A friend and I went to enjoy the anniversary dinner -- it was exceptional. I had a 1944 mai tai....oh so good. What would I change? First: how about some Hawaiian music? Second: the waiter was good, mostly, but inconsistent. Most astonishing, at 8:23, he came to the table to tell us to leave because someone was coming at 8:30. He'd been slow to bring the bill but suddenly, we had to leave. This unhospitable end to the evening was unsettling.
Excellent Italian choices. Very busy restaurant.

column4: 1250 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: Don't know if we experienced an off night or whether it was typical, but we were decidedly unimpressed. We had very high expectations, based on a recommendation from someone very knowledgeable about Italian cuisine and fine dining. Restaurant was very loud. One of our party of seven ordered pizza, which was served before anyone else received appetizers. Main courses were pedestrian. I ordered chocolate creme brê_lê©e for dessert, and it didn't look chocolate when it came out. I asked the waiter to confi that it was chocolate, which he did. He was wrong.

column4: 1151 Coast Village Rd. Santa Barbara, CA  93108
column13: We went on a Sunday expecting lunch however they only serve breakfast on Sundays. It was yummy!

I really want to like this place, but they just can't seem to get their act together. The food ranges from "OK" to "Outstanding" - same with the service! We were there for Sunday Brunch and the memosas were great. Three of the six entrees were "outstanding" - the fried chicken with waffles, the steak and eggs and the pork chop. The other three, not so much - green eggs & ham, duck confit hash and breakfast pizza - they were not bad, just not much to them. Very little ham and very little duck; the pizza was unremarkable. Just not what we expect for the price.

LOVED Trebol! My only complaint was that the place seemed understaffed. The staff they did have was doing an amazing job however!That and our guacamole was almost entirely inedible as the avocado was hard. It should have never been sent out and when we pointed it out nothing was done to compensate... tho we did have a living social deal so that may have been why. Will definitely go again!

We were dissappointed in the change in menu which limited the vegetarian options. The server was extremely helpful and made the experience. The trout was excellent. The bread served with the salad was stale - and not up to par with Portland breads. Very close to the Keller and a good option for a quick meal but little ambiance- what happened to the view of the river?
Outstanding restaurant, although expensive, is one we love for special occasions as our recent anniversary.

column4: 1 Old Golf Course Road Monterey, CA  93940
column13: It was just okay. Good hotel restaurant. I would not seek them out for any occasion. Food just okay. It was surprisingly pricey.

The place can be hard to spot if not for the umbrellas out front but you will not be disappointed once inside. The staff there are more than just friendly they treat you like a friend. The food is great (brie and four mushrooms pizza is awesome!)and the prices are very reasonable for such a beautifully decorated place. There's also billiard tables but you don't feel like you're in a pool hall. Very classy and can't wait to go back! Only bad thing, but you can say this about every place in Portland, is the parking. I ended up getting a parking ticket for a loading zone infraction. Bummer.

Had visited Urban Farmer twice prior for lunch and had a lovely dinner experience with some out of town friends. All of us had wonderful entrees and enjoyed the family style sides. Our server went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and welcome, and I can't wait to try the various cheeses on my next trip.
Great Martini's from their bar... Bartini.
Always great!Great staff, great food, great beer selection!

column4: 690 Higuera St. San Luis Obispo, CA  93401
column13: We had rehersal dinner for 22 people on a Saturday night....was very nice...no problems....staff very happy....
Front of the house was poorly trained, i had to wait 10 minutes . Their was only one person to seat guests and he was doing that slowly. The food and our server Brittani were outstanding!
What an amazing place! We were very impressed with the food and service. We will be back, and back, and back again.

column4: 6795 So. Virginia Street Suite H Reno, NV  89511
column13: The food was wonderful - and the tappanade with black olives is excellent!

You sit right on Lake Tahoe it is just gorgeous. The service was a bit slow and we had to keep asking for more water and bread. The view can't be beat. We happened to be there on a full moon. It came up right in front of us across the lake it was beyond words.
We are at the bar several nights including Happy Hour. Jason/Justin made out evening. He's great!

column4: 415 Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924
column13: Small but good menu, gourmet pizzas, steaks, seafood and chicken. Something for everyone. too bad patio was closed for private party, but we hung out until they left and enjoyed a bottle of wine by the fire. Recommend this spot!
Casual setting but serious about seafood. Great options for sauces and presentation Attentive wait staff and timely delivery of different courses
Amazing place to have a special occasion!! Food was wonderful, service was outstanding and I will definitely come back!!!
Wildwood may not get the hype it once had nor the hipster cred that other restaurants have, but you won't find a better combination of great food, great service and great wine list anywhere.

column4: 800 NW 6th Ave at Union Station Portland, OR  97209
column13: Matrix Morpheus chairs a bit odd... Food is good but pricey jazz was good

Excellent food and service. We wanted to eat outside but smoking is allowed and that was a turn off. Someone was smoking at the time and it does smell up the whole patio, so they seated us back inside again.

column4: 19 East Carmel Valley Rd Carmel Valley, CA  93924-9703
column13: We had an awful experience....starting with our waiter being 15 min late for his shift. We sat there unattended and ready to leave when he showed up.The hostess took our drink order and, again, it took about 15 minutes just to get a glass of wine.In addition, the fish was ok but the sauce for it was bland. My husband did not receive any condiments for his baked potatoe. He would have asked for something if we had ever seen our waiter.Next, my husband asked for another glass of wine with dinner, and never received it.I have found the service to be awful from the day Bernardus took it over.I'm telling all my friends what a terrible experience it was and to beware if they go there.Barbara

column4: 640 North Lake Blvd. Tahoe City, CA  96145
column13: Recommend outdoor seating, most inside tables do not have a clear view of the lake. Food was disappointing; service average on the night we went for dinner.

Wonderful... Open, modern, simple decor... The ribs are spectacular succulent, fall off.the bone, amazing Sauce. Presentation was lovely. Inventive cocktails. Our wait person was attentive but not intrusive. A great experience that will be repeated.

column4: 15900 La Cantera Parkway Ste 25100 San Antonio, TX  78256
column13: One issue wiqth an undercooked meal but theey were really on top of it zand tok care of us without us having fo ask.
Based on quality alone the wines are overpriced. Other local restaurants have better wines, larger pours, and a better variety during happy hour.

column4: 207 North Presa Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: I eat at Zinc all the time. The food is outstanding and it's easier to get a table here than at its sister restaurant Boudro's. The Shrimp Po-Boy is a must on your visit if you like a great Po-Boy sandwich. Food is always very consistent and the bar scene gets very vibrant. Outside patio welcomes cigars, so it's a great place to enjoy a good cigar and a glass of wine. Huge wine list and full bar. Hamburgers are also excellent as well as everything else on the menu.

column4: 420 W. Market Street San Antonio, TX  78205
column13: The food was excellent and the service was top notch.

I would recommend but only for the tableside S'mores. I thought the burger and tots were just "ok". The fried pickles had a tasteless batter that didn't stick well to the spear. The decor seemed very dated.

column1: Bob's Steak and Chop House - Omni Tucson National Resort
column13: This was my first time at Bobs and I arrived around 7pm on a Saturday and expected to see a valet to park my vehicle but drove through the drop off area right in front of the entrance and there was not a person in sight anywhere. I went ahead and parked my vehicle and had to walk from the parking garage to the entrance but I was questioning if I was at the right entrance because there was no one out front to great us or even open the door. Once we entered there was a girl at a computer who checked my reservation and sat us at a table. The food was good but for $117 dollars for two steaks, one salad and two sodas I was not impressed. For that money I expect a valet service and someone to open the door for me when I arrive.

column4: 10999 N. Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd Scottsdale, AZ  85259
column13: Food is excellent. Try their thin-crust pizza. Servers Lori and Laura are top-notch.
very satisfied overall.

column4: 10455 E Pinnacle Peak Pkwy (Not Pinnacle Peak Road) Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: What an incredible place! The view, the ambiance not to mention the wonderful cuisine...and the service was first class. Our 2nd time visiting Sassi so apparently have become "regulars".

column1: Bourbon Steak at The Fairmont Scottsdale Princess
column13: The most tender and delicious steak I've had in years! Food is outstanding, and the service was impeccable.

column4: 20751 N. Pima Road Suite 120 Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: We have dined here before (appetizers and dinner) and feel like we did the last time... the food is good, the service is good but it seems to be a bit pricey. Perhaps it is the North Scottsdale pricing. We think we might return just for happy hour...

column4: 2905 E. Skyline Drive Suite 168 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: I've been here a number of times, and always enjoyed it. It's a great place for a couple of glasses of Cabernet during happy hour. The flatbread is delicious too.

column4: 16091 North Arrowhead Fountains Center Peoria, AZ  85382
column13: It worked out very well. Mom enjoyed her Birthday. Thankyou so much.
Had a very good dinner and will come back again sometime.

The food for very authentic and tasty. What also impressed me was the service. Our waiter was from Croatia and you could tell that this was his profession. You didn't have to ask for anything. He had it before you could think of it. Truly a professional. I usually only see that in New York where young men have spent their lives in the service industry. Not too many of the fancy Scottsdale restaurants have this type of service. It is a learned skill and one that he obviously takes pride in. Thank you. We will go back for sure. Great little place. !!!!
Great service great food. Would definitly go there again.
First timer. Filet was great. Surprise party a success.

We have been to Black Angus before and really enjoyed it. This was not the case this time. The service by Cassie was phenomenal; she was attentive and personable. The food however was terrible; more specifically the rib eye steaks. We thought we were eating a Village Inn quality steak. It was thin and tasted like a cheap steak at an inexpensive price for the quality we got. This was my parent's 50th wedding anniversary and was a big disappointment.
Service was good. Very filling. Desert was big
Service and food were great. A very nice evening.
Excellent food and wine list combined with great ambiance! A great neighborhood gem!
Food was amazing.Waiter needs more training on menu and table serving manners. He was adorable otherwise.

The service is very good but the food is terrible. The sea bass dish, the shrimp dish as well as the beef burro dish are just bland and covered with sugary sweet sauce. This is no Mexican cuisine. We all had apple crisp for dessert and they are ok.

I have eaten at some very good steak restaurants, but this ribeye was not worth #35 at all. It was very thin, fatty and didn't taste good. It reminded me of what you would get at a casino. Also, the mac and cheese tasted like the milk in it was bad. Someone else in my party had canneloni, which was just ok. Another person had a different cut of steak and it wasn't good either. I loved the ambiance and live jazz.
It was a fine restraunt, but for the price I expected better food and a better salad bar.

column4: 36889 N. Tom Darlington Dr Carefree, AZ  85377
column13: Food and serve wonderful as always. Acorn squash soupp was creamy and yummy. The trout was amazing, It is one of my favorite places to dine.

Were greeted politely by the hostess, brought to our patio table, water right away. After about 10 minutes Lindsey came out and asked if we were served yet and we said no. This was our second time at the restaurant, Lindsey was our waitress the first time. We asked if she could be our waitress, she said she had to check. She came back, apologized for the delay and took our order. The meal was great.

column4: 34505 N. Scottsdale Road, Suite G2 Scottsdale, AZ  85262
column13: We highly recommend the Spotted Donkey at el Pedregal. Every time we have visited this restaurant, the food and service have been fantastic. This place is excellent, and we always have a memorable, and tasty, experience. Thanks to the gang at the Spotted Donkey for all of their efforts. We are already looking forward to our next visit!
Intimate, charming and completely authentic Italian, where food trumps ambience.

column4: 300 East Wigwam Blvd Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: The service was outstanding. The dining room needs to be seriously spruced up; new paint, etc.

I read a review that described this place as having the feel of a cafeteria and without any prompting that is exactly how my wife described it. Our server was very friendly...almost too friendly...but no complaints. Our food (stuffed chicken breast and salmon) were ok but nothing special. The live music was a nice touch and maybe we'll return on a Saturday night for a nosh and the music.

We had a very pleasant evening. Our waitress was very good and responsive to all our requests. All of the staff that we encountered were very pleasant and we felt they genuinely cared about our dining experience.

Service was impeccable. Chef was entertaining. Food absolutely amazing. Great for special occasions and they offer a birthday club where you get a certificate for use during your birthday month for $30 off your meal. Plus free ice cream with a candle and a birthday song. The instant photo memory keepsake is the icing on the cake.

Chandler, AZ on Ray. Family style dineing, great for groups so everyone can have a bit of everthing ordered. Can get exensive quickly though. Assided from the clapping and singing the wait staff was doing for birthdays, the noise was fairly quiet on that Sunday afternoon. Food as always was cooked to perfection. Calamari was not rubbery and mushrooms came out perfect as well. Waitress (cindy) was attentive kept drinks filled.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler
column13: We went for REstaurant week and ended up ordering off the regular menu. It was our first time at Flemings so we wanted to experience other options than the restaurant menu. Sides are huge so split for sure. The half and half side we weren't that impressed with. The soup, salad, shrimp, steak and sauteed mushrooms were great.

column4: 3111 W. Chandler Boulevard Chandler Fashion Center Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: I have eaten here seval time and it is always hit and miss.. Tonight was a big miss, and I don't plan on going back anytime soon. We order sushi and it came to the table a hour after we arrived. A few minutes later the entree's were sent to the table. Water glasses were empty most of the meal. The sushi was good. The entree's ranged from great (steak flatbread) to awful (meatloaf).
Food was excellent, the service was ok, but overall, we more than likely will be back. The restaurant week menu was great!
During this visit I came on a Saturday night, it was much more quiet than the weekdays. If you would like a great dinner and great conversation I would recommend this location on the weekend ONLY.

column4: 3717 E. Indian School Rd. Phoenix, AZ  85018
column13: What a great meal and great service from Keith. Will definitely be back!
One of the best meals we have had in our lives - the food itself was amazing but the ambiance is unsurpassed.

column4: 7042 E. Indian School Rd. Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Always have a fantastic meal at Eddie's House. The Halibut entree is outstanding and this time we tried the vegetable plate as well. Terrific service with a special thank you to Lori (our server) who keeps us coming back!
Josephine's is the best place in Flagstaff. End of story.

I've been going to Cheuvront's for many years. This is the only time I had a less than stellar visit. Server was not up to their usual standards and was too timid to be successful. A few items were not available on the wine, food and cheese menu so that was disappointing..
Menu was classical French and very delightful. Tables were very close together for any ambiance. Service was outstanding. I will return.

One of the best restaurants in town. The food was cooked to perfection. The best salmon I've ever had. Even the lemon drop cocktail was excellent. I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience and look forward to going again.

I absolutely loved my first experience at City Hall Steakhouse! Delicious, melt in your mouth filet,oridinal, delectable lobster mashed potatoes, and key lime pie that was "to-die-for", and of coursethe impeccable service make this restaurant a truly amazing dining experience!
Everyone was very accomodating and the food was wonderful. It was our first time at this Morton's and would recommend it highly.

column4: 15323 N Scottsdale Rd suite E1-160 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: Hadn't been since they moved to Scottsdale Quarter from DC Ranch...menu was just as familiar and delicious - and what a fun way to celebrate AZ Restuarant week!
Very good staff. It was our anniversary and our waitress and the manager took great care of us.

Had a wonderful dinner and our waiter Juan could not have made it more enjoyable! Everyone was attentive without being intrusive. Juan added just enough humor to make the evening perfect! They very generously gave us a piece of cheesecake to celebrate our anniversary, and it was the best cheesecake I have ever had!
Good restaurant, don't understand why it wasn't more crowded though.

column4: 6541 E Tanque Verde Rd Suite 7 Tucson, AZ  85715
column13: A hidden gem!! The food was excellent and the outdoor dining backdrop could not be beat. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The sweet potato fries and the accompanying special sauce was to die for -- the best we have ever had.

column1: Rita's Kitchen at Camelback Inn, A J.W. Marriott Resort
column13: Great service and beautiful outside eating

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - DC Ranch
column4: 20753 N. Pima Road Bldg. R Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: We visited Flemings for AZ Restaurant Week - there was zero mention of that option by our waiter - until we asked for it - food & service was good - certainly feels like a PF Chang Chain Steakhouse though.

Of the new restaurants I sampled for 2012 Fall Restaurant Week, this was my favorite! Seemed quiet for a Saturday night but the service was excellent so can't complain. The menu had several items I'll have to try another time but we stayed with the special menu for this visit. Wonton soup and Strawberry salad were good starts, particularly enjoyed the candied walnuts on this salad. Entrees were the stars.. Saigon Lobster was flavorful and plentiful but the Macadamia Nut Crusted Halibut was just amazing. The portion was very generous and what a nice combonation of flavor and textures! Dessert was an entertaining berry flambe and a fairly standard chocolate ganache cake. John the waiter shared his recomends and was very attentive!

I was in Phoenix on business and this is exactly the kind of place I like to seek out when I travel. The space is modern with clean lines and generally dark colors, but not over the top. Our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive and didn't try to steer us in any particular direction on food choices. My friend and I shared several small plates and absolutely everything was perfectly prepared without being over the top. The pork belly sopes were a particular favorite of mine, but kudos to the kitchen on prepping perfect roasted asparagus-- harder than it sounds. The bar didn't disappoint either, with nicely prepared, well-balanced cocktails. Mixology is fashionable again, thankfully, and this bar knows how to do it right.
Had been to Las Vegas location and was not impressed. Now this my family's favorite steak house in Phoenix!

column1: Taste- An American Bistro at The Hilton Phoenix Chandler
column13: THEY DIDN'T KNOW HOW TO CHECK ME IN WITH OPEN TABLE, SO I'M SO HAPPY TO KNOW IT WAS ACCOMPLISHED THE FOLLOWING DAY.

column4: 10355 N. LaCanada Dr Oro Valley, AZ  85737
column13: We had mussels as an appetizer. The portion was VERY small.

column4: 6107 N. Scottsdale Rd Suite 110 Scottsdale, AZ  85250
column13: My only complaint was that the menu was a little sparse- needed many more items...

column4: 28234 N. Tatum Blvd Cave Creek, AZ  85331
column13: Great place for our large group Happy Hours! We have been several times. The food and service are always excellent. Music is a nice touch.
The Arizona Inn is one of those historic gems that has been discovered by a really great chef and the combination is outstanding! The food was creative and extremely well presented.

column1: Palm Court at The Scottsdale Resort
column13: Some of the best table side service at any restaurant we have ever been too. Banana's Foster prepared table side was off the chart. Great summer 5 course wine pairing at great price.
Fabulous quality and typical Kimpton service
A special place with service and food that exceeds my expectations! Great job!!
Fantastic food, and even better service! I will be going back again and again...
Had a good meal during restaurant week. It was a limited menu, but still great selections nonetheless. Had some great food. Keep it up!
Delicious food, beautiful preparation, breathtaking views (come before dark at least for cocktails if not for dinner), wonderful wine list. Service is glacially paced but the food is worth it.

column1: Tii Gavo, a gathering place at Enchantment Resort
column13: I would suggest that a review of the items in the lunch menu be considered. My partner could not eat spicy food so the choices were limited and not very appealing. The service was excellent. We especially liked the views of the red rocks.

column1: Arizona Grand Resort- The Lobby Grill
column4: 8000 S Arizona Grand Pkwy Phoenix, AZ  85044
column13: View is nice. Sandwiches were okay but the fries were soggy and greasy. Was hoping for more but will probably try one more tomr because the location and view from the dining room are so nice.

column4: 7555 E. Eagle Crest Dr. Mesa, AZ  85207
column13: We ate there the last few days before a scheduled renovation. They had all of their menu items available on their standard menu but there was still enough choices. The food was excellent and the service was friendly and efficient.I can't wait for them to reopen.
Great old steakhouse but the menu is the same as it has always been.
our server rainy was truly outstanding. Excellent wine list and food was great.
Food was excellent and at perfect temperature. Angelo, one of the owners, was very friendly, witty, and personable.
Everyone there was really friendly and attentive! The food was choice! And I cannot say enough about the location and view!
We enjoyed Lodge on the Desert very much. It was our first time there. Food wasreally good and our server was excellent.

We had a memorable dinner. Our guests that came with us said it was the best dining experience and food they have had in a long time. Jeff, our waiter was awesome. He remembered us from a previous visit, welcomed us back and did a superb job serving us. We enjoyed the evening and didn't want to see it end. We are looking forward to returning!
noisy too many kids at the time i was there

The fresh chips and made at your table salsa are fantastic. My entire party thouroughly enjoyed their entrees. Service was a bit slow and the mariachi band was at times MUCH too loud, overall a fantastic dining experience.
The best salsa around - made custom for you at your table. Large menu to choose from. Food and service has always been consistently good.

column4: 2224 E Williams Field Road Gilbert, AZ  85295
column13: Service was slow. My wife's rolls were falling apart. Asked for new ones and they didn't come out till we were done eating everything else. Very disappointed in the service we received.

column4: 7500 E. Doubletree Ranch Road Hyatt Regency Scottsdale Resort and Spa at Gainey Ranch Scottsdale, AZ  85258
column13: Overall it was a great experience. However, for the food served, especially the amount, the prices were waaaaay too high.

column4: 6770 N Sunrise Blvd Suite G-211 Glendale, AZ  85305
column13: When you walk in and the first person you see is the hostess and she can't even greet you with a smile it turns you off completely! I even tried to joke with her and nothing! It was 115 outside and she asked us if we wanted to sit outside... Really? Then she seats us and plops down the menus and walks away! Our waiter took his time to get to our table he was ok nothing special. Once we received our sushi it was sub par nothing great I think for the price it should of been a whole lot better, presentation was sloppy. The vegi ramen was great but my teriyaki salmon was horrible. I would try it again to see if things are better and only order the soup. They really need a nice hostess that knows customer service and knows how to smile.
My lunch salad consisted of iceburg lettuce, a smattering of black beans and chicken and Kraft low fat salad dressing. In short, I would have been happier at Mc Donalds.

The food was excellent and our waiter was attentive and made some great recommendations. My vegan wife had the portabella and would recommend it as one of the best dishes she has eaten. I truly enjoyed the pecan crusted trout and would highly recommend it and the potato soup.

column1: Primo at the JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort & Spa
column4: 3800 W. Starr Pass Boulevard Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: Our server, Kirby, was knowledgeable and helpful. She was there when we needed but did not hover! And the food was so good. The Farmers Salad was spot on. Appealing ant creative. My guest loved the cobia. The pasta in my Vongole was perfect...al dente.
The peanut butter decadence dessert was absolutely amazing!
I've been here twice and only have good things to say about this place. The food is great, the service is even better.

column4: 8280 West Union Hills Road Suite 110 Glendale, AZ  85308
column13: Great experience! I would highly recommend this restaurant. Service was attentive but not intrusive. We had the filet and prime rib. Cooked to perfect temp. Server was knowledgeable and helpful with recommendations. Received great value for meal. Will return.
They had a party going on in the inside, which was very noisy, so we requested to be outside! It was enjoyable, quiet and beautiful!

column1: BLT Steak at Camelback Inn, A JW Marriott Resort
column13: My wife and I ate there for the first time on our 5 year anniversary and we loved it! It was a perfect meal for a perfect evening. We plan on visiting regularly now.
Just really great food!! ...very unique approach in serving Indian food compared to other restaurants in the Phoenix Area...

column4: 413 N. San Francisco St. Flagstaff, AZ  86001
column13: One of our favorites! Food and wine are great. The tempura squash blossoms were a treat this time!
The food was impeccable. I tried several things that I normally can abide eating and they were delicious! I will definitely eat here again!

column4: 7111 E. 5th Ave Ste. E Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Good food and service, nice wine seclection. We shared crab cakes and chicken/waffel appetizers between 3 of us, both quite good. I had the crispy steelhead with risotto, which was very good. One had the shortribs, which were also very good, tender. One had the scallops, which were excellent. We shared the bread pudding and the black and tan for dessert. The black and tan is excellent. Second visit to CPH, similar to first time. Will go again.

column4: 4991 S. Alma School Rd. Ste 1 Chandler, AZ  85248
column13: I have heard about Corkmformthe last several years and have always wanted to try it. It definitely lived up to all of the reviews, all of the hype and my expectations. The waiter had me the minute he said "pardon my reach"...I was in fine dining heaven. We went as part of Phoenix Restaurant Week so we had a prix fixe menu and you had three options for each course. I can't wait to come back - not even for a special occasion per se. It was just that good.
Excellent food with a great atmosphere. Knowledgeable and friendly staff. Highly recommend and we will go back.
Wonderful food for risky palates.

Actually hit up three different restaurants for this past restaurant week. Crudo was by far the best and the only one I would return to outside of restaurant week. We savored every bite, from their bacon relish to their butterfish to the Romanian style escargot. I've never had such a flavor-packed risotto - perfect amount of heat - and the pork belly is a must. I'm not a big dessert guy but those were good, too.

Overall it was a very enjoyable experience and we would go back. the portions were just right and the presentation and flavors were excellent. the service was great and very accommodating. due to the small seating space, i would always make a reservation.

column1: Brittlebush Bar & Grill at The Westin Kierland Resort
column13: The Beer dinner series is a fabulous deal and Chef Graham and his staff always does a terrific job pairing delicious food with the beer from each brewery. We love the beer series.

column1: Deseo at the Westin Kierland Resort & Spa
column13: We sat at "The Rail" and got to talk with the ceviche chef and learned much about ceviche. The staff were very attentive. We were there for our anniversary and they prepared a wonderful dessert of a chocolate cigar filled with filling, edible matches, and an awesome mocha ice cream treat. What a surprise! This is also the ultimate place to test out mojitos. Go early and have a few before your meal. Their special rolls with con queso cheese is also a unique find here. We will always visit Deseo on our trips to Scottsdale.

column1: Nellie Cashman's Monday Club Cafe at The Westin Kierland Resort & Spa
column13: Food service atmosphere, all top notch.
raviolli overpriced and looked and taste like celletano from the box not homemade
Very nice menu. Service was excellent. Great experience.

column4: 5532 North Palo Cristi Road Paradise Valley, AZ  85253
column13: Great Gem in Phoenix. Menu is a bit overpriced...that is the only thing keeping me from rating all 5 stars.
A nice place. Great happy hour. The food was excellent. Had to wait a bit for service when we arrived.
classy place great experienced waitor delicious unique food a time memoriable
very intimate, excellent food, very personable wait staff. byob is great

Pastiche is our favorite restaurant in Tucson. It has a varied menu, great food and an amazing wine list. In addition, the service is the best and friendliest in town. They are back to late night hours on weekends so we can hit it after a play or movie. What more could you ask for?

Every course of our restaurant week menu was a delight for the eyes and the tastebuds. Vegetable terrine was a colorfully vibrant presentation. We opted for extra course of silky foie gras atop a crispy buttermilk waffle which was a nice alternative to toast, pairing well with the sauternes.

The hummus with balsamic vinegar dripped over it is "to die for." Since I am a vegetarian, I chose to have the crispy eggplant bites which were fantastic! I also had my usual PCG pasta (without the chicken) and was sad that there wasn't enough left to take home (because I ate it all).

column4: 6166 N Scottsdale Rd Ste 701 Scottsdale, AZ  85253-5442
column13: Pomo was an excellent restaurant and it reminded us of a few places we ate at in Rome, Italy. The chefs crafted our order perfectly and the quality was very good. The taste was as close as it gets from actually being in Italy, likely the difference in local ingredients. This location was busy so reservations are recommended.

column4: 7167 East Rancho Vista Drive Unit 111 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: The staff was perfect, from the amiable hostess, knowledgeable waitstaff and prompt removal of plates from the bussers. The food was phenomenal, each bite better than the last. I love the tasting menu which gave us a chance to try many wonderful styles and ingredients.
little too noisy for a date, great service, draft sauvignon blanc was delicious
Food was awesome and service was great!
Had the tasting menu and it was a truly wonderful dining experience. Creative and delicious,

column4: 1425 N. McCulloch Blvd. Lake Havasu City, AZ  86403
column13: As always.......wonderful. A beautiful setting to share a fantastic dinner with friends and family. The place to go in Lake Havasu City for great food and service, always the best.

We have been to St. Francis many times. We ordered a flatbread appetizer and it was exceptional. It was Restaurant Week and we had a prix fixe dinner which was excellent(Ciopino). Could not leave without a loaf of their amazing bread.

My wife and I both thought Sushi Roku had the best sushi that either one of us have tried in the Phoenix, Az area. The staff did a wonderful job. They kept water in my glass the entire time and more importantly fill your glass w/o being intrusive. I always pay attention when dining to how well a restaurant is able to give you outstanding service w/o you really feeling like they have been around. The management at Sushi Roku have that down to a science. I also noticed how quickly and smoothly they are able to turn their tables. Way to go to all the staff at Sushi Roku!!!

column4: 7114 E. Stetson Dr. Suite 210 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Top notch , Service, food, decor and patio ... Nick was great
The drinks were excellent Classic Mojito, daily rum punch, etc. The snapper was very good. Our server was well-informed and pleasant.
From the minute we stepped through the door we were made to feel very welcome. This was my first visit, my friend had eaten at Greekfest and wanted to return for her birthday lunch
Food did not seem to be their forte, but that's understandable given that they are more of a night out place. I would go back for drinks/starting the night off, but not for dinner.
Great cocktails and very good food. Would definitely recommend for Brunch.

column1: Tommy V's Urban Kitchen and Bar Scottsdale
column4: 7303 E Indian School Rd. Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Excellent food and service. Very contemporary and classy place to take clients, family or friends. Great location to walk around afterwards. Not negatives. We all loved our evening.

column4: 2 N. Central One Renaissance Sq Ste 102 Phoenix, AZ  85004
column13: We sat on the patio. I really enjoyed the brisket!!! Our waitress was very knowledgeable and attentive. We will return.

column4: 15411 W. Waddell Rd Suite 108 Surprise, AZ  85379
column13: The meatloaf with potatoes gratin and the Blue Jeans Burger were our food choices for the evening and really hit the spot for our weeknight dinner. Service was excellent and we had a relaxing evening enjoying our dinner out.

Our server was great, but the food was just so-so. He took off an item from the ticket that I didn't eat without me saying anything. The food was really just not very good at all. I like the location but I don't think we will be going back.

column4: 8 S. San Marcos Place Chandler, AZ  85225
column13: It was great! Great vibe and selection of beer was great!

column4: 6370 N Campbell Ave Ste 160 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: The patio was crowded and the live music was excellent but very loud. We sat inside where for much of the time we were the only customers. Nonetheless, the service was attentive and we found it very pleasant. The menu is limited, but both of us enjoyed what we had (I had the meatloaf, she had a caprese salad). Only about half of the wines on the list were available (the others were crossed out), and what we drank was mediocre. We will be returning, but will not order wine next time.

We can't comment on the food because it never came. An hour and a half after sitting down, and after being told that the food was being plated for 30 minutes, we discovered it was a lie and we had to leave because we had a child who was now u past bedtime and was getting very hungry and cranky. The tables around us cycled through twice while we sat and waited, and the food that the they got (all parties of 2) looked pretty good.
The wait staff was friendly, courteous, and very professional.

column4: 3645 W. Starr Pass Blvd. Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: The BBQ pulled pork is amazing - the best we've had! Enjoyed the creamed corn as well.

column1: Kai - Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort
column4: 5594 W. Wildhorse Pass Blvd Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: Another exceptional meal at Kai. Go if you get a chance.

column1: Ko'sin Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort
column4: 5594 W. Wildhorse Pass Blvd Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: The restaurant look lovely but it has many flaws in execution - the chairs are uncomfortable, the silverware hard to use for someone w/ arthritis, the plates too small for some dishes. The cheese bisque and shrimp cocktail were terrific and the salmon was outstanding, but some of the gnocchi was burned as was the creme brulee. After telling our server my cosmo was undrinkable he removed it from my bill along w/ our coffees. Interesting note - no bartender on a busy Sat night. Poor choice by manager. Service was spotty - the 2 cocktails arrived at different times, pepper mill was empty, no one asked if we wanted coffee refill, server had NO idea what wine we'd ordered. Not the level of expertise in either chefs or wait staff as Kai.
Food was excellent! Everyone is not into 3 salts, none were normal... Suggest a normal shaker on the table...

The shrimp cakes for a first course were really, really good and the macadamia crusted fish was delicious. It was served with plain white rice and would have been nicer with a more flavorful side dish. The sauted spinach and the crispy fried sweet potato chips made up for the rice. it was a wonderful combination. I visited during Tucson Restaurant Week, an excellent opportunity to try a new restaurant. I will definitely return.
Great experience! At first they wanted to seat me at a table I didn't care for, but we got that taken care of reasonably quickly.After that - great food, great service!

It was very nice and romantic atmosphere at the restaurant.The food was amazing. The service was impeccable. The dessert was also lovely. Atmosphere- relaxed, friendly andthe people working there are very kind.

column4: 300 E. Wigwam Boulevard Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: *Atmosphere quiet & romantic yet had a casual feel*Pan Roasted Halibut, blue corn fritters & Heirloom Potatoes amazing*Wine selection excellent- Alexander Valley Cab 09*Service was professional net friendly and attentive

Not sure if I go there for the Corned Beef, Spicy Mustard or the Ice Cream. They are all so good. There services is fantastic. Great place for lunch, can't wait for the trolley to finish so it is easier to get there, but it is definately worth the trouble to find this place.
best mole we have ever eaten including multiple trips to various locations in Mexico!!!
Great place, we had a wonderful meal,staff was also great, we where greeted my our names.We are going back.
Tutti Santi is always a pleasure and never disappoints. Thank you Nina. P
if you like sports, this is the place to go. All kinds of memorabilia, especially baseball and great food too!

column4: Arizona Biltmore 2400 E Missouri Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: My date and I werr treated like royalty by staff. I requested a romantic setting via OpenTable reservation notes. The gave us the best table in the place...absolutely perfect. Our waiter (can't remember his name) from Argentina selected a variety of the small dishes so that we could taste everything they had. The food was out of this world.
Great restaurant, very nice lady waiter!!!!, wonderful to be able to sit on the patio with 6 people. Wished we could see the city lights from there.
The steak was great but the sauce on the ribs was pretty bad and the sides were pretty bland and need a lot of salt.
Atmosphere was good. AC was not so great--a bit hot inside. Food was good but plates were not hot. Service was excellent.

column4: 400 N. Toole Ave Suite 100 Tucson, AZ  85701
column13: Food was fabulous and the wait staff was excellent. Very knowledgeable. The resturant was busy, but we did not suffer from waiting. Food came in a timely manner and was well presented.
Best New York strip I've had in a long time. The Ott was a great accompaniment with it!

column4: 1730 South Val Vista Drive Mesa, AZ  85204
column13: The restaurant had a very Italian decor it remind me of the north end in Boston or even new york. The staff was very friendly, and our waitress was great. we started with off with the antipasto tossed salad it was excellent. for our entree we had stuffed chicken with ham which was extremely tasty. But the Alfredo was very bland. The kids meals were very pleasing both children were happy with there meals.
Loved the restaurant and especially liked the grill and salad part of the menu.

column4: Arizona Biltmore 2400 E. Missouri Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: we tried the resturant twice and it was poor both times. Took more than an hour for the food to come each time - food was just ok

Restaurant Week salmon entree was outstanding. We'll go back to have it often since it is apparently on their normal menu. Six of us were there & everyone seemed to enjoy the evening. We live in the area & will certainly go back.

column4: 10885 N. Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd. Scottsdale, AZ  85259
column13: Real New Mexican cuisine in Arizona. The red and green chile gravy and stuffed chiles are great.
Very good food and nice presentation.

column1: District American Kitchen and Wine Bar
column13: Based on all of the reviews, I really expected more. The food was very tasty but the service was very slow and uneven. Our server was young, polite and nice but disappeared for long periods of time. The wine list was just okay. Could have found every bottle at a big grocery store. Sommelier was nice and quickly exchanged our bottle of wine when it was corked. The prices were pretty reasonable so I guess we got what we paid for. I would only return if I was staying in the Sheraton. Would find other options if you are looking for "special" dining experience.

column4: 7014 E. Camelback Road Suite 1433 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Service was a little slow, but we were there on a Saturday. Meal was very nice. Had the bacon wrapped pork tenderloin and the filet, both of which were very good and flavorful. Would recommend not to sit on the "patio inside the restaurant" unless you want to people watch, while physically in the mall.

Went for brunch. Lovely room and grounds. Excellent buffet or order off the menu. Promptly seated, greeted, served. Nice table outside as requested. Easy to talk, not crammed in, but a good crowd which I consider a positive. Food quality superb. I thought price was very good for the service, ambiance, and food quality and quantity. Would definitely go again - soon - and will try other meals (lunch, dinner, etc) now also. Just a great place all around.

column1: Steak House at Desert Diamond Casino
column13: My husband and I had dinner with two friends. We had a wonderful dinner. The service was impeccable. Even though there was a five dollar split plate charge we didn't mind paying. They served plenty enough to share on one plate. The bacon wrapped shrimp was cooked perfectly. I'm looking forward to going back.
Always good food and attentive service. A new dessert we shared was very good. Warm sugared doughnuts with a lemon cream sauce. Delicious!!

column4: 15024 N. Scottsdale Rd, Suite 160 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: Might not be good for a business meeting since it's difficult to hear the person siting across from you.

We stopped in before a movie - we are on a diet but the selection of fit food was great. Best part? Lou the manager - he was awesome and a lot of fun to talk to. We even went back after the movie for a night cap.
Meals were very good.
We had fajitas and seafood enchiladas. The fajitas were good, but not better than others we have had. The red sauce on the enchiladas was not one that I cared for.

column4: 7135 E. Camelback Road, Suite 195 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Apppetizer and salad was good, main dish just ok. Fun atmoophere, probably would not go back.

column4: 5455 East High Street Suite 115 Phoenix, AZ  85054
column13: Swordfish was so moist the best I have had!
This is my Husband and I's favorite restaurant. We went here 3 years ago on our first date and it was the perfect place for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Thank you Past Brioni's!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria
column13: This was again a memorable dining experience at this location. The first time my wife and I dined here was on Valentines Day 2011 and it was good, but the steak was burnt a little. However, this time, the food was perfect. Even my wife was mightily impressed. The services was good too. We were seated less than 5 mins after we arrived although I had the good sense to make reservation. One of the managers even made time to come over and ask how the dining experience was, and left us with a $25 gift card. Overall, it was a great experience. Will definitely be going back.
Prompt service but entrees lukewarm when they arrived at table. Food was good, quantity suprisingly large.

column4: 5310 E. High St #101 City North Phoenix, AZ  85054
column13: Food was okay, sushi kind of generic. Waitress was always gone not checking on us. Took forever for drinks and to order.

This was my second time here and my friends first. The service and food are top notch; especially for a semi-chain. I normally do not like chains with the exception of some and this is one. Great place!

column4: 2201 E. Camelback Road, Suite 106-A Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: Great place to have an anniversary dinner. They had rose petals on the table when we arrived and brought dessert with candles. Service was excellent and the food was great.

Saturday evening sat in the bar area. The piano player was excellent and overall a very warm inviting dinner.Food was well prepared, steak was perfect as was the artichoke shrimp. Our Waiter Danny was well versed in the menu as well as suggesting excellent wine choices. The wine menu is awesome with plenty of variety and an amazing amount of by the glass choices.
The thanksgiving bread was amazing!!

A true seafood restaurant ... sushi ... chowders ... sour dough bread ... many kinds of fresh fish and seafood every day ... great service provided by cheerful and attentive servers ... a great place for dinner ... try it.

column1: Palo Verde at The Boulders Resort
column4: 34631 N. Tom Darlington Drive Carefree, AZ  85377
column13: My husband said his food was very good. He had salmon. I had the veal and it was very chewy. Manager did take 25% off my meal without prompting.Our waitress also seemed to disappear for long periods of time.We sat out on the patio which was lovely but the entire time we were there, the room service person was hauling trays back and forth to his delivery cart at the bottom of the stairs. Really destroyed the ambience. Don't they have a service area which would be better suited for this activity?

We expected this to be just another run-of-the-mill, resort-wannabe eatery. We were wrong. Our steaks were cooked perfectly (i.e., barely) and were delicious. The spicy shrimp appetizer (Borracho Shrimp, I think they call it) was outstanding; nice and zippy with great flavor. The wine list is rather too heavily Californian, but we found a tasty Washington-state Barbera at a reasonable price. Very good service, too: things happened in a timely fashion, but nobody hovered over us. We're adding PG to our regular rotation.
Our compliments to the chef! The menu for Arizona Restaurant Week was outstanding and literally a symphony of flavors.
This restaurant looks great. It's chic and casual and the food is fantastic. Our waitress was wonderfully attentive. The green tea cheescake is splendid.
We ordered lamb and sea bass. Both were delightful. We had a member of the group who could not eat onions, garlic or herbs. They handled it fantastically.
Always excellent food, good service, and an enjoyable atmosphere.

column1: Reds at Sedona Rouge Hotel & Spa
column13: The service was friendly, but spotty and the check was wrong. The food was mediocre. I had a vegetarian entree that was bland. My husband liked his shrimp dish, but complained that there weren't enough shrimp. It was so dark, I had to stand up under a light to read the menu and the live music was a little annoying. We won't be going back. There are far too many better choices in Sedona.

column4: 13220 N. Eagle Ridge Drive Fountain Hills, AZ  85268
column13: Alchemy's food is about Lunch. They excel at lunch - not so much at dinner. The menu is great and all items a super. The view is THE best!

column4: 3550 N. Central Ave Suite 120 Phoenix, AZ  85012
column13: One entree was far too salty, the other far too sweet. The server needs to be working at a McDonalds. Great if you are 70+ (most of the people there were), have no taste buds left, and don't care about atmosphere.

Waitress came with bread, that was nice considering my son's blood sugar was low. We informed her of that (thinking she would put our appetizer order in right away) Ordered Zuchinni for the app. She came back 10 minutes later with our beverages, and I finally got to order mine. The salads came out 15 minutes later, still no appetizer or my beverage. 15 minutes later I finally rec'd my beverage, and was NOT what I ordered. It was a martini, but clearly goose, and I asked for absolute. There is a BIG difference in taste. Anyhow, a total of 45 minutes and our main course came to the table....still.. no appetizer. Our waitress did not ask how our food was until she brought the check. Like she was kissin up for a tip. ** irritated.

column4: 5550 E Lincoln Dr. Paradise Valley, AZ  85253
column13: It was wonderful to be back at El chorro for the 1st time in ten years (1sttime back in Phoenix ). It met all expectations of wonderful ambience on the patio, as well as great food. We were super impressed when Tim,operating partner, stopped by our table to personally greet us and spent 6-7 minutes chatting about how he became involved in 2009 when the old owner wanted to sell and there was quite an interesting story. It is obvious he loves what he is doing and that is a benefit to all. Now for the food ...we were lucky to hit restaurant week and enjoyed the three course special ...I chose Caesar salad (the fresh shaved cheese was notable), Trout Almondine which came with two big pieces of trout and mexican chocolate pie - fabuous !!

column1: J&G Steakhouse Scottsdale at The Phoenician
column13: The food was very good; the service was inconsistent and not as good as expected.

column4: 7001 N. Scottsdale Rd Ste 147 Scottsdale, AZ  85253
column13: bartender VERY friendly & informative. He got my drink order and brought it to me as I waited for my colleagues to show. he then switched out with a server. the server was not very good. i had to be getting up and getting drinks at the bar because he was more busy doing other things, like chatting. he dictated where we sat and asked us to keep that order to make sure he knew who was ordering what. he wasn't very friendly and dropped our fried zucchini and had to place an additional order. i know people make mistakes but telling patrons what to do and where to sit is unacceptable. i won't say i'll never go there again...but I certainly would not recommend Nimbus to othdk

We enjoyed the bartender Justin at Jade. His personal attention was great and the Southwest bramble was a big hit with our wives. The martini's were excellent as well.The table we received was great not a window seat but a great view. The main course and wine went well together and the dessert celebrating both of our 39th anniversaries was complements of the house.We will return for a future special occasion clebration.

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu ___ Scottsdale
column13: Servers attentive and answered questions very thoroghly. Food prepared exactly as requested. Food was fantastic!!!

column1: Rawhide Steakhouse at Wild Horse Pass
column4: 5700 W North Loop Road Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: Eight senior ladies enjoyed dinner - food was elcellent, we enjoyed the music. Everyone from the hostess who helped me with reservation and subsequent moving it back a half hour to the gentlemen who greeted us at the gate to the shopkeepers were super friendly. I can't wait to go again.

Although the food was good, we will not return. Why...1-Valet parking required with no option to self park...don't mind paying but do not allow anyone to drive my vehicle 2-Server was down right rude.

column1: Rico's American Grill - Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak
column13: Service started out good then dropped off dramatically. We were abandoned for about half an hour. Food was on par for hotel. Nothing special or memorable. Best part was setting. It's a pretty place. I kept thinking I'd rather have breakfast there.

column1: The Flying V at Loews Ventana Canyon Resort
column13: Excelent food , service, and views.

column1: Signature Grill at the JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort & Spa
column4: 3800 W. Starr Pass Boulevard Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: It was our first time there and was suggested we go there to celebrate our anniversary. Loved the 5:30 tequila toast. Can't wait to go back and try an afternoon lunch. Definately will be back.
