When we first got there I was disappointed (but not overly surprised) that they had pulled out of offering the 2nd week of Restaurant week, but that was my mistake for making my reservations a week in advance. Parking was a pain, but I expected that so made sure to wear shoes comfortable for walking. The location was cozy.The service was okay, but unimpressive. I tend to judge service by how well my water is kept filled, and there were long stretches where everyone at my table had an empty water glass.The food was hit or miss, though portions were nice. I ordered the veal daily special and was unhappy to find it tasted mostly like (gas) grill. My husband ordered the Beef Wellington and it was excellent.

column1: Vineyard Rose at South Coast Winery
column13: We invited friends to dine with us. They just purchased a home from me about 10 minutes away in Wine Country. We all had a great dinner and service. It is a pleasure to spend time in your beautiful restaurant. We look forward to visiting during the holidays.Best Wishes,Tony D'Agnenica

Thank you Cohn Group for bringing this amazing restaurant to Escondido. It is our new favorite place for dinner or happy hour on the patio!!! The staff is fun, friendly, and efficient and the food and decor is wonderful!!!
Staff is always friendly and they aren't in a hurry to get you in and out!
Excellent special occasion restaurant.

column4: 729 W. Washington St. San Diego, CA  92103
column13: This is a great place for a romantic night out.
Sous and pastries to die for. Some of the best food I've ever had in CA. Can be a bit loud when busy.

column1: The Westgate Hotel - Sunday Brunch & Le Fontainebleau Room
column13: Visiting San Diego and wanted a nice brunch to take the better half to, found the brunch at the Fountainebleau Room in the Westgate recommended on a website and decided to try it out. Right from the welcome at the host area to the thank you for joining us it was outstanding, the service, the food, the ambiance and the music all combined to make it a special event for us.The server was professional, courteous and attentive.There was a great selection of foods well presented and in tasting size portions.Champagne and other drinks are included.It's a little pricey but I highly recommend this brunch.

column1: The Westgate Hotel - The Westgate Room
column13: While the food was great and the wait staff very pleasant, the service itself was lacking. We each finished our glasses of wine and was never asked if we wanted anything more to drink. When dessert came, we were never asked if we wanted coffee or tea. My wife asked for tea and I asked for a cappuccino. My wife got her tea but I never received the cappuccino. They aslo didn't check on us very often during the meal.
Everything was as it typically is, good but not awesome. This visit one guest had the burger and was not impressed at all.

column4: 143 S. Cedros Ave. Suite T Solana Beach, CA  92075
column13: Delicious food! Our party of four each enjoyed a different meal and all agreed it was delicious!Had tickets to the Belly Up next door and found it so very convenient, not extra parking and being able to go in the back entrance.Would highly recommend!

column4: 9550 Waples Street, Suite 115 San Diego, CA  92121
column13: The food was great. We did a wine tasting of 90+ point wines and they were all excellent. The service is always great here and this time was no exception.
The staff was very attentive to us...bar was packed when we got there but cleared out when we left from dinner (9:30). Food was excellent and wine was good.

column4: 711 Pacific Beach Dr. San Diego, CA  92109
column13: Food and service were good. Right on the Boardwalk; enjoyed watching the sun set in the west. Would go back again.
The restaurant was fair, the food was okay, the service was excellent, but the noise level was deafening and detracted from the whole experience. Don't go here of you want to talk or hear.
This is an excellent restaurant. As a result of this dinner, I have selected it as our pick for our Ethnic Out to Dinner GroupThe service was almost as good as the food and that was unbeatable.

column1: Adriatic Grill - Italian Cuisine & Wine Bar
column13: We have been to Adriatic Grill many times. We live in Seattle and we are willing to travel to Tacoma just to eat at this fabulous restaurant. The service has always been outstanding--we are greeted by name by the owners, Chef Bill and Monique. The bar is an easy place to sit and either enjoy appetizers, your meal, or just drinks. Our party of four had fresh steelhead, lasagna, a salad entree, and top sirloin. Lots of choices, and all were excellent. And the desserts are amazing. I've had several that I loved, but I always come back to Chef Bill's fabulous spumoni ice cream!

Based on the menu and reviews, we were excited to try this restaurant. However, the music in the restaurant was terribly loud and uncomfortable, and the food was not great and quite bland. Our kids liked their food, though. The table service was pretty good, but it took about 5 minutes for someone to notice us waiting for a table in the almost empty restaurant.
The food at Agave is very fresh and well presented; however, the flavors are bland and lacking authenticity. It is okay if you are not expecting Mexican or TexMex. The staff are great.

Before I get to the irritating start to our dinner, let me say that the food was OUTSTANDING. 3 pasta dishes with distinct and delicious flavors, and an engaging server. Great wine recommendation from the Maitre d'.
AMAZING! Cannot wait to visit Seattle again and dine here. The food was fresh and delicious! the service was attentive and friendly. I do not have one bad thing to say about Anchovies & Olives.
We had a wonderful meal before heading off to the theater. Best lemondrop I have ever tasted! They also offer free valet parking, which is a plus.
I canceled this through your Open Table site...I also called the restaurant. I have dined there many times in the past though. Thank you.
The place could use a bit of facelift!

Incredible experience - felt like we were celebrating our anniversary. Attention to detail from the moment we valet parked. We were greeted and went to the restaurant (women in heels use the elevator). The upbeat hostess and the maitre d' found us a nice table by the window (even after I accidentally asked for the patio forgetting it would be cold). Our server was first rate and made us feel like a guest in her home. Huckleberries are in season, so we tried the spinach salads and they were delicious. We had delicious manila clams and used the sourdough bread to enjoy the rich broth. Chargrilled, very fresh halibut and lingcod with fresh vegetables and rice, awesome. Huckleberry ice cream to seal the deal. Have fun and enjoy your visit.
The preparation of the salmon is the best in town!
Great experience, all around. One overwhelming memory is that it is expensive!!
Excellent find. Had a great business dinner. Quiet, great ambiance, attentive weight staff, excellent food.

column1: Art Restaurant & Lounge at the Four Seasons Seattle
column13: They made our anniversary very memorable- surprise champagne, beautiful table, and the servers were attentive, positive, and delightful. Two hours blew by in a hurry. The food was perfect, as was the whole experience.
Okay, not great, and a bit pricey.

My husband is a food snob, so he is not easily impressed. We love this place. The ambiance is lovely, but I took a star off because it was drafty in our section. They will provide you with a blanket, though!

Barrio is a great restaurant maybe the best that Heavy has. The food was great especially for the lactose intolerance. It is nice to ser a Mexican restaurant that servers Mexican style food. We will be back. One bad note the chairs.
We were there for Opera Night which is on the third Sunday each month.

Had lunch here the other day with our friends. The menu was small but everyone liked what they ordered. My wife had the spinach salad which was very good. I had one of the pasta dishes and it was very good as well. The wait staff were attentive and the location was easy to access. We chose it as a location midway between where we and our friends live so I don't know if I would go out of my way to visit but if I were in the area I would not hesitate to have a meal here.
Good food and service, but it can get a little noisy with the lunch crowd -- very busy place but fun!

We sat outside by the water (within ten feet!) and watched the boats and ducks on beautiful Lake Washington. The waiter was enthusiatic, courteous and very helpful. We loved the food and had a wonderul lunch.

We came to Bella Italia because of its association with "Twilight," but found it worthy in its own right. Ambiance was quiet and serene, service was friendly, and the food, delicious. Our daughter had mushroom ravioli -- of course! -- and I had the locally-caught salmon over rice (or was it risotto?) and a creative blend of several vegetables including beets, which I thought I didn't like but have now decided differently. My husband -- Italian himself -- had minestrone followed by lasagna and pronounced both very good. Daughter and I finished with gelato, she a chocolate/coffee flavor and I, Torrone, and we enjoyed them both with coffee served in generous cups. Overall, a delightful experience.

Happy Hour menu is reasonable and good for families with kids, but the cost of the entrees, otherwise, would be too expensive for kids. The salmon poke and beef skewer appetizers and scallop entree were delicious. The kids thought their sliders were just ok. The chocolate cake and bread pudding desserts were really good.

column4: 1507 Queen Anne Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
column13: Food was terrific, but the wines by the glass are all of modest quality and way overpriced given their quality. For example, a glass of Charles and Charles red goes for $9, when the entire bottle sells in my local grocery store for $10.99. I may not return due to this, as it seems that Betty is trying to overly profit off of its customers.
Comfort food, convenient nice neighborhood spot. Not elegant, not trying to be.
Absolutely wonderful! We'll be back...

There aren't many great restaurants in Tacoma, so I was really looking forward to eating at Bite. Overall I'd say they need to step it up a bit. While everything was OK, food, service, etc. there is room for improvement in almost every area. Floor staff was friendly, but knowledge was lacking. My drink arrived without a garnish, and when I asked for a lemon twist, I got a piece of lemon peel. Food was mostly good, but both clams and fish were overcooked.

We were there before the dinner crowd so it was nice and peaceful. Used the coupons for six people and it was a bargain to get all three courses and so much of it.I suspect though that a lower grade of steaks are used for the coupon deals. They were thinner and a little dry. However, they were cooked to order.
The service was good with lot of people helping us as our waitress seemed busy and she didn't come around much as other people had to tell her we wanted something. But we always got what we needed.
It was so easy to make the reservation from my home computer. When we arrived we were immediately seated. The service was prompt and courteous.

column4: 14724 E Indiana Ave Spokane Valley, WA  99216
column13: Eric, our waiter is always wonderful!
I enjoyed myself and would go again
We always enjoy BA. Consistently good food. Great Service. Excellent coupon offers.
Too loud for me. I had to nearly shout for my wife to hear me! Not a place to be bring a date for a romantic evening.
We were visiting Seattle and found this vegetarian restaurant on OpenTable. Wonderful food eaten on the patio on a hot August day.
Great restaurant!!! Loved the food, drink and Tom the bartender.
the best crab cake I have ever had!

column4: 7900 E. Greenlake Dr. N. Seattle, WA  98103
column13: Nice location & convenient parking for Greenlake. Staff were accommodating in allowing me to hold a window table while I waited for my party to arrive. Service a bit slow..took 3 requests to have water served to my dinner partner. Food was very good, wine selection pretty extensive for this kind of establishment. Very satisfied.
It's a fine venue for decent food and service.

My wife and I love coming here, the food is fresh, organic and local. The drinks are also amazing. The service is very good. We love going here because its a great price for the amazing food. Valet parking is free.
The service was very slow - we had to wait 10-15 min for water. The orders came out seperately with a 15min lag. I would not recommend. Boom Bellevue - go the Capitol Hill or the U-Village.
Consistently good. Fresh ingredients -- well prepared

We sit out doors on the veranda. Very helpful staff. Peaceful and relaxed atmosphere. Order off the 10minute $10 menu. THe Ham and swiss was excellant. The Southwestern saladas that my friends had were plentiful and provided a diversity of flavor. Serving staff were attentive and not intrusive. We were able to conduct the business we need to discuss. View of the parks around the base added an aesthicly pleasing backdrop. I would highly recommend it to my friends.
Wonderful Lamb and Silver Salmon!
Enjoyed the dinner very much.... Thank u

This is a fun place to dine. The kitchen seat is a hoot and all the staff participate to make it fun. The food is generous and we have never been disappointed with its quality and taste. Reservations are needed to get the only kitchen seat but usually booths are available in the bar (our favourite) The dining area is huge offering seating for groups or couples. The servers are friendly and take a special interest in you, the customer.
We loved:The portions, good for the eye,Food is very tasting,The veal was superb,The salad fresh,

Great food and service! I thought it would be expensive. Not only was the cost reasonable and well worth it, but then we were surprised with a military discount! Thank you. My wife and I came for our anniversary, we'll be back just for any weekend! Miguel and Allison

Cafe Juanita will exceed your expectations at every level. This is a perfect choice for a special occasion or intimate dinner with friends. The service is outstanding and the food is excellent. The Seared Foie Gras with Nectarine and the Beet with Gorgonzola salad were both amazing. The Braised Rabbit ranks up with the best meals I've ever enjoyed anywhere. Do yourself a favor and dine here.
It is a great location to see the view/sunset.The service and food are as mediocre as ever.Calcutta Grill needs a good chef and a manager that cares!!
Cal's was just o.k.

If you are looking for 1st class service, Canlis can't be beat. Everything is top notch from the moment you exit your car to the moment you leave. They make you feel like a superstar throughout your meal. And the food.... outstanding.

The staff at Capital Grille went way above and way beyond for our birthday celebration. If you want great bang for your buck this is the place to go. Seriously. The understand customer service and great food.

Caspian, secreted away in a nondescript office park, is a delicious experience in flavors and spices of the Middle East. The ambiance is casual yet classy. There is a small wine list and some very basic cocktails. Service is competent but casual; this is not the place to eat if you are in a hurry. Nor is it the place to eat if you like fancy salads. The complimentary salad served with dinner is so basic, it is a disappointment. Ignore it. The rest of the menu is the real reason to come here. Understand that there is nothing elaborately prepared. Yet the rice that comes with every meal has a unique flavor and texture, always perfect and fluffy. And the execution of the dishes, whether of smoked eggplant, perfectly grilled beef shish-ka-bob,
Love this restaurant. Noisy at times. the peppercorn new york is outstanding.
Love the World's Best Crabcake!!!
nice decor large menu great flavor but something is off. seems like production line food.
The food and service were amazing. At the top of our list in Bellevue. Great service. Can't wait to go back.
We went to Chutney's Bistro for a date night and it was a hit! The food was FANTASTIC! Thanks very much for a great evening.

The best Indian food out there, period. This place is absolutely perfect. The food, THE FOOD. It's fresh, it's delicious, it's perfectly cooked, it's PERFECT Indian food. I have explored this area top to bottom for good Indian and this place is light years ahead of any other restaurant around. The service is outstanding, the restaurant is spotless, the kitchen is in plain site and spotless. I have absolutely zero complaints. Not a single thing here needs to be improved. Even the price is a total bargain! GO. NOW.
Our first visit for our anniversary. We live in Idaho. Jumbo Prawn Scampi, Prime Rib, spinach salads and creme broulee. Good food and very nice waitress. Expected more ambiance, but overall pleased.

My husband and I went to Coho for our 10-year wedding anniversary. The food and the service was exceptional. Best caprese salad I've ever had in my life. Everything we ate was amazing. It was the perfect spot for our occasion.
The food was excellent though the menu for lunch is less extensive than it used to be.

I had the goat cheese ravioli which had some very limp, overcooked sun-dried tomatoes in the dish. It also was not particularly tasty.It's a beautiful space with Chihuly's personal collections (not glass) on display on the walls, ceiling, and under glass at all the tables.
Food excellent and beautifully presented. Service compliant with various dietary restrictions and tastes also excellent. Great for leisurely meal, not if you are in a hurry.

The food was pretty fantastic! Favorites were the foie gras, poutine, spare ribs, and cavatelli. The service didn't quite seem to match the food, swank atmosphere, or the prices, though. We all liked it well enough for the food to compensate.

column4: 15600 Northeast 8th Street Suite J-1 Bellevue, WA  98008
column13: I like the neighborhood feel of Crossroads Bar & Grill, located in Bellevue's Crossroad Mall. Our meals are always well prepared, and the service is done with a smile.

Three generations of Madonna fans came to eat a nice meal before the concert on a Wednesday early evening. Service was friendly and fairly fast; all cocktails were excellent. We ordered lots of apps and plates to share and everthing was excellent. Even my niece who wanted to eat at Red Robin thouroughly enjoyed all of it -- even the roasted garlic!(Crow/Robin - they're both birds!) We then saved room for dessert as they all sounded excellent. Got three to share among the 4 of us and we left satisfied and happy. Thanks for the nice dinner.
Located in an old house, it's a very quaint place for a date. Still trendy! It was a quiet night when we went. The seafood was packed with flavor and we had a great time!

We loved everything about this place! Great Italian wines, delicious food prepared with local, seasonal ingredients, and a wonderful, cozy atmosphere. Our waiter was friendly, knowledgable, and took the time to describe many of the wines in detail. We will definitely go back!
The wait staff was fabulous as was the food

The Daily Grill continues to be a consistently good restaurant with a variety of menu items at a range of price points. I took my bride here to celebrate our 2nd anniversary and had a very pleasant experience. The service and food are good. The area allows for a conversation with one's companions. Like most downtown restaurants, there can be a search for parking.
Loved everything about Daniel's.
It was a fair experience this time around, though coulde have been better.

We have dinner at Daniel's many times during the year. But we always take our last boat ride of the summer and have that dinner at Daniel's. Often the boat slip at the restaurant is open as it was this year. The staff usally is able to accomodate our request for a window table as they did again this year. So it was another successful evening.

Best Brunch Ever! I cannot begin to describe how wonderful the brunch at the Davenport was. The food variety was unbelievable. Every dish was quickly replenished and needless to say hot and fresh. We had reservations for 10:30, but they were able to seat us by 10:20. The room was beautifully set, and our server, Lucy, made the morning wonderful. Cannot wait to return!

column1: The Dining Room at Salish Lodge & Spa
column13: The food was exceptional. We had the steelhead and the duck--both fresh, superbly prepared and nicely presented. Deconstructed apple pie was a tasty dessert. Of course, the ambiance is great when you have a window table overlooking the top of Snoqualmie Falls, and with a delicious dinner, who could want more?

I have mixed emotions about Dockside Bistro as I've been there twice in two weeks with the first experience being terrific and the second a disaster. On my first visit t was a Monday night and it was only 20% full and on Friday it was very busy, but does not make our poor experience acceptable. I made reservations for 6:30 which we arrived onetime.Our server took our order within 10 minutes of our arrival as we had one person who needed to get home within a reasonable timeframe(2 hours). I had to ask where our main course was at 8:15 pm to ony get a bunch of excuses. Bass was way overcooked, scallops & chicken was excellent. Server was terrible & never addressed our terrible experience. Overall disappointing!

The seafood was not good. One party ordered Crab Mac which was inedible.Crab cakes were substituted but they were also sub-par. The fish tacos were tasteless, the house green salad house dressing was no good. All four personsin our party were very disappointed.I cannot recommend this eating establishment.

column4: 450 108th Avenue Northeast City Center Plaza Bellevue, WA  98004
column13: We went there for our 35th Anniversary, Louie was exceptional from beginning to end, we felt so special. Thanks.

El Gaucho has become an annual birthday destination and continues to exceed my expectations: from my first visit before relocating to the state 5 years ago to my annual birthday visit yesterday and several other occasions in between. The name recognition and warm greeting is a great opening, along with a tasty beverage from the bar. Then of course the table side Caesar Salad, the exceptionally tender and perfectly prepared steak (I always go for the filet) sides to compliment and topped with Bananas Foster because every special meal needs table side prepared flaming deserts! All topped off with a friendly wait staff, live pianist and unique dim but inviting atmosphere. Perfect!

- Yes, it is expensive, but it is also the best 2 and a half hours for my money.- The service is very good ... they are very attentive, knowledgeable, and compliant ... when asked to give us 15 minutes to enjoy our drinks before taking our food order, the server left us alone and then promptly returned 15 minutes later to take our order ... .- The ambiance is very nice ... especially with the piano player.- El Gaucho has a great wine list, I would guess they have at least 100 wines to choose from, prices ranging from $40 to $800 a bottle.- The food has always been very good and my meal is always prepared as I ordered.- I'd be hard pressed to name another restaurant that can prepare food better than El Gaucho.
DoHe, our server, made our meal a delight. She was so helpful with everything from food descriptions to directions back to our hotel.

column4: 1825 Queen Anne Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
column13: I've been here once for dinner so I was hoping we'd get a similar great experience for brunch. Not so. My friends ordered Eggs Benedict and they were....okay. Just okay. I ordered the farro fries and specifically asked for hollandaise on the side. My dish came lukewarm and with the hollandaise on top. It was one of the more expensive items on the menu and came with "foraged and wild mushrooms" - there was maybe a tablespoon of them total. The dish was tiny. I was completely underwhelmed. The waitress brought our check before we even finished our plates, and then never came back to pick it up. I had to go to the front desk. Kind of a let down experience and I don't plan on coming back for brunch. Hope dinner hasn't gone downhill too.

The last three meals I have eaten here were some of the best dinners I have had all year. Very good. We tried the four-course option this time. Every course was excellent. The portions were smaller with four courses, so that we could still have room and appetite for the wonderful caramel panna cotta.
The service was wonderful and food was amazing! The Cider House whiskey drink is now 1 of my favorites!
Good food; well served; helps train people who need work for positions in restaurant industry. It not only tastes good but feels good to eat at Fare Start!
Excellent service and food, a great place to go for a meal before or after attending shows at the village theatre.
Great food accompanied by quiet environment and good customer service. Food was good but a bit too pricey for regular dining.

Dated interior. Main screen volume is extremely loud. Service was not good. Took ten minutes for a server to come to our table after we were seated. We were on the verge of walking out when he came to our table. He did a good job after he took our order, but not a great job. Seemed like when we came in, all of the servers were on a smoke break at the same time. Food was good, but don't expect a spectacular meal. There are better options within walking distance of this restaurant.
Nice atmosphere and great food.

The restaurant is beautiful & in a great location, & we were wanting a quiet, relaxed dinner. Unfortunately, the food & service were both disappointing. I couldn't even give it a 5 star for ambiance because the choice in music was terrible - electric guitars that were jarring & unsettling. It has romantic potential ... but poor service, poor food & poor background music all combine to kill that aspect of it. Maybe lunch and a burger would be a good choice.

Our first dinner at this restaurant. The waiter was knowledgeable and very helpful because the menu was confusing with one of the largest selections I have seen. Add to that, all the Indian dishes, the casual diner needs help. Service was fast and the taste was exceptional. All four in our party agreed that this was a place to re-visit. Prices were moderate.

Thoroughly enjoyed the tasty items on the 5-Course Dinner. The Dungeness Crab Bisque was scrumptious as was the Wild King Salmon with thinly sliced white peaches. The food presentation immediately enticed your senses and prepared you for the marvelous flavorsof the dishes. Service was very attentive but unobtrusive. Definitely want to go back plus they serve breakfast and lunch as well.

This is one of Puget Sound's gems. Gianfranco makes a trip to Snoqualmie worth the drive, even from the Kitsap Peninsula! The food is excellent, and the service is so cheerful, friendly and attentive, without being overly-so. Just right! The wine list is great, with many Italian and local wines to choose from, and a nice range of prices. It's a small place, so be sure to get your reservations. This was our second visit there. We plan dinner there whenever we have an event that brings us out that way, but I would go to Snoqualmie just to eat at Gianfranco's.

column4: 21 Bellwether Way Suite A Bellingham, WA  98225
column13: Good food, the waiter was very attentive and reported to us often. But the kitchen-food-was very slow to come out. We loved the flavors, seafood, pasta and the Tiramisu was to die for...

Golden Beetle consistently exceeds my expectations for gorgeous food, lovely customer service and an overall fantastic dining experience. The flavors are top notch and interesting to boot. Brunch was especially delicious with a great price point.

column4: 23207 Bothell - Everett Hwy SE Bothell, WA  98021
column13: It was a pleasant night out. The ambiance was great. I probably wouldn't go back, as there are many other restaurants I want to try, except for everyone I know raves about it. I'll give it another chance as it's close to home.

This Grazie location was fine - the food was good and the staff were pleasant. THat being said, the it doesn't hold a candle to the Grazie location in Canyon Park, which is PHENOMENAL. They make their own pasta in house every day (Southcenter does not) and they are a large and inviting restaurant while Southcenter is very compact. I also found the service speed in Southcenter to be quite slow, and we definitely weren't in a hurry, so that means they were really slow. Overall fine if you're in the south end, but if you can make the trip to Canyon Park, that Grazie will blow your mind!

column4: 7200 E Greenlake Dr. N Seattle, WA  98115
column13: Chef must have run out of holandaise sauce for the eggs benedict? (usually fine)Receptionist charming, very hospitable, sweet!
The food, service and fantastic view made this a wonderful experience. We were able to forget the outside world and enjoy food, conversation and surroundings. This really is a gem!
The food was terrible, no flavor, and meats not cooked to the right temperature.

column1: Hoist House Restaurant at Swiftwater Cellars
column4: 301 Rope Rider Drive Cle Elum, WA  98922
column13: We arrived early so we sat outside around a fire pit and enjoyed the view. We moved in side for dinner which was excellent some may have considered the salmon undercooked but my companion loved it. Some may have thought the three inch thick pork chop was over cooked but it was just the way I like it. The salads were fresh. The wine was, of course, Swiftwater Cellars. We'll be back. Service was good but our waiter was covering a lot of tables.

As far as restaurants in hotels go, this is a superior choice. Nice selection of well prepared food. Had the Salmon (what else in Seattle) and it was grilled perfectly. Bargain priced three course meal for $30. Wonderful clam chowder with chunks of oven backed small potatoes and big pieces of bacon. Don't miss it.

column4: 2208 Queen Ann Ave N Seattle, WA  98109
column13: Try the beet salad, the best I've ever had! Fabulous selection, love the family style sharing. Great wine list!
The service was excellent. The food was tasty but the menu was quite limited for brunch.

This was a very nice dining experience! The staff were all welcoming and gracious. Our server Rafael, was there at the right times, but didn't hover. My party enjoyed all the dishes we tried, including the unusal combo of chicken and waffles. :) We went to the Hunt Club because of a Groupon special, but will return because of the variety of offerings, and the relaxing atmosphere.

column1: I Love Sushi on Lake Bellevue
column13: The $36 Miso Black Cod was 2 pieces 1/4" think by about 3.5" wide, it was dry and nothing like the silky buttery texture of black cod. The $15 Wagyu was tough and thinly cut, more like pieces of jerky. The Shashimi salad was good but the dressing was lacking. The Tempura meal was greasy & the coating wasn't the lightest I've had at a good Japanese restaurant. The Sukiyaki was okay & too sweet by the end & was lacking in noodles, mostly just meat & the celery like (dakon?) vegetable. Not impressive as a good Japanese restaurant. I guess best to stick to the namesake food of just sushi...

column1: I Love Sushi on Lake Union
column13: not as good as it use to be. Service is always good but the food, though better than most is not as good as Bellevue location. Sashimi pieces and rolls cut way too thick to comfortably eat as one piece. Sashimi was unevenly cut as well. Not sure why they don't catch that.
Icon is such a gem. The food seemed a bit off the night we visited. It wasn't as delicious as it usually is. We will continue to go back though.
Il Bistro was amazing! I reserved their romance package which includes rose petals on the table and champagne,, which was a definite hit with my wife! The whole ambiance of the restaurant was great.
We celebrated our 40th anniversary at Il Fornaio and it was delicious food, lovely setting, excellent service and we enjoyed our evening out.

The food was just OK. We ordered a special pasta and a pasta entre from their regular menu. The ambience was good but service was mediocre. Price was high for the overall experience, so I will not be going there again. There are certainly better choices for food in Seattle.

I have been to Indochine before and really liked the place. The food was good as always but the service was quite poor. I felt terrible that a different waiter (perhaps a bus boy) had to go find our actual waiter. Our food came out in two rounds (though it look as if it had all been made at the same time...) thus some of us were left eating while others looked onward with hunger. Overall good food, but service needs to be addressed. At least the waiter could have apologized for our food being late and ignoring us for most of the evening!

column4: 4301 S Meridian Ste A Puyallup, WA  98374
column13: It was my boyfriend's first time visiting a Japanese steakhouse, and we both had a blast! Food was great as usual and our chef was amazing! We'll definitely be going again!

It has been about 30 years since I was in western Washington state, so about that long since I had a really good bowl of clam chowder. Ivar's more than fulfilled my expectations, and reminded me what chowder can be when the clams are fresh, and the chowder is made in the kitchen. The crabcake sliders were incredible as well. The view to the ferry dock may not be the most stunning, but it was cool to watch one come in and unload. The view across the Sound, however... watching the boats and birds in front of the hills on the other side... That was beautiful. We also had the fun and privilege to see some dolphins/porpoises (I couldn't see them well enough to tell which) go cavorting by, and a seal later swam through as well. A wonderful meal!
Food was excellent. We had an appetizer of scallops that were so delicious.
Would appreciate if an Asian portion is selectable. We wasted lots of food because of no choice!

Jacobi's is now a standard in Walla Walla. It is good. We had the butternut squash ravioli (good but a little sweet) and the mushroom purse pasta (very yummy, very rich). Sitting outside in the evening is the best. It was noisy inside.

We had a couple clients with us, so we were waffling on how to proceed with our order. We were all considering sashimi, and rather than make us figure out something on our own, our server recommended that she just bring a sample platter with enough for all four of us. We were took her up on it, and were glad to get something coming to the table right away while we continued to look at the menu. The sashimi at Japonessa is always mouthwateringly tender and fresh, you can tell the chefs really know their stuff. I highly recommend this place, but it gets busy as soon as they open at 11:30am, so you should make reservations.
Great place with good food and service
I had a veggie burger. It didn't have much flavor, worst than any other veggie burger I ever had.
One of my favorite places in seattle for a special occasion, whether a group or a certain someone.

column1: Kingfisher Restaurant and Wine Bar at Sleeping Lady
column13: Very speedy for the experience. Decent food. A bit disappointed there was not a more knowledgeable wait staff regarding wine pairings. Not worth the $160 for two, to eat buffet style.

column4: 900 Bellevue Way NE, Suite 100 Bellevue, WA  98004
column13: The restaurant was strangely empty for 7:00 on a Friday night. My cocktail and food were excellent, but the service - from the hostess to the busser and the waitress - was amazingly amateurish. My server recommended a couple of menu items as excellent, then listed several that were "pretty good" and some that were "just OK." (!) No-one asked if I wanted fresh-ground pepper on my Caesar salad until I was almost finished with it ("Sorry, I forgot!") and I was never offered a refill on my empty cocktail. Both my salad fork (on the plate) and dinner fork (clean, on the table) were taken away with my salad plate and not replaced until I asked. Some front-of-house training from someone with four-star restaurant experience is needed!
I brought East Coast friends to La Bete to flaunt what Seattle is all about, and did my friends get flaunted! In your face, East Coast.

column4: 17535 Ballinger Way NE Lake Forest Park, WA  98155
column13: Everything was perfect...out hostess made great recommendationsand made sure we were constantly taken care of.....although she was extremely busy. Our only complaint was due to the fact that she was so very busy .....we had to leave without our left overs of penne pasta in a peanut sauce
Food was not good, place was very small, they didn't have my reservation, they forgot to bring us 1 of the meal, music was too load
Food was great. Mango Margarita a big hit.

Pretty mediocre.I really wanted to like this place when I walked in. The decor is beautiful. The view is awesome, but the food and service were hit or miss. To start with, there was no host to greet us. I had to go find the bartender to get seated. After that, it was unclear who our waiter was. With french peasant food, a chef should be able to completely nail it every time, but they didn't. My trout was overcooked and unsalted, the salad was over dressed, etc.

Had Sunday Brunch here and really enjoyed it. The food was heardy and simple. The waiters professional and attentive. Overall it was a great experience. If there wasn't so much to do in Seattle, we'd have sat there for hours. We'll be back.

column1: Little Boston Bistro - The Point Casino
column13: One of the nicer places to eat in North Kitsap
As always, our entire family enjoyed getting together for a superb meal that offers great food and ambiance for all ages, toddler to adult.
I was only visiting the city and the restaurant was recommended by a local. Good food and good service. Will certainly go again!

Great food but poor service. Servers didn't seem to like their job and we felt like we were bothering our waitress by being there, she would rather just gab with her friend in the corner instead of wait on customers. Very disappointed with the service considering the food was quite good. It was bad enough not to go back.
Food was mediocre and very overpriced. Things look good on the menu but it is poor quality and tiny portion. Wouldn't go back.
Food was fantastic & the service was great!
A lovely meal, as always! The staff is one of the best in the city and the food is consistently great. Our favorite restaurant in Spikane for very good reasons!

column1: Ma_Ê_ono Fried Chicken & Whisky 'formerly Spring Hill'
column13: "Cheeto" was our server for a group of 4 ans he was absolutely friendly, helpful and attentive. It was the first day of their bottomless brunch and we were neither hurried, left with an empty glass at any time. The french toast and chicken nuggets with incredibly delicious and perfectly balanced. Can't wait to go again and try the other mouthwatering items for brunch. Finally! A place that does bottomless mimosa brunch AND food right!

For a large, production type restaurant it's really quite good. The red wine that is specially bottled for Maggiano's is very nice. The quantity of food is amazing - and we had classic pastas to take home as well.

My wife and I decided to try the Majestic as are still relatively new tithe Everett area and were looking for a nice bu not over the top priced place for our monthly night out. I must say that the Majestic truly held up its name. Our server Andrew was fantastic, the non rush policy was just what we wanted, and the food was amazing. All in all definitely a place we will be frequenting again soon.

It was one of those rare warm and sunny days in October, and we sat outside for a lovely lunch. The food was great...they had a special 2 course menu for $13.00. Everything was perfect, and we both enjoyed our meals...plus we managed to make room to split the Pana Cotta for dessert. I especially appreciated the wonderful service!
We ate a mushroom, shrimp, and corn dish from the daily menu. It was outstanding, one of the best dishes I have tasted in a long time. The service was very attentive.

column4: 11111 NE 8th Street Level Two Bellevue, WA  98004
column13: Great place for lunch but a bit noisy there should be something they can do about the acoustics very difficult to carry on a conversation.

column4: 100 N. Hayford Rd Airway Heights, WA  99001
column13: We had a wonderful time. Our servers, Cory and BJ were fantasic and made my daugthers birthday dinner very special.

An excellent restaurant for a special occasion, business lunch, or happy hour with friends. Matt's features a wide variety of unique and classic menu options. Their special seafood chowder is delicious every time and the flatbread plates are a surprising treat. The vibrant bar mixes up some excellent drinks while sporting events play on TVs. Of course most people are enjoying good company or watching flames rise from the grill as chefs prepare tasty dishes. A meal here doesn't come cheap, but for great food, service, and energy, they make it worth every penny.

We went for their anniversary dinner and since it was a special price, I wondered about the menu. No worries. Everything sounded appealing.The foie with foie gras, the rabbit and duck dishes we finally selected were classically well prepared, as was the dessert. My only complaint with the latter was a heavy-handedness with canned whipped cream.

Thai cuisine used to be my favorite. Now May Thai cuisine is. May raised it to a new level. On top of that: great staff. Our waiter was fantastic, helpful and enthusiastic. No wonder the place was packed!
Food was very good. And nice daily special options.

I always love going to McCormick & Schmitck's especially for special occasions. It is a great place for lunch (especially when there is a group going) and the service is very good). If we are on time constraints, we let the waiter/waitress know and they try to make sure everything is done as quickly as possible but with the same service and quality of food that I've always received here.
McCormick has been around as long as I can remember. I have had many lunches and dinners there over the years and have never had anything but excellent food and service.

driving by you wouldn't expect the extraordinary level of service and food Melrose delivers on a consistent basis. The meat is exemplary and all the desserts are made on premises. Note about the dessert: they are not oversweetened.

It seems the restaurant has lost its class - and has become a family oriented dinner place. I was going for a romantic anniversary and instead we were surrounded by kids and crying babies. It used to be the place was so expensive that you could leave your own kids at home for a nice adult dinner. But now we left the kids at home just to be surrounded by other peoples kids. The food quality has dropped and its more like going to Outback now.
great food. great experience. kinda pricey.

We have been going to this location for years. It is still good BUT I notice that they have cut portions yet again. Value is increasingly a problem, and at some point we will stop going. We spent $250 for two, including cocktails and a bottle of wine, but even after requesting extra veggies did not leave the table stuffed. The meat portions are about half of what I remember them to be.
great food, great service, but it is too loud compared to their competition.
This was one of the most personalized, incredibly delicious and special dining experience!

Excellent food and wonderful service! We went for my husband's birthday and the restaurant even treated him with a full size dessert on the house. We would definately return to this restaurant and recommend to our friends!

Stellar food, wine list and amazing value for the quality. This was my 2nd time at the restaurant and this time took a group of 5 others with me and some from out of town, as I had previously had an all around great experience

When I was there the kitchen was having trouble with their fan so the whole restaurant was really smoky. It also looked like the host or hostess was out because there was a sign that said 'seat yourself' as we walked in. We had to wait a while 10 min. or so before getting menus or water. The food was good, not great. I think it might have just been a difficult night for the restaraunt.
I am Italian and very picky, the food was ok but not that special I expected for the price.

For the price we were expecting great food and we weren't disappointed but you should expect small portion sizes (1 small crab cake for $20, $30 for 1 king crab leg). The service was a little underwhelming for somewhere of Morton's caliber. As we were early for our reservation the hostess asked us to wait in the bar (no problem! :-)) but they subsequently forgot about us. The food service was also on the slower side.
We held a lunch meeting at the Nordstrom Grill. Our food was delicious and the leisurely service were perfect for the occasion.
I really like this place. So glad they finally got on Oopen Table.
Food was good and the service was exceptional.
Love the place - right in the heart of Capital Hill. The food was delicious and the service was very good. I would recommend for both larger parties and smaller intimate dinners.
Excellent food and service. The starter menu could have a greater selection,and the wine selection is a little pricey. Otherwise great place to have dinner. Will go again in the near future.

column1: Palm Court Grill at The Davenport Hotel
column4: 10 S Post Street, Suite B Spokane, WA  99201
column13: This was a wonderful place for a special occasion celebration. The atmosphere was elegant without being stuffy. It was kid-friendly for our 11 year old, but it may not be the best place for active little ones. The servers were very attentive but we never felt rushed, and the menu had something to offer everyone. Several at our table chose from the 'early-bird' selections -- salad, entree, and dessert -- and portion sizes were perfect in that even with the addition of a shared appetizer we still had "room" to enjoy dessert. We definitely plan on returning, perhaps for a Sunday brunch. Would love to see the place decorated at holiday time!

The waiter was helpful when we were selecting a bottle of wine. The ambiance was simple but comfortable. The food selection was great and both of our meals where delicious. Don't pass up the Tiramisu.

The focus is on a parade of food prepared by people who know what they're doing. Sit back and anticipate the next great dish. Don't go here if you are looking for elegance. I will be going back soon, and taking friends, for a first rate casual meal that will leave everyone smiling. I love this place.
Great food. Calamari comes with a unique spicy sambal cream sauce that is perfect for the deep-fried calamari. Filet mignon is prepared right and the sablefish is yummy.

column4: 605 Queen Anne Ave North Seattle, WA  98109
column13: Always one of the best restaurants in Seattle. Took out of town customer and he loved it!

Delicious food. incredible flavors if you like this type of food. I try to eat there as often as possible. The eggplant dip was perfect as well as the other food. Never disappointed.Go there if you like this kind of food. Small, intimate and authentic. We got extra Baklava to go - home made and also fabulous.
Wide selection of good Northern & Southers Italian style dishes.Good selection of wines by the glass including wineries from Washington.

The food was very tasty but the restaurant was not what I expected. We were planning a nice date night but this place is better suited for a lunch spot. It is definitely more of a bistro/cafe than a restaurant. The service was good, but it was much too quiet for me.
Great food, beautiful deck - and they do a very nice job of accommodating gluten-free eaters.

I love Pinxto - my favorite place in Belltown. Great tapas and cocktails, pleasant service, and cool vibe. And there is a small heated outdoor patio if you want to sit outside. I will return again and again.

Great authentic italian pizza and fare. Home made bread available that is amazing and fresh. Imported tomatos and olive oil makes for extra special touches and flavors.Waitress was sophisticated and friendly.

My husband and I have been going to this restaurant for years, and we just love it. The waiters are very attentive, the menu is interesting (has food we don't usually eat)and the food is extremely well-prepared. And you cannot beat the view, especially the way Elliott Bay looks while the sun goes down and the ferries have lights on after the sun goes down. A wonderful, romantic little restaurant.

Kids from a private party kept going in and out of a patio door next to our table even aster the photo shoot outside. Very annoying and distracting. Open door let in the cool air in and chilled over our meals. Waiter made some attempt to tell party parents that their kids need to be more considerate. Parents were clueless. Need to mark door this time of year as emergency exit only.
We had a wonderful dining experience. I had noted in my reservation that we celebrating a birthday and the staff had prepared. What a great place to dine!!
A Flavorful Delight

We were a group of six meeting for a book club. Our waiter was wonderful (and a reader) and spent just enough time chatting and was spot on with the service, he was an entertaining addition to our evening. Our food was,as usual, very good.
Lovely view, decent service but the food is nothing to write home about. It is not really up to the quality level it needs to be for the prices they charge

Prelude is a great place to eat prior to seeing a show at McCaw Hall, having the ability to dine at the venue makes scheduling a dinner and show so easy. I would also recommend eating there even if you're not attending an event.

It is difficult to evaluate PK now that they've combined forces with the Bothell Ale House. My reservations for Sunday brunch were made at the PK website, but we were seated in the Ale House portion which was much too noisy for conversation and a leisurely brunch. Fortunately, we were able to move to an outside table which made for a pleasant experience.

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Bellevue
column13: Great Salad....never disappointed

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Kirkland
column13: I was looking for a particular Malbec, which unfortunately this Purple Cafe didn't have. But the bartender, without me knowing, went to his manager and suddenly came back with two recommendations! The 2010 Catena Malbec is the bomb by the way, as are the gorgonzola stuffed dates and the salted caramels!!

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Seattle
column13: Food was very good, but on the pricey side. Ordered their famous Lobster Mac and cheese and baked Brie. Would order both again without hesitation. Also ordered their special Scallops. Granted the scallops were very big (3 of them), but the lemon vinaigrette was a little off and the dish was not worth $28. 2 people, 1 app, 2 entrê©es, tax & tip with no drinks came out to $88 for lunch and left still hungry. That's why I said it was pricey. We went to 4 other restaurants and didn't spend nearly as much for dinner.

column1: Purple Cafe and Wine Bar - Woodinville
column4: 14459 Woodinville Redmond Road NE Woodinville, WA  98072
column13: The only complaint I have is that my shoestring fries were cold. I normally send this kind of thing back as I really want my fries hot but it was my birthday and I was in too good a mood.

The food at Ravish is OK but unremarkable. The wine list is poor and the better selections on the wine list were not available at the time of ordering. The waiter attempted to confidently offer me a "good" substitute to my first selection of wine but given that he was describing a WA wine as a CA wine, it was clear he had no idea about what he was talking about. I eventually selected a bottle of wine that was the best available on the list and it was (as I knew it would be) just mediocre. I was charged for the more expensive bottle I originally ordered but didn't notice this until the next day when I had to complete an expense report for the business related meal. So I was accidentally charged $20 more than I should have been.
It was great!! Had out of town guests and they were very impressed.

We had a gift card from a raffle with the Bushwick Bookclub.We were very excited for the prize and had a very nice time at you restaurant.It was my sweetie's bday and the cocktails were a great treat.It was also nice to see zeppoles on the dessert menu as we are from NY and have not found them anywhere here in Seattle.
Great sushi and soups.. We loved the whole experience. Chef was great, he was fast when we asked for anything at the bar.Thank you.

This was our second visit to Red House, and we like it. Red House has a nice menu offering a variety of unique dishes. We had the Paella and Lasagna and were happy with both. What we really like is they have a great beer selection to go with this great food. Usually we are left with great food and no good beer choices or great beer with only bar level food, so this is alone moves Red House up on our go to restaurants.
Most everything we ordered was good and the prices were reasonable by lower Queen Anne standards. We'll definitely be back.
While the food was good, the service was slow and the restuarant was not busy. WE had both dinner and breakfast there.

Restaurant Bea is a charming spot for weekend brunch, and it's quite surprising that more people haven't taken notice. Bea can be noisy with a full house at night, but otherwise, the sound and energy are perfect for lazy weekend mornings. Crabcakes Benedict and the frittata are consistent winners...
We were there a couple of weeks ago and enjoyed out lunches very much. However, they changed the two for one to 20% off the entire bill. It's a nice place and we would return.
Ricardo's was amazing, truly delicious food and a fabulous staff. It was the perfect place to relax and enjoy a beautiful evening with my husband.

The service was a bit slow to actually take our initial order after telling us the specials, but was decent afterward. The food to us was good but not great or particularly creative in any way with not large nor small portions.

We came for a business lunch and it shows well for Seattle in the downtown core. Not particularly creative and a bit loud for a business lunch, but it was fine. Better for meeting friends given the energy. Food was good but not outstanding.
Great place for dinner before a play at the 5th Ave.
Wow! We enjoyed ourselves very much. Celebrating a birthday with our daughter - memorable food and service...I will be back!

column4: 20109 Aurora Ave N Suite 101 Shoreline, WA  98133
column13: They had the best miso soup I have had hands down. Beyond that the batter they use on tempura shrimp was unique and delicious and they had a great selection of Japanese beers, which you don't often see, even in Japanese restaurants.
Classic experience we've come to expect from Ruth's. A loyal fan for decades! Thank you!

After eating at Ruth's Chris Steakhouses on the East Coast, this was a dinner we looked forward to while in the Seattle area. It didn't disappoint. Steaks were wonderful and cooked exactly to everyone's liking. Wine selection by the bottle and by the glass was great. Server was knowledgeable and helpful.
Quite nice. Very good and authentic Italian food. If just two are dining ask to sit at the two seat area overlooking the chefs.

column1: Safari Room Fresh Grill and Bar
column4: 111 South Post Street Ste. E Spokane, WA  99201
column13: Took the team out for lunch. Food was not special, but not bad either. Service was outstanding.

column4: 28201 Redondo Beach Drive South Des Moines, WA  98198
column13: I love a great brunch especially one with lots of seafood. The sun was out and it was beautiful
Music too loud.For a supposedly fine dining experience, Salty's should get rid of TV's. It is not a Pub or Tavern.Food was O.K but nothing special for the prices charged.

The food is always fantastic, the presentation is great, the services is consistently great as well. I eat at Sazerac for work 3-4 times a week and they are amazing. Consistent great food and service.
Disappointed with the food. It wasn't horrible, but it wasn't good.

column4: 22341 Marine View Dr. S. Des Moines, WA  98198
column13: I thought the food was great! Sarah the Sous chef did a really great job presenting the food which also had alot of flavor. Nice place,and a good selection of food. I like the cheese selections. It's perfect place for drinks and appetizers after a long week at work. They have healthy choices and its not your typical greasy bar food. I would defiantly feel good about bringing friends and family.
food was good, service always good. we live in the neighborhood so we like to go often.
service was good; food was good in general - the spearfish special had a good combination of textures, but the flavor was not so special. a bit on the pricy side especially for lunch...

Serafina couldn't have been more perfect for a romantic dinner. Although the restaurant was fairly small and all the tables were taken, they were spaced in a way that gave you the intimacy you wanted. The food was great and the wine and appitizer were ready upon arrival as i requested on open table. Great experience. cant wait to go back
The place for Oysters. Great oyster selection and helpful staff.

We made a reservation and took our guests from out of town to Sip on a Friday evening. We all appreciated the extensive wine list. Each of of us found a small plate or entree we relished. Although the noise level was high, we were able to converse reasonably well. Our waiter was knowledgeable and efficient. All of these elements combined to provide a very pleasant dining experience.

Breakfast was good, staff was friendly and helpful.Dinner choices were poor, food was overdone and meager. Waitstaff was not helpful. Table was in middle of walkway to outside, resulting in disruptions of space and comfort. Waitress was rude when approached about situation and unhelpful. Did not return for dinners as result and went elsewhere. View was wonderful.

column1: SkyCity Restaurant at the Space Needle
column13: Our dining experience was delectable, enjoyed by all and would definitely create a return trip for brunch.

I've been to Tsillan Cellars in the past, and fell in love with it. I really looked forward to trying out their new restaurant. The weekend after the 4th (notably busy for Chelan), I took 10 of my friends out there from Seattle. This was definitely the highlight of my trip! The patio seating was large, but they still managed to keep their intimate ambiance. I hoped to do a tasting before our reservation, and called before to ask how early we should get there. They suggested we give ourselves at least a half hour before dinner. Unfortunately, it was difficult getting 11 people coordinated and on time, so we only got there with 5 minutes to spare. The manager was very understanding, and let us do a tasting, even though it was very busy!

This is the third time I have had the pleasure of dining at South. The restaurant is capable of handling any size group with advance notice. We have always been sitted fast and the food is worth the trip. The waiters have all been great and accommodating.

The food was great, the atmosphere is wonderful. The only down side to our experience was an overly chatty waiter who made it difficult to enjoy our evening out. I definitely prefer their Bellevue site over the Redmond site. Bellevue Spazzo has a view, better food, and more professional wait staff.

column1: Spencer_Ê_s for Steak and Chops _Ê_ DoubleTree by Hilton Spokane City Center
column4: 322 N Spokane Falls Ct Spokane, WA  99201
column13: First time attendance. Servicer Derrick was very knowledgable, answered questions, and made helpful suggestions on food choices. All at the table were satified. Food and service was outstanding.

column4: Hilton Seattle Airport 17620 International Boulevard Seattle, WA  98188
column13: Ambiance and food great. One of my favorite places to dine. Barbara

column4: 4909 Rainier Ave S Suite 102 Seattle, WA  98118
column13: Hire some staff. This is our 3rd and last try always poor service - what a shame.

We are foodies and were looking to have an excellent dining experience while visiting Seattle. Spur hit the mark! We visited with moderate expectations and left extremely happy. The artichoke salad and pork belly sliders kicked off our meal and both were excellent, the sliders getting the "this would be an appetizer on my last meal of my life dining list" award. The sweetbreads were perfectly paired with corn fritters and were delicious. The pork cheeks were cooked to perfection and packed with flavor. The next evening we visited Crush, on the Seattle's best list, and our meal at Spur definitely topped it! Fantastic food with excellent service!

column4: 401 NE Northgate Way Ste. 1106 Seattle, WA  98125
column13: Food was good and ambiance is just perfect for our purpose that day, a working lunch.
Usually has great steaks at moderate prices. A little disappointed with the Special this time, but still highly recommend this place.
Service was great, she was very attentative. food was great, it was my boyfriend's birthday dinner. For dessert he got a crembrule and we both loved it!
Excellent service. The food was great. Perfect salad. Wish the menu had a little more diversity. My husband's steak was cooked to perfection. My pasta was tasty.

column1: The Steak House at Silver Reef HOTEL - CASINO - SPA
column13: Loved the food. wished we had ordered old school caesar salad- a rare treat to have it prepared at the table these days

A friend sent me to the Steelhead Diner in the middle of the Public Market. Very active area. We went there on a mission to have a quick bite. Ended up with fish and chips. Needless to say, the fish was really, really, really fresh!!! What do you expect for being in the middle of the market! Yes, we will go back there in a heart beat!

column4: 403 Madison Ave N Suite 150 Bainbridge, WA  98110
column13: Pretty space, nice service, interesting menu.......and rather unremarkable food. Nothing stood out, some of the sushi was just OK, the agadashi tofu was totally boring (one of my favorites!) They took good care of us and we had two squirmy kids along, but I would not go back for the sushi. The kids loved their bento boxes and the teriyaki and tonkatsu was good.
WE celebrated our wedding anniversary here and the staff made it a special evening. Food and service was great.
Truly amazing experience, from the views, to the service, to the great food...this was really one of those experiences I will remember for years to come!
We ordered the seven course tasting menu with sake pairing and were blown away by the food and service. Great job!
Overwhelmed by the needs of a large group, we were very much an afterthought for our server.
Great lighting. Not too bright or dark. Great food and wonderful customer service. Our needs were always taken care of, such as more napkins without having to ask.

This is a great choice for dinner before a show at the paramount theatre. the parking arrangement with a nearby hotel, of only $4.00, means one can enjoy tapa's and then a show. The food is good and the variety of tapa's makes the meal fun.
Nice location, but noisy, food was just ok, service was fine. Good enough place for a beer and burger, but not somewhere you take customers and hope to be able to talk.

Lots of beer and an interesting menu = recipe for success. I tried the bacon wrapped jalapenos stuffed with cream cheese, the pulled pork sliders, and the poblano burger. All were very good. And, the prices were reasonable.My only disappointment was that they ran out of Franziskeiner Weissbeer and another one I wanted.Tap House is located in the basement of a building. It is interestingly decorated and well kept.Overall, a very good place.

column4: 3720 Factoria Blvd SE Suite C Bellevue, WA  98006
column13: Food was quite good. They have lots of options for vegetarians that aren't just rice and beans. The vegetarian combination was tasty. Service was good too. We will come back the next time we are in the area. Thank you.

I took a retiring co-worker to lunch. She chose Taste because she'd not been there before. She is somewhat particular and very much a healthy eater- and she was impressed! It was an excellent way to celebrate her next step in life.
Was a great evening...food, service wine...all fabulous....
Awesome food and great atmosphere; wonderful service. We had the roast pig and risotto -- amazing!

First time at Terracotta Red, most assuredly won't be our last. Food was amazing. We had a great time. The server was wonderful and the place was very clean and modern. Can't wait to bring my husband and daughter back for a special night!

The food was very well prepared here. We longed for patio seating as it was a beautiful night. The only downside was the service was incredibly slow. One of the members of our party received their dish considerably later than the others. Our server did essentially no checking to see if we had everything we needed. Luckily, we were not in a hurry. If the service had been better I would have rated this establishment higher.

This was our second time to That's Amore. We were seated in the back and had a fabulous view of downtown Seattle. The food is very good, very authentic Italian food. There are a few downsides to this restaurant; they have been out of a few wines, the service is a bit lackluster, and the portions are small. We will continue coming here though, it is so easy to get to, the parking is always good, and good italian food isn't easy to come by in Seattle.
Excellent meal and great service. Waiter very knowledgeable and provided suggestions that were perfect. Will definitely be going back
I immediately felt rushed by our server on a night that was special for us...we wanted to take our time and enjoy each minute.

column4: 601 Queen Anne Avenue N. Seattle, WA  98109
column13: Our reservations were for 7:15, but they didn't have a table for us until 7:50. Had we been in a real hurry, that would have been awful. The Madonna concert was that evening, and it was packed.
The food was just amazing! I loved the soup, best corn soup ever. The flat iron steak was seared to perfection and I cleaned my plate, even the vegetables.
Good food, nice staff, consistent quality. Will dine again

column1: Tulalip Bay at Tulalip Resort Casino
column13: Everything was wonderful as usual!
Too noisy but the food was terrific

It was lovely, food excellent, waiter very nice however he was the only one on and it was a bit busy which caused some slow service just at the beginning. Had to go get my own high chair as they kept forgetting. I had included that in my reservation as well. Other than that minor frustration, it was a lovely experience.

column1: Twigs Bistro and Martini Bar - Kennewick
column4: 1321 N. Columbia Center Blvd Kennewick, WA  98336
column13: We keep coming back. One of the best restaurants in the Tri-Cities.

Went there for my hubby's birthday on Saturday...neither of had been to Umi in over a year so it was a real treat and excellent as usual! The Moonraker, the sauteed mushrooms, scallops, and other rolls were outstanding. Love that place!!
The staff has obviously been well-trained. We had great service all night long. Cody & Logan were especially terrific.

Too little wine for the price (got a minature glass that cost like $8) although they have an impressive list. I felt like I could have gotten the same food someplace else for cheaper (because I have). Ambiance was good. Make sure you get reservations. It is busy there. Parking is a nightmare.

The food was decent but nothing to write home about. Our brunch reservation was for right when they opened at 10am. They were "out" of the dish that I had been waiting for all week. How does that happen? They don't have S&P on the table so the waitress did the hand pepper grinder. I told her I like a lot of pepper - she did 3 grinds and promptly walked off. I had to call her back for more. Another waitress walked by my empty water glass a number of times but was filling other people glasses. WT? Didn't get the discount for living in the building even tho we told the waitress we lived there. It might just be for coffee tho - not sure so I'll give them a break on that one. Will probably return, but won't be expecting much.

The Vine made our stay at Cameo Heights perfect in just about every way. The wonderful dinners set off a great weekend. Outstanding food, prepared expertly, and presented in a way in keeping with the homey feel of the small dining room. Penny, the chef, coupled a sense of adventure with a knowledge of what her customers will savor. Being able to watch her do her magic in the kitchen was an added benefit. We were fortunate enough to sit by the window on a night with a full moon bathing the countryside. The view, spectacular any time, came alive, rendering an unneeded assist to the great food. Meat done to perfect with sauces that added, not overpowered and vegetables done perfectly. A great experience.
Great food. Beautiful decor but less than stellar service. Would recommend

column4: 800 N 10th Place Suite E Renton, WA  98057
column13: This place is a real find and I hesitate to let you know - I do enjoy it so and would hate for it to become overcrowded and overtaxed. We go there for the food and the atmosphere - tapas and appetizers are all great - haven't been disappointed yet. Don't come here if you are in a hurry (unless you are willing to ask for unusually fast service). Really good food isn't fast food, ya know.

We had a Groupon coupon for Vino Ristorante and were a little concerned after reading some reviews but thought for the price we'd give it a whirl. We had reservations and we were late (I had to go back home for the Groupon). Nonetheless we were seated immediately. The restaurant is a converted house so it's broken into several small rooms. The room we were in had five tables I think, one large one that seated six or eight and several small two-person tables. We were seated by the bay window, I thought the best seat in the room. Service was great. The food was served hot and was simple but very good. The wait staff was very attentive but not intrusive. The prices are moderate It was a great evening.

I recently asked noted local Chef and General Manager of "Wine World" Lenny Rede what his favorite Greek restaurants were. "Vios" was one of the two he immediately recommended. The chef-owner Tomas has been part of the Seattle food scene for years andwas the long time proprietor of "El Greco" on Broadway in the Capitol Hill neighborhood.If you are a lover of Greek cuisine "Vios" should be at the top of your list of must-visit restaurants, as well.They have an extensive menu with something for everyone. Each dish is expertly prepared and presented. The plates are the best version of any Greek food you have everpreviously eaten.

Very great atmosphere from the time we walked in. Waitress was very good at her job. Everything was just perfect and all employees was very energetic. Food was great and would recommend Visconte's to everyone.
Excellent food and a wonderful wine list.
Volterra was awesome! My fiance and I enjoyed our brunch immensely and can't wait to go back!
Waitress was not friendly. Good was excellent.
Best restaurant in Olympia. Spent two years in Seattle basically trying all the well-reviewed restaurants there, and this place is right up there in terms of food and ambiance.

column4: 55 West Cherry Street Walla Walla, WA  99362
column13: Not much open in Walla Walla on Monday night, especially after 7:30. That said, we had a wonderful meal at the bar at Whitehouse Crawford. Service can make such a difference, and server at bar was pretty perfect. Recommended great wine, as well as several appetizers that were excellent. Tenderloin was not quite as special as the rest, but still very good. Great ambiance, and really glad we tried the restaurant.

The food was very good, and the service from the sommelier was excellent. There were 2 drawbacks to the meal and the evening: the wicker chairs look cool, but they are too low for the tables; the food, while excellent, was intricate to eat, which meant it took time. Unfortunately, all the dishes we ordered came out to the table at the same time, so some of them had cooled by the time we got to them. If they had come out one by one, or 2 at a time, it would have been extraordinary. My partner mentioned this to the manager at the front when we left, so this may have been taken care of already.

The prices are very high for the amount of food that you get. My friend got scallops, there were about 10 and the price was $17.50. $1.75 per scallop is a bit much. The time it takes to get food is crazy-it always takes a long time the past 5 times I have dined here. If you are in a hurry for your lunch break don't go here.

column4: 18001 Bothell Everett Hwy SE Ste 103 Bothell, WA  98012
column13: A real find in the Bothell - Canyon Park - Bear Creek area. We have eaten here several times and never had a bad meal. Food prices are reasonable for the quality, and there is a nice wine list, not overwhelmingly large but with nice selections and a number of local wines. We'll be back, for sure.
Went to brunch--excellent food!
The whole, experience was first rate, excellent service, food,and atmosphere.

Love the cornbread to start. Always get me ready. The rest of the food was great, drinks reasonable, and our waitress was very attentive for her first day on the job. Z'tejas may be a chain, but they act like an independent owned restaurant.
Loved the Fish and Chips. Fresh and then breaded with homemade breading. Our waiter Mike was gracious and saw to it our needs were taken care of quickly and with no problem.

column1: Formaggio Taverna & Patio - Sacramento Marriott Rancho Cordova
column4: 11211 Point East Drive Rancho Cordova, CA  95742
column13: excellent Prime Rib Special
A good place for Brazilian dishes. Good wine.

Nice energy with a guitarist playing, loud enough to enhance the dining experience, but not too loud to interfere with conversations. The food was excellent. I had the skirt steak and my friend had salmon; both came with au gratin potatoes and sauteed spinach, which were delicious. Our server was very attentive and excellent with wine recommendations. Overall, a great dining experience...we'll be back!
food was great service and your servers a plus to your business they were very friendly and fun I would recommend to others

Per our request for a table close to the ocean they seated us at a fabulous table. The service was very good. The Grand Wailea next door has a luau until 8PM-our reservation was at 7:30 and you could hear the drums from the luau for a half hour. Kind of interferes with the restaurant's music. We had the bolognese, good sauce, too heavy pasta tho. all wines are Italian and while we are familiar with 2 or 3 types (other than Chianti) we didn't want to go with something that we didn't know and pay too little-so we paid $120 for a bottle which after it breathed a bit, was pretty good. We told the waitress we like bold reds like a good simi cab. she said our choice was, but in truth it was very lite. great place tho!

Rumfire was able to accommodate our party of 15 with no problem. Fun drink menu using island favorites. View is fantastic. The menu is versatile, with plenty of options. I look forward to returning for a special occasion meal.

We have been to Ambience a number of times and have always had agood experience , with exceptional service... Having said that , themenu has regrettably become tired and predictable. If you've neverbeen, then by all means go and enjoy but you won't need to go againbecause the menu will be the same or a basic variation on the sameingredients. Here's hoping chef Song has some new inspiration....I for one would welcome the change..... and let me say that this is NOT a bad review, the food is very good,It's just always the same.

Very overpriced as far as local restaurants go. Food needs to be refilled a luttle bit quicker. Variety should include shellfish at the price for the buffett. Also the added 20% gratuity tip was automatically added even tho we only had two people came as a shock. Softdrinks charged separately on a different bill was strange.

column4: 3211 Providence Drive Cuddy Hall Anchorage, AK  99508
column13: Lucy's is a fine dining restaurant that supports the UAA Culinary program. Since the food is cooked by students there is a potential for the food to be "hit or miss", though I have experienced more hits than misses.I think it is a wonderful thing they are doing for the students and recommend that all my friends go check it out at least twice.

Kelly was our server....she's awesome!! Very attentive & personable. Don & Chris---managers are great. They always come over to say hello & check on how our meals are! Great restaurant with great staff!!
The food, service, servers were all outstanding! Best place iv eaten in a very long time! Definetly going back!
Love coming to Cattle Company! It's the best bang for your buck and the staff is always welcoming.
Lovely restaurant tucked away in a little strip mall, perfect service, awesome food, restful ambiance.

Our group went to Banyan Tree and we all had 4 course tasting menu. I love it that the restaurant has a chef recommended tasting menu, but they also allow you to change it up and come up with your own tasting menu. The view from the restaurant is wonderful if you go around sunset. There were 4 people on our table and we all got either chef/modified tasting menu. Every course was delicious and their menu is large enough to go back again and try different things. The service and food were both great and we all enjoyed our dinner at Banyan Tree. We will go back when we are in Maui again.

this is a great place altogether, but especially the quallity of the food, it is hard to find food this good in sacramento. It's not the family friendly atmosphere of Old Spagetti Factory but they accomated our kids and their picky tastes.

We were very disappointed in our experience at Bidwell Street Bistro. We were not allowed to use our gift card on any of the pre fixe menu items and had to order off the main menu. The wine we choose wasn't available so we were offered a much more expensive wine. We were seated in a side room of the restaurant with no ambiance at all. The food was just so so. The servers were fine. Could have had a better meal elsewhere.
The food and service was excellent.Mahalo!

We were at Blue Dragon for the great entertainment - John Keawe this evening. It was an evening of light rain so the staff worked very heard to try to make the show work. We were seated under an overhang and had a nice meal. John was great for as long as he could play but they finally called the night an early rain-out.
