Sean the Manager was wonderful and attentive. It was a special occasion for my husband and I, and the staff was great! Food was marvelous as always! I would always recommend Silver to anyone visiting Park City (without children). It is a relaxed but vibrant adult dining experience.
Too expensive; not a good value for money.
Great experience! Our appetizers came promptly and then had a very long wait (30 minutes) for our main entrees. Our server was very friendly and kind.

column4: 2832 East 6200 South Salt Lake City, UT  84121
column13: Great place underneath the big trees in the heart of holladay. The food is really amazing, can't go wrong and if you don't like something, the staff will fix it. Huge wine list including regions of Italy and France. A great place for special occasions or just to dine.

column4: 12234 S. Draper Gate Dr. Draper, UT  84020
column13: As always with our trip to our favorite restaurant we had a wonderful time. Our guests thoroughly enjoyed themselves and we loved our outdoor seating. The food was amazing and the service is always top notch (thanks Jose!). I had the Maui Onion soup (superb!) and the lamb shank, which was cooked to perfection. All meals looked wonderful. The only complaint came from my wife when she was told that they had run out of both chocolate deserts. Other than that...a perfect evening and I HIGHLY recommend this as one of Utah's best restaurants.

column4: 481 E. South Temple Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: This was my first time there with my wife. The food is new and wonderful, and at the same time they have some wonderful comfort food. The portions are very good and we had a wonderful evening and sampled some of their specialty cocktails. Service was... okay our server was very pleasant indeed, but was forgetful and not very attentive.If you go, try the "chile corn chowder" it was by far the best soup I have had in a very long time. It was something very different and yet not so out there that it could not appeal to just about anyone. Warning... it does have some kick to it but nothing to extreme.

Jasoh "Prime" (more formal dining area) provided particularly excellent service with Dustin (very attentive & professional service) & good food. Food was well presented & tasty - entrees of fish special (interesting white chocolate sauce) & Lamb very good. Limited Appetisers though (salads look good) - crab cakes average & calamari although tender nothing special. Not a fan of desserts being shown as prefer menu - reminiscent of dessert trolley which cheapens it a bit for us. Wine list offering not extensive but reasonable options. Ambiance excellent; seated with a good view over the street. If looking for a more "casual" formal dining experience or for a special occasion this is the place in Ogden - it's not stuffy & recommend dining here.

column4: 3551 North Escala Court Park City, UT  84098
column13: Being a long-time Hyatt customer, I had high expectations for our first-time dining experience. We were mildly disappointed. I ordered the rib eye steak and found it to be only average. For the price I was surprised that it came with only a side of cold slaw. My wife's pasta, however, was quite good. We ordered coffee & were shocked at the $4.00/cup price. In summary, the resraurant is new but has several improvements to make before I would return.

column4: 545 West 700 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Just a great place. We have never been disappointed when dining here. We took our daughter for her 21st birthday! Our server was knowledgeable and helped her select her margarita.
Servers were especially knowledgable, helpful, and friendly!

column1: Kimi's Mountainside Bistro at Solitude Mountain Resort
column4: 12000 Big Cottonwood Canyon Road Solitude, UT  84121
column13: Very impressive brunch and the fall colors were fantastic.

column4: 9565 Wasatch Blvd / Little Cottonwood Canyon Sandy, UT  84092
column13: This is a wonderful setting for a special occasion. Be sure to stroll the grounds to enjoy a beautiful surrounding before or after your dining experience. The food and service were excellent. Everyone at this restaurant made you feel extraordinary. The reservation process was very easy and accommodating. Highly recommended.

column4: 748 W. Heritage Park Blvd Layton, UT  84041
column13: After having reservations much in advance I was expecting a decent table. The hostess attempted seating my date and I at the worst table in the establishment. At my request we were given a better table. The service was slow. We were seated at 7:15 and did not receive any food until almost 8:30. The drinks were fine but the food was very bland considering the price.
The summer garden is just wonderful - plenty of space between tables and a quiet and peaceful setting. House made potato chips to die for! Hamachi in crispy won tons really fine.

column4: Hilton Salt Lake City 255 S. West Temple Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: The atmosphere was great as was the service---my NY steak was excellent.

column4: 6451 E Millcreek Canyon Salt Lake City, UT  84109
column13: Not as good as usual. The server was good but service was slow especially given the fact that there was hardly anyone there (it was a Tuesday night). The halibut entree which is normally excellent was bland and the ravioli was tough.

This was my first time at Madelines, and although the food was above average the ambience was very "Sizzler-esque". The service was fine also. Not sure I'd go back again, since it's a rather long drive for me.

Going to Tsunami hurts my wallet but it feeds my soul. We visit this location every couple of weeks and have done so for about 3 years now. Food is great, service is great, restaurant is clean and fresh. My one and only complaint is that they still don't greet me by name. You'd figure after regularly visiting one place for so long they'd figure it out. How many times have you swiped my card?

column4: 134 West Pierpont Ave Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: The food was excellent but a little pricy. I tried it because of a groupon and that helped a little. I would go again. Go for a special occasion.

column4: 2985 East Cottonwood Pkwy. Cottonwood Heights, UT  84121
column13: A little pricey, but we've never had a bad meal here!!

column1: Market Street Oyster Bar - South Jordan
column4: 10702 South Riverfront Parkway South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: My guests, one who is a waitress in a high end seafood resturtant in So Cal, and I enjoyed a great evening admiring sunset on the Wasatch mountains from the patio. We couldn't decide on single entrees so we ordered several items fom the appetizer menu and were treated to a wider variety of delicious foods. The food was all fresh and expertly prepared. Our waitress was very accommodating and kept the items nicely spaced apart and our drinks filled. We all felt we were well taken care of and had a very enjoyable evening.

column4: 60 West Market Street Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: As always, the food was excellent. We all enjoyed the food, from Steak to Veal to Halibut!
Outdoor dining that isn't right on the street or sidewalk. You can hear the live music from the street, good food, good service.
The food was fantastic and the presentation fabulous.

column4: 18 West Market St. Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: John, our server, very gracious and wonderful service. Enjoyed the agedashi tofu, tempura, and sashimi very much. The noodle bowl was fair, a bit overcooked, and broth needed more seasoning; Disappointed the Asian greens were simply broccoli and a few small bits if bok choy. The sushi rolls were good but a bit bland.
one of our favorite restaurants in Park City! in the top 3 for sure!

Riverhorse was ok. I was expecting better. My husband got the halibut which was great but the Ribeye was well done and we asked for medium. I was a terrible cut of meat and not worth the price we paid. The potato wedges were dry and I couldn't find much spinach in the creamed spinach. I don't think we will make it back!

column1: The Glitretind Restaurant at Stein Eriksen Lodge
column13: This is one of my favorite places to take my wife or the family for a special occasion. The chef always varies the menu by season and is creating new combinations that are truly unique. The setting at one of the best resorts in the country is hard to beat. The service from the valet to the staff is exceptional.

column4: 10722 South Riverfront Parkway South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: This restaurant has quickly become our favorite sushi spot. My wife hated sushi until we ate here. Now I can't get her to stop coming here. There are many unique rolls and I have never had one I didn't like. The DTH is my wife's favorite. The aloha is my favorite. A must try for any sushi connoisseur and a great place to start for any sushi amateur.

column4: 165 S West Temple Bldg #1 Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: We couldn't understand a word our waiter said to us. They would not honor the special that was advertised on the street, after seating us they told us that if we wanted the special we would have to move and eat downstairs. Our waiter was super confusing when we asked her if we could order sushi and have a hot meal. After saying it was my birthday dinner they did nothing "special" for my birthday as other restaurants using would.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Salt Lake City
column4: 20 South 400 West Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Excellent food and service! Always a great place for a good steak, nice atmosphere with stellar service!

column1: Buca di Beppo - Salt Lake City
column4: 202 West 300 South Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: EXCELLENT SERVICE BY OUR WAITRESS!!!!!!!!!!!!

column4: 191 South Rio Grande Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: Ordered off the special menu that ZTejas changes every season. The food was very good-looked to nice to eat, it was flavorful and delicious. We also ordered the shrimp tostada appetizer. I love this particular appetizer but it was better than ever this time around. The shrimp weren't just cooked as normal, instead the shrimp were grilled and this gave the dish a totally different taste. The restaurant seemed to be understaffed when we arrived so the staff on duty were quite busy. However, management was helping out and all employees worked as a team making our experience quite pleasant. We were tended to in a quicker fashion than some establishments we've been to that have been overstaffed.

Little backstory: I have been working out with my fabulous trainer for 2 years now. She's helped me lose 125 lbs thus far (no pills, tricks or gimmicks) She has become one of my best friends. To thank her I wanted to take her out for a nice dinner on our "anniversary". I've never been to Shabu but she had and she chose it. I wanted to make it a little more special by having a gift and flowers waiting on the table when we got there. Not only were they so helpful and willing to arrange that, but they also gave us their VIP table at no additional charge! The server was knowledgable and helpful and the food divine! It being a Sunday in mid September, we were the only ones there ALL night! It was like I bought out the place! Ha! Wonderful night!

column4: 1812 E. Red Cliffs Dr. Saint George, UT  84790
column13: The wait staff is still a little green but make up for their mistakes with profuse apologies and lots of smiles. It's a Buca Di Beppo! Big food. Big tables. Lots of energy. Probably quiet after 9pm if you are looking for a more private dinner setting. Great place to go with a group of friends or family.

column4: 2223 South Highland Dr #E3 Salt Lake City, UT  84106
column13: Never a disappointment. always and steadily excellent food preparation

column4: 111 E Broadway Suite 170 Salt Lake City, UT  84111
column13: Eclectic menu containing foods I have never eaten before. The menu highlights highlights ingredients from local farmers. Great place for a romantic dinner and to celebrate a special occasion. We celebrated my husband's new job and then went to the Broadway for a movie. Great ambiance and good service.

Food cooked perfectly. Steak flavor (steak frites) not very good. Service a bit slow at times. Very courteous and friendly staff. Would recommend to a friend, but would suggest the chicken dinner instead of steak frites.

column4: 11516 South District Drive Suite 500 South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: We really enjoyed our meal at The Wild Rose. The food was excellent in both preparation and presentation. The atmosphere was so pleasant and relaxing and the service was all that you could ask for. We would definitely enjoy visiting again.
Great food - especially if you like elk and venison. Their salad is always the best in town!

column4: 10702 South Riverfront Parkway South Jordan, UT  84095
column13: we were seated and greeted promptly, but that is where the flow of service went downhill. We asked for bread on not less than six occasions, each of which was acknowledged by our server. Bread never came. One of the meals, and omelette was not delivered until the testify the table had finished eating. A manager never came by to acknowledge the delay or apologize. The food was good, but not great. There are better places to go than here.

column4: 54 Market Street Salt Lake City, UT  84101
column13: I was seated immediately upon arrival and the waitress was very friendly, service was above my expectations, very awesome "Fresh Fish". I had the Orange Roughy and would highly recommend this dish to fish lovers. The Oysters on the half shell and Clam Chowder were delicious. I will return again and bring family and friends the next time I'm in Salt Lake City. Hopefully real soon. Ski season is rapidly approaching. Ready to hit the trails...
Excellent in every way. Will definitely go back

column4: 6405 South 3000 East Salt Lake City, UT  84121
column13: The food wasn't that great. Not a lot of flavor!! Disappointed......

column1: Ruby River Steakhouse - Salt Lake City
column4: 435 S 700 E Salt Lake City, UT  84102-2805
column13: They easily accommodated a group of 11. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The wine list was short but had a couple good choices. The value was outstanding. The prime rib was good, but not great, but the sourdough bread, the creamed spinach and the garlic mashed potatoes were excellent.

column4: 151 South 500 East Salt Lake City, UT  84102
column13: Staff went above and beyond! The soda dispensor was not working and they went to the store to get our table diet coke! Great customer service.
Wonderful executive roll and great ribs and cod.

David our Server was fantastic. Our steaks were perfect, but our sides of spaetzle and potato gratin were lacking flavor. The piano music created a perfect ambiance for our anniversary. We would recommend this restaurant to all our friends and family.

I went there for my anniversary and it was wonderful. The food was great quality for a reasonable price. The service was outstanding with a friendly demeanor. They were rather knowledgeable about the menu because I had not heard of half of the entrees before. The menu doesn't seem that long but everything on it I wanted. We were seated immediately and all of our food was out rather quickly. The staff was on there A-game and I have nothing bad to say. I will definitely be going back before too long.
Great food, good atmosphere, great staff.
Excellent service, food, and wine. I think it's great if you want to experiece tasty fun food with a romantic atmosphere, or with a group of friends. I would definitely go here again.

Fork was amazing! Exactly what my husband and I were looking for. The food was excellent, the drinks were inventive and delicious, and the service was terrific. All in all, we had a wonderful time and will be sure to visit Fork on all future trips to Boise. We have already recommended it to all our friends!
Food was good except the fish tha halibut I had and the salmon that my husband had seemd dry and over cooked.

This was our least favorite restaurants on our recent trip to Boise. My husband had the meat and cheese appetizer plate and found some of the meat tough and the presentation was poor, my son had the prime rib which he enjoyed and I had the chicken Caesar salad (which for $15.00 consisted romaine lettuce whole leaves and a piece of chicken plopped on top. I had to do a lot of cutting it up to eat it and it wasn_ã_t very tasty. Service was poor _ã_ we had to continually ask for things, which at a place such as this is unacceptable. We had made reservations through Open Table and for a week after our visit Open Table indicated we were _ã–no shows_ãù according to the restaurant It took a week to straighten that out even after contacting the manager.
Fantastic as always. We are long time fans. The food is exactly how it should be...hats off to the incredible chef! Outstanding beer selection too.

I thought I was booking a reservation for Bacon. We were initially disappointed that there was no reservation at Bacon and no seating. We were pleasantly surprised and happy to enjoy the brunch at Berryhills, and it didn't really cost any more than we would have spent at Bacon.
Had a delicious dinner, great service...Great evening.
Chandlers is our favorite restaurant in Boise/Meridian.
This is a great restaurant for lunch for personal or business use. They have a sushi bar and a great selection of salads and sandwiches.
Great food and wonderful selection. I would like to see a bit more noise canceling suppression as it does get quite noisy at times.

The food was surprisingly very good. Our server did provide good service. The atmosphere was more like a coffee shop then that of an expensive steakhouse. For special occasions you want a little more pizazz in the design and furnishings. There was no music only silence.

Carnivores rule here! My wife, son, and I dined here last week during a visit to Boise, and we were not disappointed. We had, respectively, beer chicken (excellent), filet mignon, and prime rib (plus a gooey dessert). The sides were nothing special, but the meat was tender and cooked to our order. Also, there was a decent wine list with many reasonable choices. Our server was professional and the owner took the trouble to go to each table and spend a few minutes with everyone. Though it's unlikey that we will return to Idaho, we can recommend this restaurant to those who enjoy their protein medium rare.

The restaurant is in a beautiful, old 8th Street building which gives is a great feeling and atmosphere right away. We loved the spinach/artichoke dip we ordered for an appetizer. Had 4 different main dishes and everyone thought they were all very good. The sweet potato enchiladas were the most unique.

When we arrived, only 5 mins late I had to seek out the host who was on the phone and did not look up to acknowledge us. About 5 mins passed and he told us our table was almost ready. We were seated at 7:30. Another group came in who apparently knew the host and were cheerfully greeted and offered beverages. The service was good, the food good (altho the salads were very average), but not as remarkable as I remember. Quite noisy and crowded. I did get to eat lamb for the Trailing of the Sheep festival. Bottom line I would go back with lower expectations - there are so many fabulous places to eat in SV, the KG may go to the bottom of the rotation.

Their rolls were seasoned with rye, fennel, and rosemary. A little seasoning is good, but they put way to much herb which left a bad taste in my mouth. There was no soft music, just an erie silence which made conversation awkward because others dining around you heard your conversation. Their drinks were good. Their portions are small. Their chocolate mountain dessert was gross. The server was really great. We spent $95 and I walked away hungry. We won't be returning, unless for drinks. My dining partner said his bison flank steak was good, but the mashed potatoes needed flavor or gravy.

I booked a reservation for me and my wife's wedding anniversary. During the reservation process, I put in the comments that it was our wedding anniversary. Upon arrival, we were seated at a table next to a big window overlooking Whitefish lake. After the gal sat us at our table, she turned to my wife and said "happy anniversary". I thought this was an extremely nice touch, that I didn't even ask for. Through the course of the night, 4 other restaurant employees, including the busboy said "happy anniversary". It was a small thing for the staff to mention, however it made my wife feel very special. Not to mention that the food was excellent, most importantly the huckleberry cheesecake! We will definitely be returning to the boat club!
Wonderful timeExcellent mixologistoutstanding dinner serviceIf we return to the Big Sky area we will return and we will recommend Rainbow Ranch to our friends as it was recommended to us.

This was our second time at the RB. My duck was quite good as was the octo and king crab salad. My wife's halibut was prepared well but the pot roast like gravy and the old potatoes left her looking for something less bland. Lastly, we thought a little dessert would take some of the disappointment away but it took over 20 minutes to get it. We like the RB and they have great food but this night didn't meet our expectations.

column4: 434 W. San Francisco Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Superb service! Very good food. My wife had scallops that were, in her description, absolutely delicious. I had ribeye, which was slightly overcooked, but such a good cut of meat that it could be overlooked. However, my server did not overlook it and offered, without any comment from me, to replace it. We were far enough from the piano bar to not be overwhelmed by that, and the background music added to a very enjoyable meal.

Since we were here last, Terra has changed its name to "Terra Bistro Italiano," reflecting a change to an Italian menu. We dined on a Wednesday night and found the food still very good, selecting a nice bruschetta Caprese for starters and the manzo (pot roast)and chicken picatta fettucine for our entrees, both of which were quite tasty. The wine list is decent, and they have beefed up the Italian offerings since the change-over (not yet on the website, however), so we were able to enjoy a good Chianti Classico. The only problem we encountered was slow service. Mid-week they seem to be operating with a skeleton crew-- there was only one waiter and an assistant, but with just 5 or 6 tables occupied, service seemed unnecessarily desultory.
Great food and service. Very happy with our lunch..lovely atmosphere.

column4: 132 West Water Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: My husband and I had dinner at Coyote Cafe on Saturday night. This was our third visit and the evening was wonderful. The service was very good and the food was outstanding.It was a great way to top off our wonderful visit to Santa Fe. We look forward to our next trip there.Gail

column4: 48 North Angel Fire Road P.O. Box 1648 Angel Fire, NM  87710
column13: By far the best restaurant in Angel Fire if not the entire area.

column4: 428 Agua Fria St. Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: As always, our dining experience was fabulous. Our server, Jaime, was attentive and professional. Azur has become our favorite dining spot in Santa Fe, especially with their prix fixe menu being so reasonable.

column4: 142 W. Palace Ave Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: We were there on a Friday evening, around 7:30. The dining room was lovely--quiet and romantic, and the food was innovative (creamy polenta, kale, and duck with raspberry sauce, with chocolate truffle stuffed pepper dipped in white chocolate for desert)and delicious!The wait staff was very professional and took very good care of us.
POOR SERVICE! Good food.
Excellent service. Good food: ordered beef and lamb gyro, plentiful serving, great seasoning and the cucumber dressing was excellent

column4: Hilton Santa Fe/Buffalo Thunder Resort 20 Buffalo Thunder Trail Santa Fe, NM  87506
column13: We recently dined in your restaurant to celebrate my son's 30th birthday. We loved the outdoor patio and the food and service were great. Thanks for a great experience. If I have any complaints it's that my chicken was dry, but all other orders (i.e., salmon and steaks, as well as the shrimp cocktails) were great. We especially loved the cheese tray -- very nice presentation.

We celebrated our 11th wedding anniversary, everything went smoothly and food was superb. We both had manhattans (great bartender) Caesar salad and the filets with bê©arnaise, excellent! They surprised us with a chocolate layer cake for dessert for our 11th wedding anniversary!

column4: 544 B Agua Fria Unit B Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: We liked both dishes we ordered, the lamb vindaloo and the chicken spinach dish. Both were generous portions and tasty. We just wish they had taken a bit o time to serve us. WE got our naan and raita and both dishes all at once and VERY FAST. Would have enjoyed a few minutes to enjoy our wine before the meal. But the restaurant was quite empty on the night we were there, so maybe that's why our food showed up in minutes!

column4: 288 Prairie Star Rd Santa Ana Pueblo, NM  87004
column13: We took out of town friends there because after a week of visiting all of New Mexico's beautiful sites they were a little tired of Mexican food. Prairie Star didn't disappoint. The food was excellent and presented beautifully. Not one of us was disappointed with our choices. And walking outside into the quiet beauty of the sky at night was a treat! Our guests noted it was the best meal that had had during their stay. I must confess it had been a few years since my husband and I had visited Prairie Star but I know we'll be going back soon.

column4: 839 Paseo De Peralta Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: The mole Poblano is home made and very tasty. The salsa was fresh and not too spicy. The waiter was attentive and friendly. He recommended the chicken bomb as a customer favorite....I can't believe it is a favorite, it was terrible. Fried ball of chicken stuffed with mystery ingredient smothered in a white sauce. It was a bomb, but not the good kind. There are plenty of other items worth having, like the flan. Order two because you will not want to share.

Tomme is one of a small number of really interesting and innovative restaurants currently happening in Santa Fe. Owner 'Max' Renteria and chef Joseph Wrede have joined forces to provide wonderful food in an intimate setting. Each dish we've experienced in two visits now has been outstanding, an original take on a familiar theme. The menu changes daily, as it seems that the chef is overflowing with great ideas. Our highest recommendation.

column1: La Plazuela at La Fonda on the Plaza
column4: 100 E. San Francisco Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Eat here whenever we are in Santa Fe!!
Nice dining room, can sit on pillows with faux sunken table for fun. Good shrimp tempura and unique spring rolls! They need better choices for wine by the glass.!

We like Zinc very well although not quite as much as the sister gem Season's. Our server on the last visit was lacking polish an was too informal and inappropriately familiar with us. Two of us had the scallop special and it was.very good. Without the specials, it can be hard to find something to choose. My son picks the ravioli every visit and they do change up the variety on the ravioli periodically.

We were there on a Sunday evening, so it was dead quiet. Shared the shrimp flatbread appetizer, prepared perfectly! No rubbery over cooked shrimp here!! I had the sea scallops and my partner had the flat iron steak. The scallops were certainly the nicest I have ever had in Albuquerque, both in size/texture/freshness and in overall presentation. The flat iron steak was reported to be very tasty as well. Dessert was Lemon Three Ways and Vanilla Creme Brê_lê©e. Both were excellent, as we had come to expect after such a nice meal. The only weakness at Forque is the wine list, it is rather limited and unimaginative.

column1: High Finance  Restaurant - At the top of the Tram
column13: The scenic view is fantastic both from the 15 minute tram ride up to the restaurant and out the large windows in the dining area! High Finance has a somewhat limited menu but the items they have are well prepared. Add to this a pleasant and competent wait staff and you will enjoy the experience. Be prepared to pay about $120.00 for a party of two (including discounted tram tickets).
Overall excellent experience and beautiful view at sunset

While visiting Albuquerque for the Balloon Fiesta, we stopped in eclectic neighborhood of Nob Hill (Route 66) and ate at the Nob Hill Bar and Grill. What a pleasant surprise! The unique presentation of the food was something you might find at a more expensive restaurant, but the prices were very reasonable for what you got ... and certainly not "budget busting." I can only describe the food that we had as outstanding! Everything we had from the jalapeê±o poppers and currie chicken soup to the sandwiches and beef tenderloin were some of the best tasting food we had during our weeklong visit. Also the pumpkin cheesecake was ridiculously good. The food at this place was truly some of the best we have ever had.

column4: 6855 4th Street NW Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, NM  87107
column13: Awesome anniversary dinner. The fig bread pudding with home made ice cream was a great ending to the meal! Adult mac and cheese was amazing and the steaks are always tender and perfectly cooked, Matt was our waiter and we had a great dinner and service. We ate in the Black Diamond lounge and thoroughly enjoyed the Joshua Breakstone Trio. Thank you for another enhoyable and delicious dinner.

The Pork Piccata was strange. The pieces of pork used, were unidentifiable and tough. The piccata sauce was fabulous. If they made Chicken Piccata, very thin, it would be wonderful. The scallops were OK. The Halibut was good. It was our Waitress who made our experience great. She was exceptional. We will go back, but they have to change that grey pork for flattened, very thin, chicken breasts.
Great food, great wine, and our server, Bri, was friendly, delightful and very helpful with recommendations. A terrific evening!

Sabroso consistently has excellent food. For Taos, the fresh fish specials and variety of shellfish appetizers is unusual and particularly delicious. I believe the food is some of the best in Taos and the secluded location in Seco is quiet and the drive makes the restaurant a nice destination.

Loved it. We were planning on spending our 25 anniversary at a restaurant downtown but opted for what we knew would be a perfect dinner. And it was. Dinner was super, service was super and we changed our time for dinner and it was easily done without a problem especially on Balloon fiesta weekend. Loved it as always!
The restaurant is lovely, the service was outstanding, and the food was delicious. Especially the bisque! :)

Great food. Very poor service. Our waiter could get it right. It was a sunday night and half price wines.But two wines they didn't have in stock. They did nothing to make it right. We did get a half price but not the wines we ordered.

column4: 58 S. Federal Place Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: One of our favorites - always. Close to Plaza and cozy in the winter and great patio in the summer. Love their veal ravioli. They also have wonderful specials almost every night. Great wine list!

column4: 72 West Marcy Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: I had not returned to La Boca for several years because the noise level can be impossible, but a buddy and I went to lunch here last Sunday and the food not only was excellent, but the noise level was okay, even with the restaurant about 3/4 full. And it was an excellent value. They had an appealing $15 three course lunch special, but we are light eaters and opted for a salad and a sandwich and would have the same thing again with pleasure. The pre-tip bill was $25.00 and that is very hard to beat in a nice restaurant in Santa Fe.

Farm and Table exceeded all my expectations! My parents were in town from California and I brought them to brunch to meet some of my friends. We sat on the patio with a beautiful view of the vegetable garden. The quiet trickle of the water feature was calming and added to the charm of the ambiance. The food is a gift from the foodie Gods! Overall I can highly recommend Farm and Table.

Had a really nice time...they recognize us now. We had the specials, Mahi and Lamb specials. Mahi was really good but with a breading, really strange thing to do to a good fish like that but it was moist as all get out...kind of Germanic-style Mahi...most of the cooking seems Germanic / heavy which is still hard for me since I really avoid heavy food. But it is done well and with imagination. Great service from Sophia. Most servers are good but seem overwhelmed all the time. It does get busy. Anyway, don't go there Please, we need to be able to eat there when we want and we don't want alot of people showing up and messing things up for us...thanks for that. There are pleanty of great places to eat in Abq.

We met old friends there for lunch. We are Wisconsinites visiting in ABQ, and they live in Santa Fe. We were seated outside in a lovely patio, with a few heaters to take off the morning chill. After we were seated, a huge birthday party assembled right next to us. We were quickly moved around a corner, and never heard a sound from them. The menu was ample, the food was all good, the wine list was varied, and the prices were fair. I will go again next time I am in ABQ.

column4: 95 West Marcy Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Service was very attentive, food outstanding. Best meal we had in our week in Santa Fe.

column4: 2031 Mountain Road San Felipe Plaza Albuquerque, NM  87104
column13: We found the food bland, plus my wife's chicken was very dry!

column4: 210 Don Gaspar Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: While the food was very good, the service was lackluster. The waiter kept disappearing, although the restaurant was almost completely empty when we arrived. We were so badly neglected,that another waiter came by to see if we needed anything, which we did! I'd be willing to give it another chance since the food was so good, but if the service fails again that's it!
Food only fair - the menu was was a surprise - and above the restaurant's reach. Definitely would not recommend or return.
Top notch food and local flamenco entertainment. As a commercial photographer, I hope to return to photograph the show for the troupe before I leave Santa Fe until Spring of 2013.

column1: Fuego @ La Posada de Santa Fe
column4: 330 East Palace Ave Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Save your money and go somewhere else. Actually don't waste any money in "nice restarunts in Santa Fe. Big let down. Cheap simple spots are great.. Much better food a

column4: 548 Agua Fria Street Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Warning: foie gras on the menu, which turned my stomach before I ate anything. This is not a menu that makes you feel good about how we treat the planet or the animal kingdom. Despite appealing to upscale diners in Santa Fe, there wasn't any mention of serving foods that are local, seasonal, organic, or humanely raised, etc. There is only one vegetarian entree on the menu, and it seemed to be a concession to those who don't eat animals, rather than a dish that the chef would proudly serve to friends. It was a poblano pepper stuffed with potatoes and rice, which required a steak knife to cut. The bed of spaghetti squash was bland and nobody asked why I left it on the plate or whether I enjoyed my meal.

column4: 416 Agua Fria St Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Was good last time we were able to find it open.

column4: 1297 Bishops Lodge Rd Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: My wife and I had dinner recently at Las Fuentes when we stayed at Bishop's Lodge Ranch Resort & Spa. Though it was convenient and we did not have to drive into Santa Fe and park, the quality of the food, service and ambiance were not nearly as high as we had expected. Perhaps our expectations were too high, or possibly we hit an off-night.

column4: 106 N. Guadalupe St. Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: The best steak I have ever had! Delicious food.

column4: 211 Old Santa Fe Trail Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: This was by far one of the best restaurants in Santa Fe. Everything was wonderful. We can't wait to return.

We were so disappointed. The restaurant looks beautiful on their website, but is vastly different upon arriving. It was in a bad area and there was only one other family there and it was a Friday night at 6:30! I suspect all the perfect reviews are from multiple family members of the owner. Do not recommend.

column4: 106 Paseo Del Pueblo Norte Taos, NM  87571
column13: Peter greets every diner at the door. We felt welcomed. Service was excellent. Evey one of the four meals were delicious. Two of us had the portabella pasta and the other two had Chicken Schnitzel over noodles. The clam chowder was as good as the best we had in Cape Cod and the salads were fresh and tasty. It was a pleasant evening.
Excellent, fresh seafood. Portions are rather small for the prices but the food quality and spot-on service more than make up for it!

column1: De La Tierra at El Monte Sagrado Resort - Kessler
column13: Loved it never a disappointment
This was our first time here. The food was excellent. A perfect date nite. We will be back
great place for Italian food. Why go to a national chain when you have Trombino's. They had our table ready and waiting, the service was excellent, the food was excellent.

The food is very well prepared, fresh and excellent tasting.It is a little noisy at dinner but could converse easily.The wines are reasonably priced and very good. The owner, Robert, remembered our name and email address as we left the restaurant-very impressive. Recommend GB very highly. We will return often.
loved it! better than expected! great jazz band in the lounge.

column4: 125 East Palace Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: Always enjoy the singing and fun spot to go. Everyone is always so friendly.

column4: 125 East Palace Avenue Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: This is a wonderful restaurant in Santa Fe, fine dining with a diverse and interesting menu(I had rabbit confit and a quail dish for example). They also have wonderful wine pairings that are carried in the wine store located next door. They also have a very nice outdoor patio for dining, including Sunday brunch.
Everything about our experience was very positive. Great food, well priced and service was very good. Love the booths, offers privcy for each couple. Will definitely return. Quiet atmosphere.
Outstanding restaurant in downtown Albuquerque. Service was exceptional even though the restaurant was crowded. We also had several apps, all amazing.

We used to go to St. Claire's all the time. We went with small groups and large groups. Regardless of the occasion, the atmosphere was always very intimate. This past evening, it was loud, noisy, and the food was just ok. I understand the reason for renovating, but in an effort to have more clientele, they sacrificed the ambience. Because of this, it is not worth the money for my wife or me.

Great food, great server. The only thing was that our appetizer did not arrive, so at the end of the meal we just told him to cancel it. The waiter was very apologetic and made it sound like he was going to comp the dessert (we initially said we were too full to order dessert, but he was very persuasive!), but it did show up on the bill. Otherwise, we've been here a few times and have thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

column4: 1017 Paseo Del Pueblo Norte Taos, NM  87529
column13: This is the best spot in Northern New Mexico - worth a special trip, and a must visit if you are in Taos. Have been there at least dozen times, and will be back again soon.

column4: 2201 Uptown Loop NE Suite 1A Albuquerque, NM  87110
column13: The previous location was much a much more private and intimate setting. The new location is still great but i still prefer the old one. Food and service is still exceptional.

column4: 315 Old Santa Fe Trail Santa Fe, NM  87501
column13: We will probably come back and have some wine at the bar. That was very good but pricey. Not sure if we would come back for dinner though. The food was good but not alot of great choices.

column4: 645 So Cache St. Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: We had a delicious, special dinner at 43 North! I had the prosciutto wrapped halibut! Loved it! My husband had the pork chop and my son had the stuffed prawns. We all enjoyed our entrees! Plus we were given a free bottle of wine as part of their special. While we were dining a huge group of tired looking fire fighters came in to eat. 43 North opened up the entire back room to them. Everyone applauded when they entered the restaurant. It gave me a warm feeling to know that 43 North was showing appreciation for these selfless, hard working people who literally saved our community!!

column4: 3255 W. Village Dr. Teton Village, WY  83025
column13: fondue and desserts very good, little outdated built in 1960s needs updating
My husband siad, it was the best fried chicken he's ever had! We also ate breakfast there and it was delicious! Highly recommend!

column4: Jackson Hole Mountain Resort Teton Village, WY  83925
column13: Fabulous food -- but the salad was memorable....watermelon, minced cashews, fresh greens -- triggered every taste bud in my mouth...incredible!

We had our 20th wedding anniverary dinner there as part of our out west trip. It was quiet, not crowded and the food was good. Nothing really popped out at us as it being an extra special place accept for the animal heads hanging on the wall. The view was beautiful outside as it is located at the base of the Grand Tetons.
We have been eating here for a little over 30 years and it is still our favorite place. We love it.

This is casual dining at its best. Think of it as a pizza joint with a sports bar, alongside a large rustic dining room that has an interesting menu, a very decent wine and beer list, very good food, and friendly and attentive service. Oh yes: and reasonable prices. The parking lot is packed in the evenings, and it is not a ride-share lot! This place is popular, and deserves to be.

What a find. My friend and I had dinner here and loved it. Top notch, great prices and fabulous drinks. Loved the sushi and flatbread. The best edamine I've ever had. Service was very good. Highly recommend!
We found Giovanni's while traveling. It was near our hotel and had good reviews. We were pleased with our meal and our service. The dining room is dark and a little stuffy.

column4: 3335 West Village Road Teton Village, WY  83025
column13: Everything was great. The food was well presented, flavorful and just the right amount. The

column4: 55 North Cache St. Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: The food was exceptional. We were there on Thurday. We ate at another restaurant on Friday but returned to Local on Saturday.Thank-you.

column4: 2550 Moose Wilson (Teton Village) Road Wilson, WY  83014
column13: Food is too heavy. Seems to appeal to younger crowd however

column1: Wild Sage @ The Rusty Parrot Lodge
column4: 175 North Jackson Street Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: Perfect in every way! We got there late and were the only ones there but they catered for us perfectly and everything we had - crab cakes, pheasant, salmon and risotto, French onion soup - was the best of its kind we'd eaten.
Amazing steaks, great wine list and excellent service.

I think the kitchen consistently delivers the best and most imaginative food in Jackson. Service is excellent.This visit my wife and I had the luxury shrimp (the best shrimp preparation I've had anywhere), the calamari (merely excellent), and then, the goat.On previous visits we've had the red deer, swordfish, and tuna. The kitchen always gets it right. Highly recommended.

column1: Westbank Grill @ Four Seasons Jackson Hole
column4: 7680 Granite Loop Road Teton Village, WY  83025
column13: Delightful evening, at Westbank Grill! My husband had the pork chop, and said it was SO good, that it didn't even need sauce of any kind! The Halibut was well prepared, and the roasted eggplant and pomme puree were divine.Great personalized service, the staff are wonderful!
Always has been an excellent steak house! I didn't know about their awesome burger deal and they treat locals with a special deal!
The homemade pasta was delicious in all the dishes we ordered. I would absolutely go back again and again. Only issues were that it was a little expensive and they were out of meatballs.

column4: 380 S. US Hwy 89 Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: Dined at the Bistro with my three girlfriends! We had a rollicking good time! Our waiter was excellent.... so patient and competent! The food was delightful! We all enjoyed our entrees! I'll have to say my favorite was the soup of the day: parsnip & golden beet! Loved it! We'll be back again and again!!

Played golf earlier in the day and saw the restaurant and decided to try for dinner. Lots of great restaurants in Jackson but if you are in Teton Village this is a great place for a change and not have to drive downtown.

column4: 5000 Spring Gulch Road Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: The food here is very sub par, has been for years. Every year they change the FB Manager along with all the wait staff, thinking that is the problem. The only person who remains consistent is the chef - that should tell you where the problem is. Fish & chips are greasy, salmon used to have black sesame seeds which gave it some flavor, now it is a mixture of white sesame seeds with a few black mixed in - with no flavor, chicken wings are good but very overpriced, the quality of prime rib is hit or miss when they have it. The burger is no longer mead ranch however it still sells for $14.50. The ambiance sells itself for the locals who live near by who are willing to accept sub par food rather than drive to town. Lots of missing potential!
A real GEM in Driggs, not many in Teton Valley to speak of. Love the food and the fact you can request your degree of fire, 1 - 5!! Keep the curries coming!
Kobe-style beef special was wonderful. I took pics of my beautiful heirloom tomato salad to recreate for dinner party entertaining! Service was great!
We have dined at the SRG a few times and every time has been Great. The friendly knowledgeable staff and Great food and decor has made this restaurant a must when we are in town.

column4: 3535 North Moose - Wilson Road Wilson, WY  83014
column13: There aren't any restaurants like this in the town. It was very unique. The food was good, and the staff was very well trained and helpful. Personally, I did not care so much for the decor and how dark it was inside, but I would go back again.

column4: 3465 North Pines Way Suite 103 Wilson, WY  83014
column13: Absolutely wonderful! The food is fresh and unique. Will go back soon!
John Mark is such a hospitable bar tender! He remembers people's names and what they like to drink and eat. He is very congenial, and he is a true asset to The Garage!

column4: 1800 Spirit Dance Road Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: This was a great find. The restaurant was situated on top of a tall hill overlooking one of the valleys outside Jackson proper. Great views of the Tetons up toward the Teton Pass and of the large herds of blank angus steers in the pastures below, Both of us had the Idaho trout - very nicely cooked with an imaginative wild rice. Very friendly attentive wait staff

column4: 45 South Glenwood Street Jackson Hole, WY  83001
column13: Well prepared casual dining spot made for couples or small groups. Good wine list although limited by the glass selection. My second visit this year and can't say much had changed on the menu. Desserts were excellent.

column4: 777 River City Casino Boulevard St. Louis, MO  63125
column13: We had a party of four and we all thought the food was prepared exactly as ordered. The portions are large enough to split and the wait staff is very attentive. My wife and I have eaten here numerous times but for us it's a little on the expensive side so we come here for special occasions, but it is always well worth the cost. We highly recommend this restaurant.

column4: 3910 Peachtreee Dr. Suite H Columbia, MO  65203
column13: The staff was amazing here. The day we went someone called from the restaurant to ask if there was anything special that they could do since we were having a bridal shower. We decided to put the brides bill on mine and to have her dessert brought out before everyone else without her even seeing a menu. When we got there 45 minutes before our reserved time, they seated us right away in a large comfy booth on a raised platform overlooking the rest of the dining a bar area, so we felt a bit special. The waitress was very prompt and kept checking on us for about an hour while we waited for the last person in our party. We ordered the welsh rarebit for the table and it was amazing. The 44 stone burger was delicious as well. Recommend!!!
My favorite restaurant in St. Louis.
Quick business lunch on the outside patio. Food was good (grouper), well prepared, and timely.

For those of us who love the cuisine of other Eastern Mediterranean cultures, such as Lebanese or Greek fare, Aya Sofia's Turkish theme is at once both familiar and adventurous. We love the nuanced seasonings, great vegetarian options and flavorful lamb dishes. They are also our favorite source for a calamari appetizer.
Food was excellent and wait staff was very helpful and friendly.

The food is excellent!! It is a very busy place and the noise is overwhelming if your trying to have a conversation. Though I would go back everyday of the week because of the food. The wine we enjoyed Tres Picos was good and our server was accommodating.

column4: 1130 Town and Country Crossing Dr Town and Country, MO  63017
column13: I had the Autumn risotto, which was super. Also had the duck confit salad. Great. Others had the curry, a steak, steak tartare, veggie Napoleon. All excellent.

Bixby's is one of the few restaurants in St. Louis that specialize in civilized dining: good food, a peaceful setting, and the opportunity to converse without having to shout over loud music. The menu is creative -- and the prices are reasonable. The service is exceptional -- friendly, hospitable, and attentive without being overbearing. This is a five-star eating experience.
Four of us attended before attending the show at Jesse Hall. The dining experience was a delight!

column4: 1034 S. Brentwood Blvd. Saint Louis, MO  63117
column13: My wife and I chose to eat here after reading some of the other reviews. The martinis were great. They have 60 "flavors" of martinis on the menu and we sampled 4 that were very tasty. We chose to try several appetizers because they were only $5 during happy hour and the chicken lollipop skewers were awesome. We also tried the Popeye pizza(spinach, olive paste, feta cheese) and it was good. Since we were headed to a concert, we did eat pretty early (5:00) and the resturant was empty. We are headed back in a couple weeks with some friends to sample more martinis. Overall it was a great experience!

wE HAD OUR FAMILY REUNION AT THE BOATHOUSE. IT WAS A MEMORIAL TIME. THE MENUE CHOICES PLEASED ALL THE FOODIES IN THE FAMILY ALSO THE FINICKY PALET OF THE LITTLE ONES. AFTER DINNER AND DESSERT THE KIDS WENT OUTSIDE TO FEED THE DUCKS AND GO FOR A PADDLEBOAT RIDE ON THE BEAUTIFUL LAKE. THE WHOLE FAMILY FELL IN LOVE WITH THE BOATHOUSE.
Our waitress was very helpful when ordering our dinner. The food was delicious.

An eclectic place with an interesting Cuban/caribbean focus. I had ropa vieja with cuban rice, a really good and different dish. Definitely not a dress up place. The wine list is notable only for poor selections (Blackstone Merlot, Ravenswood Cab?)and high prices.
A true french restaurant (blanquette de veau, cassoulet, profiteroles, floating islands, etc.) We will go back!
The Twilight menu is a good way to try out Bristol if you've never been there. Three courses for 19.50 cannot be beat.

Excellent upscale restaurant with surf and turf type dishes. Wine list was nice. Get on their email list and get birthday discounts. Some of their well known dishes include scallops, Lobster and Macaroni, steaks and Carrot Cake to top it off.

The food was delicious and well prepared. I thought maybe $16 for a six shrimp cocktail appetizer was a little pricy but they were done perfectly so I quickly forgot about the price. The service, overall was very good. The only negative on this review is that I gave my parking stub to the waitress to be validated. She forgot about it (and so did I) until after I had left the restaurant to go to a movie and had to rush back and find her to get it. Just a little detail but also an inconvenience. Other than that, all aces.

Everything was GREAT at Cafe Napoli...!!!Table was waiting for us when we arrived.Quinton was our waiter. He was professional, friendly and prompt...Q was great!It was my wife's Birthday and he chose our desert and it was on the house!!I had Veal Parmesan and my wife had Chicken Pasta...wonderful!!!Our server was Mayra, she was also a true professional and very friendly. Both Q and Myra took care of our every needs.We will be back at Cafe Napoli.

Wonderful entertainment and very good food. Nice choice of Italian dishes. The veal was fork tender and a generous portion. Shrimp and scallops had a strange spice, but were good. Nice overall experience.
Had not been there in a long time. I am in my mid 30s and felt like the youngest person in the place. The clientele was old!

column4: 777 Casino Center Drive Harrah's Casino Maryland Heights, MO  63043
column13: I just wish the tables for two people were bigger. They seem cramped.

column1: Charlie Gitto's from the Hill - Chesterfield
column13: This Charlie Gittos doesn't compare to the one in the Harrahs Casino. The food doesn't match the mood setting nor. The price. Me and my husband ordered the chicken nunzio which is excellenat the the Harrahs and suppose to be one of there signature dishes at this location as well; the chicken and potatoes tasted like frozen food I can buy at the grocery store, it was room temperature although the plates were piping hot. It was almost like they plated frozen food , put it in the oven and then put sauce over the top of it. The sauce was the only thing that tasted decent. Would not recommend anyone eating here especially for the price. Go to the Harrahs location instead; we've never been to the one on The Hill so not sure about that one.
Walk into a time capsule with excellent service that seems to be a thing of the past at most restaurants. The maitre d' sets the tone and it just gets better.

column4: 999 N Second Street St. Louis, MO  63102
column13: i have been there multiple times and it has always been extremely nice. this time however i was totally disappointed;the pizza was just ok, the service was lackluster, and the noise level was very loud. glad it was just a buddy and not a date with me. i know they can do better.

After having made a reservation well in advance, I was given the worst table in the house, with very little concern from management.Service was slow.Food took forever to come up.The fried clams, one of the specials, were as tough as my left shoe.NOT a wonderful evening.
We had our 1 year old with us and the server went above and beyond to.make our baby feel at home

A tasty little secret in Clayton, MO. This is a cozy, dark wood themed French restaurant in an unassuming storefront. The looks belie the incredibly tasty menu and wine list, and their commitment to local, seasonal foods and wine. The tasting menu is a bargain for the quality and diversity of dining choices, and is highly recommended. The local grass fed tenderloin was excellent, as were the scallops. The staff is friendly and attentive without being pushy or intrusive. The atmosphere is quiet. This is an excellent choice for a romantic dinner for 2, or for an evening of good food and conversation among friends. A real value price wise.
Amazing food, great drinks, the best mexican restaurant in St. Louis by far.

column4: 323 West Port Plaza Maryland Heights, MO  63146
column13: Dierdorf & Hart's has been consistent for all of our visits. The food is always top notch and the service is second to none. We have lived in St. Louis for 7 years and Dierdof & Hart's is our favorite steak and fine dining destination.

Dominics is a beautfil italian restaurant on the hill. We went for our 7th anniversary. The only concern we had was the portion size, especially for the amount of money we spent. The food was very flavorful but not enough to fill you up. Make sure to order an appetizer before the main dish.
Wonderful business lunch location.

Arrived 10 minutes late because of traffic. No problem with reservation and seated immediately. Sushi was outstanding and service from Deon was top notch. Prices are competitive on regular basis. Happy hour menu is a terrific bargain with many items 50% off. All items were deivered timely with appropriate follow-up. Great sishi experience.
To people making reservations beware that you will not have access to the happy hour menu for drinks or food. That said the rolls were worth paying full price for the drinks were not.

column4: 639 Westport Plaza Drive Saint Louis, MO  63146
column13: Sushi was good and the atmosphere was good as well.
overrated, the price is not worthy of the food, although the food is good.

column4: 6177 Delmar Blvd in The Loop St. Louis, MO  63112
column13: Good food though the menu is limited. Good selection of wine and beer, though the by-the-glass-wine selections were also limited. Service was slow.

I was visiting St. Louis to have a "sisters" weekend and we needed to plan ahead for one of our dinners. All 4 of us are from different states so no one knew about good restaurants in the area. Open Table is my favorite phone AP and it helped me find the EdgeWild Restaurant and Winery in Chesterfield. What a great place! The food was spectacular. The servers were friendly and the wine tasting option was so much fun! Even the owner came to our table to make sure we were having a good time. They even ship their wine so I'm anxious to receive my two bottles and enjoy them here in Denver.
What more can we say? Eleven Eleven once again provided an outstanding evening of food and atmosphere for us. Rabbit was delicious; beef was well cooked. Soups were tasty. Dessert great.

We enjoyed the 4 course option - very reasonable at $45 per person. Serving sizes were just right, the quality and flavor was wonderful. The only disappointment was the salmon; overcooked and lacking in seasoning.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - St. Louis
column4: 1855 S Lindbergh Blvd. Saint Louis, MO  63131
column13: As always the service was exemplary. We had the double chicken breast and a fillet, both were cooked perfectly. The wine tablet (ipad) shows an amazing array of choices. This is an ideal venue for a special occasion.
Very well prepared and creative food!
The food and lighting are great. The tile floor leads to noisy and service could be more attentive.

column4: 701 Market Street Suite 100 Saint Louis, MO  63101
column13: These guys were very accommodating for our large group with children. The food was great and reasonably priced.
We had to cancel - will reschedule in Dec.
Everything was great and Ermin was wonderful !

column4: 1059 South Big Bend Blvd. St. Louis, MO  63117
column13: Loved the food, great chef, love the layers of flavors throughout the dish...true cuisine...timing between courses perfect...

column4: 1200 S. Main St. Saint Charles, MO  63301
column13: I loved Hendricks. The decor was great and we really felt like we were at a rustic smokehouse. The food was great with many selections. We had The Whole Shebang. Which is a sample of all their BBQ meats with 4 sides. I found the BBQ and sauces very very good. The bar and drink list was different and fun. The lighting was good and there were TV's up by the bar that can be seen throughout the place so we got to watch the Cardinal game while we ate. It wasn't too loud and we also thought the seating was comfortable.
If you are older than 25 you will feel very old in this restaurant. All of the other diners were evidently Wash U students, mainly undergraduates, at least when we were there, a Friday night.
The service was excellent and the menu was great great. There was a lot of variety and something for everyone.

column1: J. Gilbert's Wood-Fired Steaks & Seafood - West County Center
column4: 17A West County Center Suite A102 Des Peres, MO  63131
column13: I entertained customers. We all thoroughly enjoyed everything from drinks, wine, appetizers, through to desert. We all ordered different things and everything was great.

The food was very good but the service was only average. Most of our drinks (like a martini) came without garnishs which we were very surprised by. We were in a separate room but it was very noisy and really not a quiet experience like we had hoped. It was just not a great experience - only average and we won't return since it was only average but priced like it should have been better than that!

column4: 522 N. Grand Ave St. Louis, MO  63103
column13: Nice to have a great restaurant on Grand Ave. Food was very good and they easily accommodated requests. Just wish the menu was bigger.

column4: 535 South Lindbergh Blvd St. Louis, MO  63131
column13: Another excellent experience at this restaurant. Best steaks in St Louis. Not a place for a quiet dinner. Always packed, but service is excellent. Always go back for a great dinner.

Good food and attentive service -- it's great to have a restaurant like this in the Grove. They make some pretty tasty hummus. Our party of eight wasn't sure about the belly dancer at first, but she turned out to have a great sense of humor and made this place really memorable. The kitchen might want to have a look at its baklava recipe, though. Light and flaky on the pastry is what's called for, guys.

This meal was outstanding. The wine pairings were especially superb. The sommelier and chef really understand the art of great food and great wine. The chef uses molecular gastronomy wisely and sparingly to enhance dishes. For example, creating pine nut dust that somehow melts in your mouth into a velvety consistency.

column4: 1330 Washington Ave 500 N 14th Street Saint Louis, MO  63103
column13: Go for the music and the atmosphere. Snack but dont dine
Great place for a nice quiet inner in a neighborhood restaurant.
Wonderful meal. Quality and temperature of food was perfect.Best meal/dining experience I've had in a while

My husband and I had dinner with another couple here for my birthday. Good ambiance, a bit noisy but wasn't a distraction...it did seem a bit crowded as we were seated right by the pizza oven. The food was delicious - Toasted Ravioli of the Day was ricotta/red pepper and could definitely tell it was homemade. Pear Salad, Swallow's Nest, Pork Ragu and Scorze pasta were all unique and delicious. Pumpkin pudding with salted caramel whipped cream for dessert - perfect!

column4: #2 The Boulevard St. Louis Richmond Heights, MO  63117
column13: Wonderful as always! However we did complain about our cheesecake and the waiter did nothing about it. Disappointing.

First trip, as wonderful as expected. Everything was flavorful. Peruvian cuisine is not Mexican food, more Mediterranean in nature but with nice use of Peruvian peppers and seasoning combinations. Deft touch with sea scallops which is always a good test for a kitchen. My partner had grilled shrimp with a bowtie pasta that was fantastic, superbly seasoned. The national dessert, a spongecake like roll with a caramel sauce inside, is positively addicting. We will definitely be back.

column4: 17 West County Center Des Peres, MO  63131
column13: We were there early in the evening-on a Sunday- so there were lots of families there. Very nice ambiance- everyone working there seemed genuinely happy to be there. The food was fantastic- overall it was a great experience! Will definitely go back.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.We appreciated that the restaurant owner was seating people and spoke to us a few times throughout our meal.The servers are extremely friendly and take care of you very well.The food was delicious!

When you have to almost beg to get the water glass filled, you know you are in for a long dinner out. I don't know if our server got slammed with tables all at once or what, but our party of two seemed very low on his list. After taking our order, he then returned to say they might be out of what I had ordered, did I have a second choice. Then left. My husband asked which entree I thought I might be getting - we were left in suspense. While the food was good, it didn't match my expectation level for the place and its prices. Just goes to show that service makes all the difference (or at least a significant amount of difference).

column4: 20 Allen Ave Suite 130 Webster Groves, MO  63119
column13: One of the best meals I've had in St. Louis. I'll definitely be coming back!

Modesto has everything going for it (great look, super service fresh locally sourced food), but they have to improve on the taste of their food. Cauliflower cooked in truffle should have at least a hint of that glourious truffle taste. The same goes for paella. I could not detect saffron and the dish while fresh and hot had little to no taste. I will definitly give Modesto another chance due to their great service, super ambiance and overall potential.

column1: Morton's The Steakhouse - St. Louis - Clayton
column13: This was our first time at Morton's and it was very delightful evening. The service and food were oustanding.

Had an excellent dining experience on a busy Saturday night. The manager Shaun greeted us at the door. Mosaic's was energized and the kitchen was sending beautiful food at a great pace. Service was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The soup sampler appetizer was a great way to try 3 different soups in proportionate serving sizes The butternut squash was so flavorful. A real interesting and special entree was the Roasted Bone Marrow; split bones with the richest, creamiest marrow to be spread on the accompanying bread. So Good!! The Missouri Organic Tenderloin was so tender and had a nice flavor. Presentation of all the food was enticing. I will be back and will highly recommend Mosaic's.
Food was great and service was exceptional!

column4: 500 South Main St St. Charles, MO  63301
column13: I have been to this restaurant before and the service and food were excellant. When our group went this time the food was sub-standard, the celery salad dressing tasted and looked as though it had been watered down. The service was terrible. We had made reservations well in advance and we waited for approximately 30 minutes before our orders were taken. The young man said that he was trying to take care of 4 tables. We had reservations for the evening meal also but I cancelled them because of this poor service. I doubt that I will go back there again.

column4: 1054 Town & Country Crossing Town and Country, MO  63017
column13: The evening was perfect! Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable. He was attentive, but not overly involved. We had many different servings and they were all appropriately paced. The food was served in a timely manner and was exceptional.

We were dining at Niche for the first time, meeting our friend's new boyfriend. The food was excellent (terrific, amazing, original). The menu itself was a great conversation starter! Everything tasted fresh and delicious. Recommendations from our waitress were spot-on. Am definitely recommending Niche to friends and family for a special occassion or "just because."

The menu is very creative and the food is subtly, and complexly flavored. Highly recommend for a new and innovative dining experience. Portions are substantial, you will feel well fed after your meal. Very attentive wait staff.
Food and service was very good.

Porterhouse steak was outstanding, very flavorful. Service was very good, never had to ask for anything. Salad was huge, could maybe downsize it a little bit, but not a big deal there. The bread pudding also very good for dessert. Would definitely recommend this place for special occassions or just a night for a great steak.

I will definately return to Prime 1000 and will recommend them. The ambiance is what you'd expect at an upscale, fine-dining restaurant but without being snobby or elitest, very comfortable. The decor has a nice modern feel, with interesting original art in the bar and dining room. While the side-dishes were very good, they weren't outstanding and the real "star-of-the-show" is, of course, the steak, which is extraordinary.

column4: 227 W. Lockwood Ave. Webster Groves, MO  63119
column13: They have successfully combined dining with more formal wine tasting. Once you've found something you like, you can purchase their wines in their wine shop to take home.
GREAT FOOD,MORE OF A HOT SPOT BAR SCENE ENVIROMENT. i WOULD GO BACK AGAIN.
Great Food- Fast Service- Enjoyed the Cardinals Play Off Game while enjoying great drinks and food- a total home run!!!
Terrific quality food and spectacular service. Dining room is dated but still attractive in an old fashioned sense.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - St. Louis
column13: We ate at the location in downtown St. Louis. It was a great experience. My 13 year old son took me, his mother out on his first date. It was such a wonderful occasion and we truly enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. My son stated the next day "that the steak was really good". Our waitress was nice and pleasant. We also got the opportunity to meet Charles Woodson of the Green Bay Packers. My son took a picture with him so he thought the experience was superb. I would recommend eating at this restaurant.

My husband and I are regulars at Sanctuaria and it never disappoints. We always take our out of town guests here and they love it. The atmosphere is great and the food is outstanding. It's so nice to be able to order so many different plates to share since everything is so delicious it is nice to sample a variety of things. The service is always great as well. It's great food without the fuss. The cocktails are also excellent. I'm never sure what I want and upon answering a few questions, they create a drink for me that is delicious! We highly recommend it!
Awesome food, atmosphere, & fun.Can't wait to return!

column4: 6-8 S. Sarah St. Saint Louis, MO  63108
column13: Overall a very positive dining experience. Had to send the flank steak back being a bit underdone for Medium but the end result was delicious. Service was good for the most part and the ambiance very amenable to quiet conversation. Was my first visit and plan on lunch there in the near future.

column4: 3024 S Grand Blvd St. Louis, MO  63118
column13: We had a great time, but the company we were with helped with that. I was a little disappointed our waitress didn't seem to be able to do more than one thing at a time. We she asked for our drink orders, she did it one at a time. It seemed odd to us. The food was exceptional. We love sushi, and we did try new things and it was delicious! The server was not real attentive to us, leaving us be after drinks, and then waiting for our food, seemed to take longer than normal. It was our first visit at this restaurant, so not the best first impression. I try not to be too picky, realizing servers sometimes have 'off' days, but it could have been better. Food was fantastic though!
Everything was great. Thank you.

Normally, this is a great place to go on a Saturday night. But this past Saturday, the wait staff was uninterested and scatter brained when seating us, taking orders and serving us. Then there were at a rush to get us out the door. I guess I could accept that if their was a line waiting, but their were tables open. Prior to the live music , the overhead music was also too low for any ambiance or atmosphere to be created. It was almost odd how silent the room felt. The live musician did make things better, but that was close to 8:00.

column4: 308 N. Euclid Ave. St. Louis, MO  63108
column13: I always enjoy myself at Sub Zero. I started going for the drinks and now I go for the food as well! I went to celebrate a friend's birthday and was told upon my reservation confirmation that there is a charge, per person, to bring in your own dessert. Keep that in mind before you spend money on a nice cake or cupcakes.

We ate at Table Three for our 36 anniversary. We were seated in a private room which was very nice. Great service. Food was delicious. A few problems, food could have been hotter but taste for most items we ordered was great. Will recommend and will go back.

column4: 2961 Dougherty Ferry Rd. Suite 101 Saint Louis, MO  63122
column13: Another evening with great food, excellent service and fun atmosphere. We love The Tavern. We celebrated our 30 yr olds birthday. He is a Chicago resident and Tavern rates right there with the Top Chicago restaurants he frequents!

I am in the restaurant business and appreciate a staff that strives to serve well and pay attention to detail. One of the things I look for is how the staff attends the table and these guys had the drinks full and were very efficient. They were attentive without being invasive. Good experience. It was early on a Sunday afternoon and that can sometimes be an inconsistent meal.
Still the best! They know how to do it so well!

column4: 132 N Main St Saint Charles, MO  63301
column13: New to town. First time there. Excellent experience. Would go back.

column1: Top of the Riverfront - Millennium Hotel
column4: 200 South Fourth St St. Louis, MO  63102
column13: Great atmosphere for a romantic date night. The view was perfect especially because we made our reservations for right at sunset. I ordered the filet mignon, which was melt in your mouth delicious as were the sides. My boyfriend ordered the St.Louis peppercorn steak and he enjoyed it at first but said it was overpowering after a while of eating it. Parking was very limited though so we could not park at the milennium (the restaurant will validate you for parking if you park in their parking lot) but it was St. Louis on a saturday night, what can you expect?
The staff was first and foremost attentive and professional, but also had a "real" and fun side to them.

Great service, food was ok but way too salty. Makes me wonder if the kitchen is masking or enhancing flavors. Calamari was interesting - thick and chewy. Not what we expected, prefer light and crunchy. Really appreciated the manner in which our server both made us feel comfortable and yet had use feed and paid within a tight theatre timeframe.
Always good and creative cuisine.

It started out with being given menus that were blank, No inserts at all .Our server, Shane then asked us to wait and order after the chef decided on his special for the night. It is now 5:25 p.m. 6:10 comes (no he has not checked onus ONCE) and here came Shane with the manager....announcing someone had dropped one of our dishes and they had to start over, offering a bottle of wine for our inconvenience. My son ordered a rib eye. I have never seen such a pathetic excuse for a steak, it was very thin and mostly fat. Not what you would expect from a fine restaurant.Then came the bill, and they charged us for the complimentary wine. The special evening turned into a disaster!

Beautiful building and great ambiance. The only complaint I would have is that we were squeezed upstairs with a birthday party. They weren't loud but it felt pretty tight. Other than that, the food and service was good. It was also a plus that they had the Cardinal's game playing at the bar, which we had a great view from upstairs.

column1: Vino Nadoz Bistro and Wine Bar
column4: #16 The Boulevard St. Louis St. Louis, MO  63117
column13: Normally one of our favorites, we had a disappointing outing. The squash soup had potential, but was served luke warm at best. The meals were uninspiring. The service was inattentive and we had to constant get the attention of our waiter. May have been a new chef or just a bad Saturday night. We've had at least 3 or 4 fantastic experiences prior.
close to the Fox which is good but food was average. had to ask for a steak knife to cut my spedini and veges

The restaurant was extremely loud. The food was poor and service just adequate. The comment was made regarding slowness of service due to a wedding reception and only three cooks. Obviously, the wedding reception was planned and the management should have been ready for a Saturday night. I would not recommend to others or return.
Fantastic fried chicken on Sundays!!!!

We would highly recommend this restaurant. We pulled up at 7:00 on a Saturday night and were surprised to find this in the corner of a strip mall. We were expecting something a little more upscale. Inside the ambience was about as good as one can adapt a mall space into fine dining.
We had six adults in our group. We all had the three course special. It was about the right amount of food for us seniors.
Amazing food and great service. They were very accommadating when we called ahead and wanted to see the college football game. We will definitely be back soon!

Most recently a friend and I visited Accurso's on a Wednesday evening. The food was okay but not wonderful. The temperature/texture of the food appeared to be heated in the microwave and not cooked to order. The location is great and the service was okay but not outstanding for a restaurant that has such longevity and history in KC. I will not be ordering the Chicken Marsala on a return visit. I may consider their soup for future visits.

I feel the Affare is soooo close, but just not quite there yet. We had a group and were seated in this odd back room - hence the 2 stars as the front room was really cool.Our server was really bad... Not rude - just seemed like he didn't know what he was doing. It was our first time there, and we needed some assistance in how to order (trust me, if it's your first time, you will too). The group wanted to try a variety of different things and the waiter wasn't very helpful in suggesting items to share. Also - the portions are set up so they aren't really shareable.... Unless you only want a tiny bite.The food was good, but not great.I will go back, as they are still young and just have some growing pains to get through.

Almost everything was excellent....However, when we arrived the hostess did not give us proper seating...I had requested a quiet table and one by the window....3 tables by the window were empty....The hostess put us at a small table in the middle of two extremly, very noisy big groups..when our waitress brought our appitizers I asked for the manager and told himof my displeasure.... he immediately moved us to one of the more quiet empty tables by the window...He even made a point of passing by later to tell us he had checked the reservations and I was correct and his hostess HAD ignored the instructions...Hopefully he made a point of making sure that it does not happen to others....From that point on, all was great.
