column4: 200 East 25th Street, Suite 400 Mailing address: 200 East 25th Street, Suite 400 Kansas City, MO  64108
column13: My hat's off to the group at The American! The food is amazing; the finest ingredients, the finest preparations, the finest presentation, and the finest service. This was not our first time to The American and it certainly will not be the last. On a side note, my wife and I stopped by The American a few weeks ago for happy hour and that too, was amazing. If you have not been to The American for happy hour, you should check it out. The cocktails are sublime and the discounted happy hour food menu is out of this world. If you are not ready to take the plunge and go for dinner, stop by and check out the happy hour for a example of the amazin cuisine.
We have eaten at Anthony's several times and they consistantly present service, ambiance, and a authentic Italian cuisine of the highest caliber.
We've eaten our way through almost the entire menu and everything is absolutely delicious! We love the braised short ribs and bacon wrapped dates.

This was the first time my husband and I ate here. After reading the reviews about questionable service I was nervous about dinning here. Our service was great and the food was good. We will go back for sure.

I was pretty disappointed in the overall experience. The downstairs of the Blue Bird is very quaint and cute. They took our group of 11 to the upstairs, which looked like an old house with bedrooms. Everything had been well-maintained, but it felt like we were isolated from the rest of the restaurant experience. We waited probably 20 minutes before any waiter or waitress came to even ask us for our drink orders. We asked multiple times for high chairs, and waited probably 30 minutes for those to be brought up to us. I had requested 2 highchairs when I made my reservation. Overall, I was disappointed that our party of 11 had not been properly planned for by making sure the staff was ready to serve us upstairs and be attentive.

The course of the pre fixe dinner are amazing. Each course is complex and more delicious than the last. The service is top notch and the sommelier and the service staff spend a lot of time with you describing the dishes and the wine and why it is paired with each course. Top rate food and service in extremely creative ways, but without an ounce of stuffiness or pretention.

column4: 6334 N. Lucerne Avenue Kansas City, MO  64151
column13: Delicious food and wonderful service! Great place for a romantic date with your loved one!
Bonefish Grill is always good. I had Crab Legs that were large and yummy. Bang Bang Shrimp is a meal in itself.
Great food. Great wine list. Would come back again.

column4: 5400 West 119th Street Town Center Plaza Leawood, KS  66209
column13: Took my mother-in-law for her birthday dinner. The service and food were excellent. The only problem was that we were seated near the bar area and the noise level made it very difficult to have a conversation. Next time I will request seating away from the bar.
we have been to broadmoor bistro on multiple occasions.we took our neighbors for their first time and had a wonderful experience.

We have been going to Buca for years and we love it. The food is great and the atmosphere is a lot of fun. This trip we found our service to be below par based on our past experiences. Not sure what happened but we felt like we had been ignored by our server.

Cafe Europa worked out especially well: one of our guests requires the use of a motorized wheel chair. Cafe Europa was particularly easy to navigate, and we really appreciated this. The food, service and ambiance are all first-rate. The dishes were unusual and the ingredients were very fresh. We highly recommend Cafe Europa!
Our favorite to date. Great food, wonderful staff, excellent service.
Excellent food. Attentive service. Beautiful surroundings. What more could you ask for?
Food was excellant and Jodi is the best.

My wife and I had a wonderful lunch at Capital Grille. My wife had the Chicken Caesar Salad and I had the Glazed Salmon. While all of the food was very good, it was an outstanding side-dish of mashed potatoes that caught our attention. (I also enjoyed a very flavorful bowl of New England Clam Chowder.) Another dish that stood out for both of us was our dessert; three scoops of rich and creamy home-made ice-cream, along with two tasty cookies. It was a great way to finish the meal. The food was matched by a helpful and adoring wait staff. When thinking about how best to describe our service, the words "attentive" and "pampering" come immediately to mind. This is definitely one restaurant that does everything right.

Food was good, but fealt like we were being pushed all through dinner. Ordered appetizers and salad came before we even got half way through. Had to stop the server from taking remaining appetizers away. Then the entrees arrived and we had just started on our salad. Not the relaxing anniversary dinner my wife and I were looking for. Knew I should have gone to Jaspers.

column4: 3737 North Oak Trafficway Kansas City, MO  64116
column13: Our group of five all found the food delicious! We ordered several things on the menu so we could share and sample and enjoyed all.The decor was a little outdated but that is probably welcome to those who return for many years.

Well. I went to Caspian beacuse they serve my native dishes. So, my expectation is high when I eat at any Middle Eastern restaurants. I ordered the Combination Koobeh Kabab. The chicken kabab was not cooked very well and the beef kabab was a kind of dry. Again, my expectation is high. I am sure that alot people go there and enjoy the food and the music which they have on weekends.

The Brazilian BBQ is the way to go. They had some well-seasoned meats, and the cinnamon-pork and garlic-sirloin stood out the most. The salad bar was only mediocre, but they have a great deal on wine flights at 3 two-ounce pours for $8. I've been to better Brazilian Steakhouses in other cities, but this is a decent showing for Wichita, KS.

There was a large group party in the dining room that was very noisy at first and crowded our table. The manager quickly mended the issue, and comped us our wine for the inconvenience. It was handled very well. The food was absolutely outstanding. The other three at my table said the same and we all ordered different items off the menu. I will be going back.

column4: 235 SE Main St. Lees Summit, MO  64063
column13: We recently moved to Lees Summit area and wanted to support local businesses. Ciao Bella has a great atmosphere, good menu choices, and very friendly staff; the bar area is very small though. I ordered the chicken saltamboca and did not like my meal as the chicken lacked flavor and was not very tender. My husband had the seafodd raviloi and it was wonderful; I actually helped him eat his dish much to his distain. Overall a good experience and we will be returning.

column4: 1720 N. Webb Rd Suite 102 Wichita, KS  67206
column13: We loved our food - especially the fresh, hot bread!
Great food, people and location.

column1: Crown Uptown Dinner Theatre and Restaurant
column13: The evening was very good. I said to myself throughout the evening how impressed I was that Wichita had the talent to pull off a difficult musical like Sweeney Todd. The leads were strong and the ensemble cast was very good. Most of the vocals were truly impressive. I enjoyed every scene and was touched by many of the songs because they were delivered with such strong conviction. The acting was a bit uneven, the leads were obviously seasoned performers and created strong characters, but a few of the actors either over or underacted but their impact was minor in the overall production. The set design was stunningly effective and the stage was used to great advantage. The small orchestra was also very good. The overall effect was wonderful!

Took reservations for a larger group. Nice atmosphere. Service was not up to par. Server took my drink order and then left the table not asking anyone else at the table. Was first impression of the place. Food was good but thought selection was limited and pricey for the amount of food. We were celebrating a birthday but don't expect anything special as I was told they "don't do anything special" for special events by our server. Would think twice before returning.
The Drunken Fish was a great restaurant, the food was delicious and the serivce was great!

The Dubliner had good food, good service, and plenty of TVs around to catch college football as we ate. As we were finishing up, a small band was setting up and although we did not stay to watch their set, I'm sure this contributed to the lively and fun atmosphere. Good place!

This was truly one of the best dining experiences my wife and I have had in some time. Pricing is reasonble for this type of fine dining and the atmosphere was very nice. Our food, from our bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer, all the way through to the Bansnas Foster dessert was excellent. We will be back.

We went here on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. There were only 2 other tables filled, so it was very quiet. The fennel soup was quite delicious and my husband really liked the pork street tacos. I had the open face fish po boy which had very little flavor, plus it came with cold french fries.

This is my second Brazilian experience. The other restaurant was larger and offered more at the salad bar but did not have quite the expanded variety of meats. I was also impressed by the addition of seafood to this menu.

Great food, great people. It says something good about a restaurant where the servers have been there for a long time. The team at Extra Virgin always works their tails off to make sure the experience is a positive one.

Nice location just a short stroll from the City Market. Very inventive menu with fresh ingredients and plenty of satisfying options for the ravenous locavore. I chose the salmon croquettes with sweet potato cakes and both were exceptional. My fiance couldn't say enough good things about his eggs benedict with a fluffy pancake on the side topped with apple compote. The coffee was so good we found ourselves stopping at the Broadway cafe on the way home to pick up a bag to take home. Highly recommend this spot for brunch or lunch.

Even though we had reservations, we didn't really need them, as there were only two other tables there at lunch besides us. The food was scrumptious and our waiter, Matt, was very attentative and personable.

column1: Final Cut Steakhouse - Hollywood Casino Kansas City
column4: 777 Hollywood Casino Blvd. Kansas City, KS  66111
column13: Very nice place for a special occasion.

Server was efficient and friendly. Good green salad (Organic Field Greens). My entry (sea bass) was too salty. Dessert (cobbler) had a very weird taste. I'd give the service a 5 (out of 5) and the food a 2.

A delicious and affordable contemporary Mexican cuisine menu top to bottom. Usually the word "contemporary" equates to expensive and minimal. . . not in this case.Our meal from drinks to appetizer to entre to desert were all exquisitely prepared, generously portioned and unbelievably delicious.The small spaces made for an intimate environment and the staff was knowledgeable and attentive.This place is a real gem for anyone wanting some traditional Mexican cuisine with a new flair.
We always enjoy the food at Gaslight!
Made substitutions!! and split a glass of wine- excellent service! Food was great.
Rustic decor, family style service, good food. Take your family for a pleasant, well-fed meal.

Great food, oft-changing menu (save for the absolute staples, which remain for good reason), romantic lighting. Can get extremely noisy, though. Sometimes difficult to hold a conversation. If you are seated along the row immediately inside the door, prepare to be in the way of traffic the entire meal.
We've been here a zillion times and we always have a great experience!!!!!

column1: Great Plains Cattle Company - Ameristar Casino
column4: 3200 North Ameristar Drive Kansas City, MO  64161
column13: Great PLains Cattle Company was Amazing, the lighting was beautiful, candlelit type ambience, beautiful fireplaces. It was a quiet and calm very relaxing and enjoyable. Service was wonderful ! Our matridee was polite respectable and very professional, he was able to describe all the items on the menus plus the specials in great detail made them sound delicious ! All servers were dressed very nice and all clean. Food was amazing, cooked appropriately and great portion sizes, Our new favorite most talked about resteraunt. We are posting to davebook and twitter about our experience !
Food was good (we did the hibachi grill), but I was really impressed with the service. She went out of her way to make sure we were satisfied.
As always, Harry's was a notable dining experience. Its quiet, almost private, environment added to a special time.
Some of our food was cold when we got it. The waiter also served us the wrong drinks twice.

We always enjoy going to Hereford House for a special evening. We order the roast beef, the cheese potatoes and sauteed spinach. We compliment it with a bottle of wine, which is why we prefer Sunday nights. Although we try, we always have left overs which we enjoy the next night.
Great food, great portions, great service equals a great experience...
It was my birthday. Loved every minute. Our waiter was awesome. He was so knowledgeable about the Wine decanters and the glasses. Very entertaining and great personality.

column4: 8661 North Stoddard Avenue Kansas City, MO  64153
column13: I enjoyed the food. The meat was tender and had a wonderful flavorful taste.

column1: J. Gilberts Wood Fired Steaks & Seafood - Overland Park
column13: The food was very good as usual, but the service was not up to par. I think the server got sat with several large tables at once and we got lost in the shuffle. We will go back, but was hoping for a better experience since it was our wedding anniversary celebration.:(

column1: Journey Steakhouse - Argosy Casino Kansas City
column13: Second time I've eaten there. An amazing restaurant. The sea bass and scallops are my favirote. Love the atmosphere and there is a nice martini bar next door for before dinner cocktails.
as always the best me and my wifes fav

column4: 444 Ward Parkway Country Club Plaza Kansas City, MO  64112
column13: Front of the rest. was absolutely packed when entering and that led to a large noise while eating. But overall the food was good but a bit pricey.
Love this place, and love to take out-of-towners! My only beef is that it's very loud.

The food was flavorful but I couldn't find the mushroom on my portabella mushroom sandwich and my co-worker couldn't find the ahi tuna on her ahi tuna sandwich. It just all seemed like condiments. Flavorful condiments, but no substance. We didn't complain because we had a large group and didn't want to delay things.
Our favorite restaurant for any special occasion or for any relaxing evening.
Lidia's was a perfect setting for a brunch--the food was delectable and exceeded our expectations! No salt and pepper on ANY table--which only meant one thing: the food was seasoned to perfection!
As always, our favorite place to dine. Can't say enough about the food or the service. It is downright excellent every visit!

column4: 4646 JC Nichols Parkway Kansas City, MO  64112
column13: 3 hours for a mediocre meal. I would never go again.

The Jazz Club in The Majestic Steakhouse was an amazing find. The food was quite good though a bit overpriced. However, the live jazz was the absolute best my wife and I have ever enjoyed. We just sat and listened for hours, and during that time, not only did the trio of musicians play fantastic music, but guests did, too. Throughout the evening, 3 diners and 2 traveling musicians got up on stage and joined (or replaced) the 3 on stage. It was vibrant, and wonderful. The service was great too. The restaurant became an instant favorite of ours, and we will go again.
Fantastic experience! My wife said it's the best filet she's had. Overall experience at least in my top 5. Great atmosphere,service,food and location.

column4: 22 A St Gate 1 at Waters Edge Lake Lotawana, MO  64086
column13: Great place for any occasion. When weather is nice outdoor dining is great too.

The food was excellently spiced - not hot just a very flavorful kiss on the palette. The service was the best I have seen in a long time - fast, friendly and very helpful. KC is famous for BBQ but reserve a night of fine dining at the Marrakech Cafe, you will not be disappointed!
Cedric was very helpful. A great server.

column4: 450 Ward Parkway Country Club Plaza Kansas City, MO  64112
column13: The Melting Pot was very accommodating. We wanted to be seated near a TV in the bar area so we could watch a big football game and they did just that! The service was great along with the food and wine! We will return for sure!!!

The items my dinner date and I ended up ordering were the ones left after a long process of elimination because we evidently caught them at the end of a purchasing cycle and the first 4 things we ordered from the menu were not available. They said they were going to have a full pantry on Monday, but were out on Thursday at 7pm. It was good to see everything is created in-house and not pre-made entrees and heated them for presentation, and a bit annoying to keep choosing and hearing, "No, we don't have that either." What they did have on hand was very well prepared, a bit slow to arrive, but we would go back, just earlier in the week.
We had a large group for a family bday celebration. The entire experience was wonderful! Will definitely be back!!
The Prime Rib special was decidedly subpar. I was expecting much better food given the hype surrounding this restaurant in trendy Brookside.

This little restaurant is a jewel. Exceptional food. My wife had the linguini alla pescatora. Wow! Delicious right down to the last bit of sauce! I had insalata di guliano for a light dinner - just exceptional. The waiter was attentive and friendly.
we had an amazing time, great service

column4: 4005 SW Gage Center Drive Topeka, KS  66604
column13: I've ordered many different entrees and they were all awesome
Nice ambiance, good menu above average service!

The food was excellent and it is a great venue. We (four of us) were there for brunch on a Saturday morning. The restaurant was not overly crowded; however, the service was some of the slowest and unmotivated I've ever had at a KC restaurant. Normally such poor service would put it in my "no return" category but the quality of the food warrants another visit, but there is a difference between laid back and lazy. I'm all for a laid back dining experience but the service we received was just lazy...

Have been to North a few times and the food is always very good.The place was full when we arrived but we were able to get in without much difficulty.Good wine list and ambiance. Will definitely be back again.

The food and service was excellent. The bolognese sauce was excellent and my wife loves the Alfredo. The bruschetta is also very good. One of the best things we have eaten there is the Carrot Cake. The waitresses are so nice and not afraid to stop and talk a bit.

column4: 30 West Pershing Road #900 Kansas City, MO  64108
column13: As always - very enjoyable dinner

column1: Plaza III, The Steakhouse - Kansas City
column13: The Plaza III Steakhouse has such a reputation for great food and atmoshpere,and certainly lived up to it's reputation on Saturday! We both opted for the KC Strip Fromage, and the steaks were perfect. Incredible flavor, cooked perfectly, and a generous helping to boot. We had the Seafood Bisque and a Spinach Salad for appetizers, and capped the night off with the Chocllate Souffle. We also enjoyed a nice Malbec with our meal, that we enjoyed so much we ordered three bottles online during dinner to enjoy at home!Everything stacked up to make this an exciting and excellent dining experience, one that we will definitely enjoy again in the weeks and months to come.

This was my first experience at Remedy and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The waitress was very flexible in allowing our conversation to flourish without interruption (only when needed for drinks/ordering). The food was delicious and I highly suggest the cauliflower mashed potatoes with the burger. The chairs were comfortable and the restaurant was buzzing with folks from 6:30 to 8:00pm.

Set in an old school gymnasium, the restaurant is in the balcony and the gym is available for group rentals. The walls are covered with pictures of literary masters. Awesome atmosphere for small or larger groups. Food is top notch, too.

column1: The Rieger Hotel Grill and Exchange
column13: Everyone in our party enjoyed their dinner. A lively atmosphere and attentive service. We will go again.
Wonderful food and service!!! Will definitely go back.

We were in town to celebrate my daughter and a friend's half-marathon finish. After the race, we headed over for breakfast with a small group, and we were thrilled with everything we had! We were certainly glad we had a reservation as the place was packed. Every one of us agreed we'd be back for more! The service was excellent as well, and we even bought some of the house coffee.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Kansas City
column4: 700 W. 47th Street, Suite 115 The Plaza Steppes Kansas City, MO  64112
column13: First time visitors to the restaurant. We were very happy with the overall service from entering to exiting the restaurant. We were able to split our meal and have plenty to fill up on. The one lb. baked potato wasn't really one lb. so I recommend not sharing the baked potato. Will return for special occasions.

We were seated immediately, the employees were highly attentive and knowledgeable about the menu items. The timing of events in regard to drinks, main course and desert were not rushed. The food was wonderful. Overall my fiance and I had an enjoyable dining experience. The only thing that could have made it better would we could have had a booth and were seated away from the kitchen. Thumbs up. :-)

I can't speak for the food, but the drinks were great. We had a nice relaxed time and enjoyed the variety of drink options. I can't think of any place like this in Kansas City, the frozen cocktail idea is a good one for summer, I just hope they can survive the cold winters!
Amazing food and service! Highly recommend

The menu and food were terrific, but the service was painfully slow. It took an hour to get our entrees, which would have been more tolerable had it not also taken quite some time to order and receive our wine. We made it clear in advance we were not in for a long, leisurely 2-3 hour meal.
Great theme ambiance tucked in a strip shopping center.The food was simply perfect; great service; well stocked bar.
Awesome sushi rolls! Will go back again when in Kansas for sure, a really great find!

Fine food and atmosphere, however with a reservation we would hbe expected a booth/table for dinner rather than a bar hightop. That was disappointing and I had even made a special note on Opentable when Iade the reservation.

Overall experience was great. We had reservations and had to wait a bit. The service was somewhat slow. Most likely another night besides Saturday would have been faster service. It was noisy. My husband had the fillet and said it was great.
Excellent food and service. It's on my list of favorites now.

An excellent atmosphere accompanied by excellent service and food. A great night of dining and memories with my family. The range of ages for our group was 15 to 57 and everyone found an item on the menu that fit each person's taste. Our server was attentive and impressed me with an excellent memory to take all the individual orders without one mistake. I was a fan of the pork chop - the best I have had. Others enjoyed the roasted chicken,grilled scallops and a fabulous ribeye steak. One of my daughters made a meal and raved about the Caesar salad. We have decided to make Tellers our restaurant of choice.

column4: 701 Massachusetts The Eldridge Hotel Lawrence, KS  66044
column13: Our high expectations were reinforced by the nice decor, and the immediate attention of the hostess. However the evening quickly deteriorated with the poor quality of food and service. While 3 in our party sipped mixed drinks, the fourth member of the group never got his wine until we were ready for a second round! Then the food portions were scanty, except for the loaded potatoes, whichWere too big, and served cold! These were replaced with supposedly hot potatoes, but the only things hot by this time were our tempers.
Food was good, and server, Chantell,was very efficient.
The service here was excellent. The entrees were a bit disappointing, but the app's were delicious! I would recommend Urban Table as a great place for a casual drink and a few small bites.
Great food, courteous staff, quiet and clean. No loud music so you can talk and enjoy conversations. Will have to return there soon.

I love Webster House. I love the building, the ironwork, the location. I love the retail concept and the high quality of goods sold. I love the restaurant because you always feel special when dining there. But, on a recent visit for brunch, I did find a few things on which to offer some constructive criticism. Number one...what's with the scrambled eggs? They look and taste like they came out of a carton. PLEASE don't do this. Second...I love the idea of the rosemary ham, gruyere waffles with fried chicken. The fried chicken was awesome. I like a savory waffle, but I think melting the gruyere over the waffle would work better (never did see the ham). The fruit sauce was thin and made the waffles wet.
Fantastic experience. Soon to be one of our favorites.

Westport Cafe and Bar is one of our favorite restaurants. We have our favorites and that is what we had again this visit. We started with the mussels with tomato fennel sauce. This time it was a bit under par. Some of the mussels were less than plump and it seemed there was less sauce (to dip the bread) than usual. My wife's soup and arugula salad were very good as was my cheese burger with grilled onions. Can't wait to go back!
Really liked the food and despite getting cold coffee, everything was great. And they fixed the coffee problem just fine.

column1: Yia Yia's Euro Bistro - Overland Park
column13: I always enjoy the Sunday Brunch. The Caramel French toast is my favorite. We always receive great service.
This was our first time to vist Zocala and we found it to be a very warm place. The service was excellent and the food was above average for Plaza restaurants. Excellent seating next to the sidewalk.

column4: 2124 Bagnel Dam Blvd Lake Ozark, MO  65049
column13: Our first time here! We will be back! Everything from start to finish was fabulous. The view is spectacular! A wonderful evening with wonderful friends.

column4: 939 Premium Outlets Drive Osage Beach, MO  65065
column13: I went with my family and we were expecting a little more out of the place. The shaved beef sandwich was dry, as was my wifes Philly cheesesteak (she gives it a 4 out of 10). The manicotti was not good at all. Spaghetti was spaghetti. The kids meals were fine, about what you expect. marinara sauce and other red sauces had little spice and no original flare. the service was slow and it was not busy. Friday night at 830 the place was 1/4 full. It wasn't abysmal, but it wasnt good either. we will not be going back especially since there are so many decent places a stones throw from biggy's.

column4: 5166 Osage Beach Parkway Osage Beach, MO  65065
column13: Another spectacular meal at J Bruners! Great steaks and great service are a wonderful combination.

column4: 2260 Bagnell Dam Blvd Lake Ozark, MO  65049
column13: We arrived and were seated promptly for our 5:45 pm reservation. We were given a lakeside table as requested. We were able to enjoy the sunset with our appetizer. Service was beyond excellent. Food was wonderful. My husband enjoyed the prime rib and I had the scallops. Both were perfectly cooked and tasted wonderful! Dessert was amazing! We will be back!
Great restaurant, great food and a view of Lake of the Ozarks that is awesome! Great service by Mr. Webb!
The best restaurant near Grand Lake. Reasonable prices also!

column4: 13509 Highland Park Blvd. Oklahoma City, OK  73120
column13: The live entertainment (Edgar Cruz) was excellent.

column4: 6305 Waterford Blvd Suite 100 Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: Really like atmosphere -service was great but the food was just ok
I love your restaurant......food was delicious.......I will keep coming back!

Bodeans is known for their seafood, and they didn't disappoint. We bothhad (very) fresh Alaskan salmon, some of the best we've ever had. It was aSunday night; they had a 4 piece jazz band playing in the bar. It was agreat experience all around. Friendly and experienced staff.

column4: 5825 N.W. Grand Blvd Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: Usually, our experiences here are outstanding. On our most recent visit, one of the pizzas was prepared with the wrong ingredients, and the other pizza was split into two plates with the pieces separated and presented individually as if for a small child to eat... It was very strange and the server had no explanation. We sent them both back and on the second go-round, one pizza was perfect and the other was short an ingredient. The manager graciously comp'd our meal (without our request). We will go back, however, as our prior experiences were very good.

column4: 820 N. MacArthur Blvd Oklahoma City, OK  73127
column13: This was the first time there since they changed the menu. The food was the reason for going. Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but not what I wanted. I used to get the house salad with my meal, now I have to pay for it. I really don't mind paying for the salad because it used to be that good. That is probably the low point of it all. I was so disapointed in that salad. They told me that the German chef was no longer there. I didn't ask why, but if at all possible, they need to get him back and pay him what he is worth. I'm sure it will be a long time before I return. I took a couple with me that hadn't ever been there before. I talked this restaurant up so high. What a let down. Service was awesome.
Full restaurant on a Tuesday, good experience.

column4: 2727 W. Memorial Road Oklahoma City, OK  73134
column13: We went to Chefs di Domani knowing that it was associated with a culinary school. We were prepared for things to be imperfect. The food was better than we expected though the portions were kind of small. The food is what you would get at a fine dining establishment, but the prices are more in the $12-17 dollar range. My only criticism would be associated with the service. The wait staff seemed very inexperienced and nervous. Though the menu is pretty small, our waiter could not tell us much about the offerings. We wrote this off as us having a new student serve us, so it was fine. I will recommend Chefs to my friends and family but will warn them of the potential need to be patient/tolerant.

We loved your set up..having table service even at the seats down close to the track! We go to another track in arkansas with box seats and have to do all our own walking for food, drink, etc..Love that you can order from any food business and get it right at our seats!! We were there on a very stormy night, but I do believe people in your community donot realize what a gem and affordable time you can have at your track and casino!! wished we lived closer..we are 5-6 hours away!!

We ate here on a Monday night and the restaurant was unusually empty (the presidential debate probably kept some of the usual patrons home) so it was very quiet. Everything was top notch. An outstanding selection of red wines. We had an outstanding 2005 Montes Alpha M cab blend which paired fantastically with the grilled tenderloin which was as tender as any steak we've had. The highlight of the evening though was the first two courses - a lobster bisque and a mizuna salad with a blue cheese stuffed apple. This place knows how to do the little things right. Steve - our waiter - was a pleasure. One of - if not the - best restaurants in Oklahoma.

column4: 5418 N Western Ave. Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: We have been going to Deep Fork for years and it continues to be one of our favorite restaurants in the Oklahoma City area. The food is consistently exceptional and the service is always friendly and attentive.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Tulsa
column13: Flemings is always consistent in the quality, preparation and service of their food.

column4: 15 N. Robinson Ave. Oklahoma City, OK  73102
column13: A welcome new addition to the downtown dining scene and a great spot to meet friends.The atmosphere is sophisticated with an attentive staff that will make you feel right at home when you walk in the door. We ordered the scallops and the pork sandwich. Both of these got high marks by our group.
Enjoyable evening. Great food. Server was attentive and pleasant, however, got our order wrong on 2 courses. Overall a memorable exerience.

My wife and I left our young daughters with a trusted friend and headed to the French Hen for a, much to scarce, romantic evening. The French Hen came through in great form. Everything was perfect from our table being ready when we walked in the door to Tom, the waiter, remembering us from 6 months earlier to the spectacular food that melted in our mouths and made our taste buds cheer. I would recommend the French Hen to anyone that doesn't mind spending good money for a wonderful experience.
Relaxed, casual atmosphere. Upscale food options. Little noisy but kid-friendly. Fun decor and lively open kitchen. Attentive wait staff.

column4: 2701 N. Classen Blvd. Oklahoma City, OK  73106
column13: excellent dim sum servings. great desserts

column4: 9201 East Lake Hefner Pkwy Oklahoma City, OK  73120
column13: Excellent food, great selection for everyone's palette. Each visit is always good and highly recommend.

The grilled cedar plank salmon and steaks were excellent as well as the variety of side dish choices. The waiter was very knowledgeable of the menu choices and the interaction with him made for an even more pleasant dining experience.

The food was great, the wait staff is good but the parking is horrible. If you go on an OU game day expect to do some major walking. They had exactly 4 spaces and they were all taken up. The rear parking is not available on game days unless you want to pay $30 to park. YIKES! My advice is to NOT go on game day -- otherwise this is a great place to eat (though a little pricey).
Great restaurant!Great food!One of my family's favorites in Oklahoma City!!

Junior's is a classy dinning experience. The staff is exceptional. The quality of the food rarely fails to exceed expectation. On this particular night the service my wife and I recieved was near perfection. Just to keep the kitchen on their toes, the orange roughy was a tad bit salty and the escargo was not as tender as it has been in past experiences. My wife enjoyed a delicious 8 oz cut of fillet and the appitizers were hot and promptly served. Ovearall one of my favorite dining places.If I could request one improvement, I'd ask for a weekly special. With Junior's staff and the quality of the kitchen, bring in some high-end beef (wagyu)or top shelf alterate fish selections. I love the classics but surprises are nice too.

Heather and ally where wonderful. Especially liked that when it was time for birthday present opening they didn't make us feel rushed to leave. Food was excellent! I certainly will be back or would recommend. Fresh local foods prepared with love! Bill and Desai Robinson
I have been eating at kyles since it was Charlie newtons. I still love it. Lots of memories have been made there.

column4: 7408 N May Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: I always enjoy La Baguette and brought friends for brunch. A good time was had by all. Summer Suffridge, our server, was a personable, lovely, and attentive waitstaff.

This genuinely and uniquely beautiful and fabulousy delicious gem has become my sole reason for saving up to go dining out ~ it is absolute PERFECTION. They not only made my birthday feel so special and fun, the staff treated my semi-overly-zealous family with such grace and good humor that I wanted to hug their necks individually, including Chef Parrot, who was kind enough to come to the table and allow them to fawn in person. I've no words to adequately describe the scrumpciousness of the various entrees and desserts I've tried since that first night, but even my 12 year old had discerning enough taste to literally groan in happiness at every single thing she's tried, which speaks volumes.

Moderately priced, great food from a moderately sized menu, good service and not noisy. Every once in a while we enjoy eating where we don't have to enjoy the kitchen and its noises along with the food.
Liked the portion size. French onion soup was amazing. The other food, besides the steak was not very impressive. i.e. chicken piccata

column1: The Mantel Wine Bar and Bistro
column13: Amazing food! Great atmosphere and the staff were top notch!!

Really enjoyed the Melting Pot. We came here for our anniversary. Eating at this restaurant is an event. Plan for a minimum of 1.5 hours. More if you add some wine and the conversation is really good. Fondue is fun and makes the pace of the meal slower than most restaurants, a good thing in my opinion. The beef was tender and well seasoned. The brie cheese sauce was a really flavorful surprise. The restaurant is sectioned off, a good thing. But it causes sounds in your area to be really loud. You can easily hear your neighbor in the next booth. If you have serious issues to discuss, I would save them for somewhere else.

We love the Melting Pot for celebrating special occasions. The service is always spectular, the food is delicious. If you get a salad try the house dressing. They offer extras like flowers or balloons to make the occassion even more festive. If you want a unique eating experience - this is a must try!

column4: 6418 N Western Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: As always, our Metro experience was just great!

column4: #7 Mickey Mantle Dr. Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: Food was amazing. Perfect for a special occasion.

Experienced servers combined with a well executed menu makes this one of the best restaurants in Oklahoma City.The views are great and even when it's full no one screams to be heard at this restaurant. It's always a very pleasant atmosphere.

column4: One Mickey Mantle Dr. Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: The service was exceptional! The food was good, but extremely overpriced. It was a nice dining experience but probably wouldn't go back because of the prices.
Excellent service and the food tasted great

column4: 800 W. Memorial Road Oklahoma City, OK  73114
column13: This place is one of a select few places in OKC offering a high-end dining experience for a special night out. The steaks are consistently spot on, and the sides, served a la carte, are plenty enough for two.

Just OK - nothing elaborate. Sunday brunch had usual omelet entrees and a regular menu with mostly sandwiches. Tried the grilled smoked chicken entree which was rather over cooked. Came with very sparce helping of sauteed vegetables. I have mixed feelings about trying restaurant again. Dinner menu might be better so possibly worth another try some evening.

We ate at this hotel restaurant on a Sunday night and shared the dining room with only one other person. The lack of patrons did not detract from the quality of the food though. We had a bit of trouble with the wine list - it had not been updated in some time and they only had 3 bottles of Pinot Noir even though the list indicated 7. The Beaux Freres we ended up having was wonderful though and paired nicely with the cedar plank salmon (did not care for the sea salt crust on the salmon) and the grilled pork chop (w/ an excellent pecan-apple-bacon relish). The "roasted onion & roquefort bisque" was wonderful.

column4: 2909 Paseo Suite A Oklahoma City, OK  73103
column13: Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Food was wonderful, cooked to, order, and great presentation. Would highly recommend for special occasion.

I have eaten at many great steakhouses in Oklahoma, this one is simply the best. I had the strip and baked potato (no false advertising when they call it a giant, it was huge) and my girlfriend had the filet mignon and the sampler. The each portion of the sampler is also huge
Great Steak, Great service and awesome architecture.
It was my first visit to Rinie's and it was more than I expected! Besides amazing food and a great atmosphere the service made the visit worth every cent. My wife and I will defiantly be going back.

column4: 12252 North May Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73120
column13: Good for business lunch. Quiet, plenty of room.

column4: 2824 North Pennsylvania Avenue Oklahoma City, OK  73107
column13: Rococo is a brilliant Oklahoma City fine dining establishment! The fresh fish & dry aged steaks are delicious. Service is great. We had Rib Steak with Demi-glacê© & wine-reduction. Rib steaks were rich with flavor; the sauce enhanced the flavor. I enjoyed the fresh Sole with lemon, butter, and capers. My fish was a sybaritic delight! We finished with expresso, Sicilian Lemon-Ice, and an incredible Green Apple Rustic Cheesecake. Rococo is highly recommended dining in Oklahoma City!

column4: 6900 N. May Ave. Suite 7B Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: Saii offers a nice selection of sushi. The only complaint is that the service can be a little slow but I guess it would not be a problem if you are in no rush. Overall, everything is delicious.

column4: One Remington Place Oklahoma City, OK  73111
column13: Stuffed pork chop outstanding. Both servers were very attentive. The horses were not very cooperative but the restaurant was great.

We just experienced Smoke for the second time this week. Again, a wonderful experience. The restaurant was busy and full of energy, but we were greeted quickly and they had our reserved table ready. Excellent service and fabulous food. Our server was great at giving us suggestions to fit our tastes. We will definitely be repeat customers! Thanks, Smoke, for a great evening!

We love Sonoma, it's usually where I go with girlfriends for a good dinner to catch-up. The food couldn't have been better. One of our dishes came out wrong and the staff was amazing and very apologetic even offering us 2 free desserts. I will definitely be back to Sonoma soon!!

column4: 7628 N. May Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: Great atmosphere and clientele. Will definitely go back. A bit on the high end for the food - the steak was pretty average for the 30+ price point, but my date loved hers, so what else really matters?The beer selection needs more on tap.
I love the healthy food options they offer - like the roasted vegetables!!! MMM MM! I also was appreciative of the flexibility of changing and adding menu items.

column4: 4318 North Western Avenue Oklahoma City, OK  73118
column13: Sushi rolls were coming apart. Fish was not that fresh/good.
Great food! Everything we had was delicious. Service was wonderful. Hightly recommend!!

I had the largest shrimp that I have ever seen. They called it a Prawn and served only one. You read correctly. One shrimp with the head and shell attached. It was the size of a lobster and was wonderful. In fact we are going to be in Tulsa again this coming weekend for an OSU (GO POKES!) football game. Already have reservations to eat here again.

column4: 6714 N. Western Ave Oklahoma City, OK  73116
column13: Food is average, waitress was attentive and friendly. This was our third attempt to see if the food had improved. When you spend over $100 on a friday or saturday night you should have great food. We have decided not to return to West. Unfortunate because we live close by and it's a great location.

column4: 115 East Reno Ave Suite B Oklahoma City, OK  73104
column13: Food just wasn't was very good. I had the onion burger very done. Could be fun if a band is there.
Great food at a good price point. Service was exceptional. This is my 3rd visit and will definitely return.
Excellent experience. Food was so good. Hot mess rolls were amazing! Definitely going back.

column4: 5001 S Western Ave Sioux Falls, SD  57108
column13: We were celebrating a birthday, everyone was very pleased with the food and portion sizes. Our Witt was vry busy but treated us as if we were his only table.

The staff was very welcoming. I had the Salmon and it was fantastic, the sauce was lite allowing the flavor of the fish to come through nicely. The portion size was just right. My only negative comment was the sign out front did not say "Corn Exchange" only Bistro. Confusing for an out of tower like myself.

column4: 1325 N Elk Vale Road Rapid City, SD  57703
column13: We decided to give Dakotah Steakhouse a try for our anniversary dinner--and it didn't disappoint!! Food was fantastic....my husband had the prime rib (which was huge) and it was perfect! THe surf and turf with the snow crab claws was very good also. Our appetizer was the buffalo satay skewers-FANTASTIC!! There is a wild mushroom bread pudding that my husband said was very savory and the red, white and bleu potatoes were also very good. Overall, we had a great evening and great food. Would definitely recommend Dakotah Steakhouse to friends and family!
After tasting a few of the "tenderloin tips".. most of them tough and chewy, my wife looked up and said, "I'm thinking Schwan's..." enough said.

column4: 445 Mt. Rushmore Road Rapid City, SD  57701
column13: Amazing...I arrived late and they held my table, they also stayed after hours so me and my date would be able to eat a full meal... I recomend this to anyone and everyone looking to treat someone special to something special

column4: 301 S Phillips Ave Sioux Falls, SD  57104
column13: my group of 4 really enjoyed it

Expect to spend about $75 for food, drinks, tip, and tax. So budget accordingly. We had appetizers, 1 drink each, sparkling water, and entrees. OK, I got caught off guard with the price. Now having gotten that off my chest, I must say that the experience over-all was excellent. Food was excellent, service was friendly and fantastic. Also, we were repeatedly treated to "nice" surprises all of which are a reflection of an establishment that is committed to excellence. The quality of this establishment deserves no less than 5 stars. If quality, flavor, presentation, and service are important to you, then you certainly get what you pay for. I would highly recommend. Just budget accordingly. I hope to visit again.

Had the Blackened Walleye, not what you would receive in the south but remember, you are in North Dakota. The service was wonderful. Found the noise coming from the bar area distracting but it sounded like they were having fun.

Outstanding food, service and atmosphere. Crab stuffed walleye is delicious! Specialty drinks are unique and perfect. The bar staff is very energenic, knowledgable recommend the perfect wine or cocktail to compliment your meal.Would highly recommend. We've been there a dozen times. Heading there tonight and Saturday night.

My husband and I, along with a group of friends, went out for his birthday. There is a new menu. We each tried a different dish to share. All were very good. We had the shrimp, carpaccio and squid/mussel calamari for appetizers. Very good start. The duck was nicely prepared. The steaks were well-cooked. All the desserts were good too especially the croissant pudding. It was a satisfying dining experience. We will definitely come back!

We used Open Table to make our reservation, and when we arrived everything was prepared and ready for us. The food was delightful with a very nice flavor and not to heavy. Prices are reasonable and comparable to similar dining establishments. Perhaps some of the best Italian food available in Fargo-Moorhead.

No place to wait for table except trying to find a barstool outside (we arrived at time of reservation), table only had 5 settings (took 15 min to get 6th setting), took 10 min to get a waitress to take drink order, 4 out of 6 entrees were prepared/cooked wrong, extremely long time to get entrees (3 were cold), twice servers brought another table's food to our table, after voicing our displeasure with the evening some complimentary desserts were offered that took at least 15 more min to arrive (tried to ask for ticket so we could leave), reservation at 7:30 and left at 9:50 (not our desire to be there that long),

column4: 2151 Airline Drive Suite 1500 Bossier City, LA  71111
column13: Dined there for our 11th year wedding anniversary. Servers were prompt, attentive and friendly. Appetizer was amazingly flavorful. Dinner was enjoyable. Would eat there again.

column4: 701 Convention Center Blvd New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: 7 on Fulton was great for lunch. Service was prompt and the food quiet good. The location is easily accessible from the convention center.
A Mano was a real find. Great Northern Italian cooking in an unhurried, congenial atmosphere. Try the rabbit; succulent.
Fantastic place and friendly ownership!

column1: The American Sector @ The National WWII Museum
column13: Loved it. Can't wait to return. Prices for happy hour are good. Considering it for an event I am in charge of next fall

They are only open a couple of days per week for lunch, but when they are open, they offer excellent meal choices all thoughtfully prepared. Prices for lunch are very competitive with other options in the area. Although easy to get to, the plantation has a nice out of the way ambiance. It did get a bit noisy once a large group arrived, but this may not have been a usual occurence. Will definitely return.

Usually enjoy appetizers more than entrees due to their unique nature. Appetizers here were not outstanding but the entrees were. Sweetbreads appetizer just so-so. However the duck, the lamb and the drum were as fresh as possible and all quite delicious. Well done Apoline, would definitely return.

column4: 813 Rue Bienville Street New Orleans, LA  70112
column13: Food exceptional. Service very good-even.thoughvery busy night.

Had a Wonderful brunch here on a Sunny Sunday. The duck dish was delicious and boudin. This place had wonderful friendly service and the jazz was welcoming. Perfect spot in a great neighborhood to walk around and sight see.

A delightful cottage with a romantic patio, quiet and private. Staff was attentive and knowlegeable, working as a team. The menu was interetsing, with good variety. Food fresh and flavorful without being overpowering.
Compliments to the staff. They make us feel special! The food is also special.

column1: Besh Steakhouse at Harrah's Casino-New Orleans
column13: You wouldn't suspect a casino would be hiding a really nice restaurant in the back! The service of foie gras with the bread and butter to start the meal is a great touch. Really nice seafood, good steaks. Friendly service. Had a really enjoyable meal!
The service was excellent. Also, the wait time from being seated to eating was very good.
We really enjoyed this restaurant. Food was great and service was the best with wonderful waitress that had a super personality.

The food and service were very good. The ambiance left alot to be desired. I would not sugges this for a anniversary or something special. It actually reminded me of a cafeteria and not a restaurant. I think this would be a GREAT lunch spot or even late night dinner, but I would still recommend a change of the seating.

column1: Cafe Adelaide at Loews New Orleans Hotel
column13: Our experience began badly with a very inattentive waiter, but that changed when the manager inquired of our experience. She personally made certain the rest of our dinner was what we expected. Thank you, Ms. Picillo. The scallops were delicious.

This place is a gem! The food is lighter than most of the places we went to in NOLA. I loved how they used local ingredients. My husband thought their gumbo was THE best here --and we've had 3 including at commander's palace! Ô_This was second only to Restaurant August!
Great, great service and wonderful food.
The food was very good. The oysters on 5 sauces was wonderful. We loved the singers and pianist.
Laid back urban pub feel that has gourmet pub food with true culinary technique. Phenomenal...would recommend to all!
Wonderful restaurant-- thoughtful menu; great atmosphere

Incredible tasting food and a great place for a romantic date. The service was excellent, and the waiter even gave us a piece of creme brule since it was my birthday. The only thing I would suggest is to dim the lighting a bit.
Very fresh, inventive dishes. The oyster shooters are a MUST. The service was wonderful as was the food. Definitely recommend.
The food was great, service was very good, and the atmoshpere was very nice!

A short walk from my hotel and from the Convention Center. Prompt service.Very knowledgeable staff. I loved the pig cheeks with mushrooms in a heavenly sauce that was just the right side of New Orleans hot. Paired this with the shrimp and eggplant dressing which was just a tad salty for my taste. I could have gone for the full size pork entree with cracklins but was too full that afternoon. Next time! I hope Cochon will remain true to its roots years from now when I return.

Took a group of business associates to Cochon for a ice-breaker dinner. A few drinks at the well stocked bar (much better than expected beer list, including local brews) and then to the food. Service was great, a large group too (~12). I had teh pork chop which was delicious, really juicy and tender. Wine list nothing to write home about but its not really that type of food were thats a problem.

column4: 240 Plaza Loop Space F-240 La. Boardwalk Bossier City, LA  71111
column13: We were celebrating my moher's 86th birthday and we had a great time!
Had a great time. Food was delicious-service was awesome!
Table was ready for our large group as soon as we arrived. Waitstaff was friendly. Drinks and refills were a little slow but over all a very enjoyable experience.

column4: 2001 St. Charles Avenue New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: The food was not bad but not that special either. We went there for brunch. Our waitress was friendly but other wait staff didn't seem very well prepared. The gumbo station ran out of bowls. The dessert station didn't have plates.The live jazz music was a nice touch. The restaurant sent me a cancellation notice after I had left the restaurant.

As a first time visitor to Coquette, wasn't sure what to expect. Read about it on Trip Advisor. It was delightful! The food was artfully presented, a modern take on traditional cuisine. I can't find any fault with the entire experience. The desserts were absolutely spectacular! I HIGHLY recommend Coquette!!!!!!
Open Table was a great way to make a reservation from out of town. The process was quick and easy.
The food was exquisite and our waiter, James, was a delight!

This is our third visit here and we just absolutely love it. The food is always amazing and this time we sat outside as the weather has been a little cooler. We really enjoyed sitting outside and they have a little seating area outside.

column1: Crossroads at House of Blues - New Orleans
column13: Good food. We went early so it was relatively quiet. Peach lemonade cocktail was divine! Bread pudding dessert was wonderful also!

column1: The Crystal Room at Le Pavillon Hotel
column13: Had a great time at the Crystal Room. Look forward to going back!
Excellent food, good winelist, good service, nice desserts. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an excellent dinner or a special night out.

We attempted a dinner one night without booking, but were informed we could only get the table in an hour.But the reviews were raving about this place, so we came back - and with much bigger group (which grew almost twice the size since my initial booking, but the restaurant staff were very accommodating and understanding). So we occupied the entire back room with 2 long tables of 6-7 people and ordered almost everything from the menu to sample and share.
Great place to catch a delicious dinner before heading Tipitina's. Loved it!
The hamburger was fantastic. Turtle soup was great. The prime rib was too tough, but the management did take care of it. Overall, very pleased with experiences at Dickie Brennan's.
Somewhat limited menu. Very sparse crowd on the evening we visited. Very much hope it survives. Food quality, preparation and presentation was excellent.

After reading about Domenica in Departures magazine, I was hoping for more from this restaurant. It was good. But nothing to go crazy about. Service was rushed and very casual. It is noisy. The food was good. An expensive dinner that was rushed and pretty uneventful.
Don't miss the marinated crab claws. Also, fried soft shell crabs are wonderful; 1 for an appetizer or 2 for dinner.

column4: 720 I-10 S. Frontage Rd. Scott, LA  70583
column13: Very good food. Traditional and good south louisiana food.

This restaurant was a perfect escape from the crowded French Quarter. The waiter that greeted us upon entering was formal without being pretentious, knowledgeable, funny, and attentive. We mainly ordered from the specials menu and we all would have licked our plates clean had it been socially acceptable. You MUST order the bread pudding dessert- it was absolutely outstanding and this is coming from someone who doesn't even like bread pudding! At the end of the meal, we were treated to a visit from the chef, who seemed genuinely delighted that we were enjoying her food. Will definitely go here again when visiting New Orleans.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Baton Rouge
column13: It's always a special treat to go to Flemings. I've found a very spicy steak dish I love. The service is always perfect. The management makes me feel very special when I'm there.
Loud, but this the place locals go to. Great experience.

column4: 914 N. Peters Street New Orleans, LA  70116
column13: Our food was fantastic! The presentation of the food and the view of the river were also excellent. There was some noise from the banquet room but not too bad. Overall great experience!

column4: 575 Convention Center Blvd  New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: Had the seafood stew - average at best, could use more seafood. (for 20$ it was lacking) The restaurant was very loud as they had a live band playing right outside. (The band was good, but if you're looking for a quiet romantic dinner do your homework before going).

column1: The Grill Room at the Windsor Court Hotel
column13: Outstanding service. I always feel very special when I dine at the Grill Room. The setting is spectacular and romantic. The menu is fresh and creative and the food is excellent. New Orleans is known for it's excellent and diverse dining options, but the Grill Room stands out as my number one favorite among many.
GW Fins had one of the most diverse and creative menus we saw in New Orleans, we loved it

column4: 701 Saint Charles Avenue New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: Thought I'd be more impressed with the food choices. Some tables are now outside for sidewalk dining on St. Charles Av.

I chose Heritage Grill for a business lunch and couldn't have been more pleased. The service was excellent and the food impressive. My customer and bosses were pleased with the experience and now two days later are still discussing the meal.

column4: 321 North Peters Street New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: the experience was excellent. every course amazed myself and my wife. great dinner and wine for an anniversary!!!

column4: 1432 St. Charles Ave New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: The food was so yummy that I soon forgot that I was soaked to the bone after getting caught in one of New Olreans' lovely torrential rainstorms.

My second time at the Italian Barrel was even better than the first. Service was first rate and the food was excellent. This is a restaurant that I would recommend to anyone, except I am hoping it doesn't get too touristy and to keep those of us who know about this gem a bit of a secret
did not care for the music.....the food was outstanding, talapia, filet...Think the waiter forgot about us for a while.....service was good after we questioned the lack thereof.....

From start to finish our Saturday night double-date at Jacmel Inn was perfect! Paul Murphy, the owner of Jacmel helped us to select a wonderful Pinot noir, the food was exciting and delicious, and the server very attentive. We will definately return... probably on a cool evening so we can enjoy the many fireplaces Jacmel keeps lit during the winter months.
Tbe worst part about this restaurant is that I did not find it earlier. Every bite of every dish overflowed with the most incredible flavors. I can't wait to go back.

I took my girlfriend to eat there and we both loved it. The service was great and our food was delicious. I would definitely recommend this place and it is not to expensive either. Another thing I liked is that this place gathers all their food from local sources so you really taste the freshness!
Food was good, but I wouldn't say it's the best sushi in Baton Rouge.

column4: 10111 Perkins Rowe Perkins Rowe Baton Rouge, LA  70810
column13: Food was very good, especially since I am on a restricted diet of gluten free. Their Ahi tuna with chili sauce was excellent!

Very good steaks and appetizers. Service was very good except manager was somewhat rude when we asked for the air-conditioning to be turned away from blowing right on us. He just shrugged and said he couldn't help us. My husband walked 5 blocks back to the car to get 2 jackets

We were forgotten with only 3-4 other tables in the restaurant in use. Another waitress realized, took our drink order and apologized. The main waiter never said a eord about forgetting us or whatever happened, an apology goes a long way, too bad they missed that boat.

DELIGHTFUL! Calming and quaint, La Provence is more than worth the less than hour drive over Lake Pontchatrain to enjoy brunch at John Besh's gem in Lacombe. The three course price fixed at $28 per person is a great food deal; choices are varied, balanced, and delicious. Service was attentive and down to earth. Everybody and everything was welcoming inside this little vine-covered cottage...
Great food, great staff, (little understaffed for this event, building is very historic. A great hidden neighboor gem.

column4: 18135 E. Petroleum Drive Suites F & G Baton Rouge, LA  70810
column13: The lunch menu is awesome! Something for everyone! Cajun blackend shrimp pasta and crab cakes are outstanding. Just wish they were bigger portions!!

Appetizers and entrees were excellent. Service superior. They provided a pre-dinner appetizer and a post dinner cookie. My only complaint was that the dessert did not live up to the rest of the meal. It was a good but not outstanding chocolate cake. Ambience was lovely. Lots of candle light.

column1: Le Salon at the Windsor Court Hotel
column13: One of the few (if not only) restaurants in New Orleans offering a true British Tea Service. They are rare ..... and unique.

column4: 709 St. Charles Ave. New Orleans, LA  70125
column13: Although we were seated immediately, service was very slow. This might have been due to a lack of sufficient staff, but it was a Wednesday night and the French Quarter was hopping. The food was overpriced and not exciting at all. I'm not a food snob, but there was nothing from this visit that makes me want to come back. The highlight of the evening was the lovely sangria, but I can purchase a good sangria elsewhere and find better food as well. I would recommend trying somewhere else if you're looking for a pleasant dining experience.

First night of my first trip to New Orleans I was lucky to have taken Zagat's advice and dine at Lilette. What a great experience. Our table was ready immediately; our server was extremely knowledgeable about the entire menu; the room was simply and tastefully decorated with dark walls, white tablecloths, and black wooden chairs.We ate fish served raw and cooked; it was escolar and drum. Beet and walnut salad featured the biggest slice of beet I've ever seen; Steak tartare and short ribs appetizers were what you'd hope for. Everything was prepared perfectly and our server's wine suggestion was excellent. WOW!

column4: 14241 Airline HWY Suite 101 Baton Rouge, LA  70817
column13: Having lived in NY for 30 years it is often difficult to find an Italian restaurant in another state that lives up to my expectations. Little Village is spot on.My Eggplant Parmigiana transported me back to the restaurants of Little Italy in NYC.The Village bread is a must have. I ordered it with the garlic. The bread reminds me of the bread served at the restaurants of the squares in Venice. The perfect combination of light and crisp.For dessert I ordered the cheesecake which they have flown in from the Carnegie Deli in NYC and it is amazing.

The people who run this restaurant know their business. Their wait staff are efficient and well mannered. When I said thank you, I didn't hear "no problem". They got our orders correct and served us all at one time. It was a busy night. This is one of those restaurants that you can 'DEPEND' on being the same good quality in service and wonderful food. Vallan Corbett 10/20/12
Happy hour oysters $.50. Great burger

beer bisque was very good and hearty-shared it as appredfish courtbillion was delicious-lots of seafoodsteak also very good-tender,cooked to correct temperaturewill go back to try appetizer salads-they sounded very good

My wife and I celerbrated our 1st anniverasry on Oct 20th. IT was a very enjoyable,relaxing and romantic evening.The food and service were outstanding.We have and will conitue to recommend The Mansion at Nottoway to our family and friends.
As always, great accomodations for a business dinner with guests. Fantastic service and amazing food. We had a great evening.

Excellent restaurant! We dine here a lot when we have visitors in town. It was a very busy night, and you could tell by the service we received. Even thought the service was a bit lackluster, the previous times we've had wonderful servers. Honestly though, the food is so great I could have a chimp for a server and I'd be happy.

We went to this restaurant--based on Open Table reviews--while on a businessnss meeting in NO. We went by streetcar--the restaurant is a short walk from the stop. We sat outside, and traffic noise beyond the barrier quickly blended into the background. Food was inventive and delicious and "real." We would definitely go back on a future trip.
Great food, service and we were lucky enough to sit out on the balcony on a beautiful evening
The food is always outstanding... I wish the service was that reliable.

column4: 942 N Rampart St New Orleans, LA  70116
column13: i always enjoy. not for intimidate dinner too noisy great before the theater

This was our second visit during this stay. The food was excellent. I love the small, intimate setting. The entertainment was exceptional as usual. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this neighbourhood. It has a great vib, and the jazz is world class. It is a bit more sophisticated than the brass Bourbon Street scene.

column4: 628 St. Charles Ave New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: enjoyed the casual, relaxing ambience.
GReat experience. Excellent food, interestingly prepared.
The food was uninspired. I was not happy with my entree (carbonara Pasta).

column4: 2111 St. Charles Ave New Orleans, LA  70130
column13: Loved everything about Mr. John's Steakhouse. The experience is just like all the high end tourist steakhouses in NOLA, but without the tourists and downtown parking and traffic. Great local find, with plenty to offer besides steak. We'll definitely be back!
Best restaurant we visited in our short stay in New Orleans.

Nimbeaux's once again did a great job in seating a large crowd and catering many diffrent dishs where, everyone was satisfied with their meal. the lady who took care of never let us want for anything and was very courteous and professional. we will as an organization contiue to set up lunchs for meeting theres.
Great meal! The BBQ shrimp appetizer was delicious. Steak and pasta dishes were great too and drink menu was outstanding. The staff was friendly and helpful with menu items. Will definitely be back.
Nuvolari's is consistently excellent, especially fo fish. We occasionally stray towards meat or fowl, but the fish is the best item on their menu.
I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. The food, service, and atmosphere are top notch.
We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at the Palace. The staff was friendly and the food delightful. It was a very short walk from our hotel on Canal and conveniently located from many hotels.

Our 2nd visit to Pamplonas and we can't wait to return again. My husband and I drive over two hours from West Central LA to eat at Pamplonas. The food, atmosphere, service, wine and prices are perfect. We have been able to try food like Foie Gras and Duck Rillette in an unpretentious and casual dining establishment that emphasizes great food, phenomenal service and relaxing & fun atmosphere. Definitely not for our children. It is the perfect reason for a mom and dad getaway! We are already planning our return trip.

Better than expected! Got the specials which were outstanding....flounder with the famous BBQ shrimp(already peeled) and the crab cakes with fettucine alfredo....mega calories...plenty enough to bring some home. Very different appetizer.....fried oysters on top a slice of grilled ham with hollandaise sauce......nice old school New Orleans vibe with unexpected dishes.
I had never been to the Pelican Club and I am a local. Food and location are great, easy parking in lot next to Pelican Club.Waiter adn staff were great.

The food was great, the waiter Marc was wonderful. It was a little confusion when we got there it was close to closing. Which everyone was stating that they were closed and as we we where walking across the street the manager and some of staff was running out stating we can serve you that you guys reservation was good. I just wants to thank them for allowing us to eat there we were from out if town celebrating our anniversary. Thanks again for your great hospitality. Everything was excellent!!!!!!

column4: 900 City  Park  Avenue New Orleans, LA  70119
column13: I am impressed with the food, the service and the ambiance at Ralph's. The dishes that I continue to sample from the core menu as well as the special menus have all been wonderful. I would wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant to locals and to visitors to the New Orleans area. What a lovely dining experience!
This was our 2nd time eating at Red Fish Grill and have enjoyed both times. The food is great, the service very good. Highly recommend.

Visited Redemption on a Tuesday evening...the restaurant was very "slow" (only 7 tables or so the 3 hours we were there), which may have accounted for the less than attentive service. However, the food was wonderful (the entire party was very happy with their selections) and creative! Will absolutely recommend Redemption and will, hopefully, be visiting again soon!
Very expensive for the level of experience

Teriffic experience at Restaurant Cotton. Upstairs bar was cozy, great ambiance, and food outstanding. Great renovation of an old space. I would recommend to anyone looking for an upscale place in Monroe.
Portions were huge and delicious. Wine list was electic but totally reasonable for a place of that quality.
One of the best meals ever. Will be back.

As a large group, we had the appetizer sample menu to start off. Wow! Everything was amazingly delicious. That could almost have been a meal in itself. Each individual ordered their main course and all of us raved about our choice. Dessert was again a sampler of 6 or 7 desserts. We were able to taste everything and we had no complaints other than there was more than we could eat. Service was outstanding, friendly and attentive, and professional. Highly recommended.
We loved everything about Rips. The service and food were excellent.

column4: 4800 Line Ave., Bldg A Shreveport, LA  71106
column13: Took family for brunch. Included toddlers and children. Arranged for one of the glassed in rooms. Great!

Well deserved honors for top new restaurants list of 2012. The chef's creations' were unique and inspired, What he did for creativity did not alter a wonderful taste for the tongue.Great personable wait staff. I hate to admit it but this place will be hard to get into once word gets around.

column4: 127 N. Carrollton Ave New Orleans, LA  70119
column13: One of our top 3 favorite places to eat in NOLA. Best scallops.
Great food and service. Will be going back

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - Baton Rouge
column13: We were treated like a king and queen by everyone...highly recommend.
Always great steaks cooked to perfection! Great service!
Great as always. Steak was excellent and service was outstanding. Another great evening from the folks at Ruth's Chris. We'll definitely be back soon!

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - New Orleans
column13: Too much salt and butter on steak!

Despite taking a 'blow' from Isaac, Owner and Chef, Ganesh, is once again serving up some of the best and more underated meals in the Garden District. We are from DC, but always make a point to visit Sara's when in town.

column4: Roosevelt Hotel New Orleans 123 Baronne St. New Orleans, LA  70112
column13: Food good, ambiance, service not so good. Lighting terrible.They have a resource but totally under utilized. Looks like the bright uncomfortable peacock in NY.

We had a large party and the service was great. The menu is different and it was challenging to order. Everyone in our party enjoyed their food, but nothing was amazing. The latke served with the fish taco was quite delicious. I would like to see this on the menu in other combinations. We will go back.
This is a wonderful family restaurant. Highly recommend it to everyone.

Food.was good, entertainment was outstanding. We were able to watch the LSU game on the big screen, listen to a fantastic rock/blues band (AKA), and then see the comedian Mutzie perform for their after dark show. It was an absolute great night!

column4: 930 Poydras St., Suite 101 New Orleans, LA  70112
column13: The reviews for Ste. Marie were impressive, but we were underwhelmed. It had more of a "bar-like" atmosphere than what we had expected. I had the salmon which was delicious, but the filet was underwhelming. We had been looking for something outside of the standard New Orleans fare, and while this was good, we were not overly impressed with either the menu, ambiance, or overall experience.

Everything served was PERFECT! No details were missed. We were somewhat shocked at the $950.00 bill for 4 persons. It really added up. The cocktails were ~ $20, about 8-10$ more than any other restaurant in New Orleans. Although the plates were beautiful, the amount of food was very small. All in all, a once-in-a-lifetime dining experience.

Wife and I stared with turtle soup and escargot. Both were excellent. The turtle soup was very rich and thicker than all most others like Brennan's in NO. IMHO the best I ever had. Escargot was surrounding a puff pastry with a great sauce. Not your trypical butter garlic or mushroom sauce. My wife raved over the cedar plank salmon. My 9oz filet mignon was ordered medium but came out well done. Also the butter topping was cold. Would have been better room temperature. The steak was still good and they offered to cook another one for me since it was overdone. I didn't feel like waiting another 10-15 minutes so I declined and they comped our dessert. It will never cease to amaze me how often "streak restaurants" miss steak order temperature
Great steaks and wine. Our server Melonie was attentive, knowledgeable, and had a great personality.
Varied menu to satisfy divergent palates.

Had some of the best Sushi I'd have had here. The ribs are excellent, with a unique but tasty bbq sauce. Salads are good and the house cut fries are fantastic. Can't wait to go back. The only downside was our server was a little disorganized and the service was really slow, but the food was good enough that I'd risk it again to return.

Fabulous food, atmosphere...cozy and romantic old New Orleans enchantment...However our waitress was nice, she was slow to respond to and anticipate our needs. If I'm paying over $100 for a dinner for two, I just expect a certain caliber of waitstaff. Patrons who were seated well after us were served well before us. Again, food was outstanding...owner/manager needs to have a better hold on how things are running...We were there for nearly three hours!! At times we felt forgotten (and hungry!!).

column1: Tallulah Crafted Food and Wine Bar at Renaissance Baton Rouge
column13: Food was delicious, we ordered the duck and the salmon. Mixed olive appetizer could have been better, came with limited bread. Service seemed to take longer than it should have, we found ourselves waiting for the server to pick up the bill from our table for about 5 minutes. Besides that, overall nice atmosphere and good food. Entrees ~$25-$30

terrable service !!!!waited 30 min to be seatedwaited 30 min for WATERwaited 30 min for winewaited 30 min for appitzerTHEY WERE NOT BUSY !!!!!LOTS OF PEOPLE GOING TO THE BACK AND STAYING, THEY WOULD WALK AROUND THE DINING ROOM FLOOR AND GO TO THE BACK AND STAY, MANY TIMES 15 MIN OR MORE NO ONE ON THE DINING ROOM FLOOR !!!WE WERE NOT THE ONLY CUSTOMERS UNHAPPY !!!WE WERE TOLD DURING OUR WAITE TO SIT DOWN BY CUSTOMERS NOT TO WAITE!!!!!SERVICE IS TERRABLE!!!!!NEVER GOING BACK !!!!!!!!
Food was awesome!! Lighting was a little dark. Try the Pomegranate Martini. It was not to sweet and had a nice after after taste.
Never disappointed at Tsunami. Great Sushi awesome view!
The food was GREAT! A unique combination of flavors in each dish that leaves you wanting more. The house-made ice creams for dessert were exotic & delicious! Definitely will be back.
Why is Village Cafe not eligible for points?

column4: 7839 St. Charles Avenue New Orleans, LA  70118
column13: I have gone here twice this year, for my birthday and for an anniversary with my boyfriend. The food is great and I love that they include a salad with most meals...hard to find that at an upscale restaurant. The service is always a tad slower than I'd like but I'm usually not in a hurry when I go out to eat. One thing I will say is that even though the waiters do their job I feel like they are a little cold and uninterested while serving us. We don't drink so maybe they are annoyed we aren't hiking up the bill so they can get a fat tip?? That's all I can think of. Thank goodness the last time we went we didn't have the waiter from the first time...he was on the brink of being rude. Next time I go I hope we get a warm, friendly waiter.
