The experience was wonderful. We loved the layout. Our entrees (Trout and Ribeye) were exellent!! Didn't care too much for the salad choices. Need to have available regular style dressings. Of course I am picky in that department. I will definately be back soon. Excited about trying out the lunch menu.

column4: 3000 South Carrollton Ave. New Orleans, LA  70118
column13: Food is good new orleans cusine!

column4: 2380 Towne Center Blvd. Baton Rouge, LA  70806
column13: This is one of our favorite places to eat. Food is always incredible and we always have a great dining experience. Great place to go with family and friends or a date night!!

column4: 15805 West Maple Road Ste 101 Omaha, NE  68116
column13: This is at least the 5th time we have eaten here. It is consistently good food & service. Every time they change the menu (seasonally), we feel we need to go back & try a couple more things on the menu we didn't get to. Their soup with chicken, curry & coconut is fantastic, and the ceviche is the closest thing I can find to what we have on vacation in Mexico. We have yet to be disappointed by anything we order and there is always something creative on the plate. On this visit I had another excellent meal. Fried coconut curry shrimp & chicken slices on a bed of delicious herbed risotto, topped with a strawberry mango salsa and queso fresco.
Extensive menu, excellent food preparation, attentive service, great atmosphere, all combine for a terrific dining experience

We really enjoyed our night out at Billy's. Coming from Las Vegas, we are used to having great food and have been mostly dissapointed with most Lincoln eateries sadly. This is possibly the only place where I've had well prepared seafood here. The scallops I had were superbly prepared, and the pasta was well seasoned yet subtle, my partner wanted to keep eating my pasta as well! He really enjoyed his duck, it was very flavorful. Service was great, and the Chef came out to talk to us, which was nice.
Looks rough on the outside but don't let that deter you. Great wine list. Wish they served domestic beer.
We had a wonderful meal and are definitely planning on returning. A lot of choices on the menu so we can try something different next time.

We celebrated my wife's birthday at Dante - and what a wonderful event it was. From the starters to the wine suggestions to the special dessert _ã_ the event could not have been more wonderful! Our waiter suggested a family style presentation of all of the fantastic food. We went through a series of savory courses that just kept topping the previous one. We_ã_ve already marked Dante for our next special event!
Great food and service. I have been there several times and love it each time. Fun atmosphere and interesting selection of beers.

My boyfriend was really looking forward to the paella. When we arrived, we were told that we would be charged for a minimum of 2 people for the paella (no mention of this on the menu)...I don't eat it, so he wasn't willing to pay $45 for just the paella alone. Quite a disappointment.
One of the best places in Omaha.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Omaha
column13: We had the prime rib special which was tough and flavorless. The sides of garlic mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were excellant along with the service. The desserts of carrot cake and creamed berries were also excellant. The noise levels were at such a high level that my wife and I could not hear each other. The place was only a 1/4 full. Not worth the high price.
Very nice place. People were great and very helpful. Food was good, but not overwhelming.
The service was excellent! We were seated promptly on a busy night (local HS homecoming) due to having a reservation. I rated good overall b/c my food wasn't hot. I would definitely go again.
Very good food and attentive service makes for a great experience. When the kids find out we are going its all they talk about. Pricey but, worth it. Chocolate Cake is a must for desert.

Hiro nails it on so many things. Outstanding Chinese and Japense food. It always offers superb service, it is a great family restaurant: very kid friendly. It is like a second home if you wife does not like to cook. Great in dealing with food allergies.

column4: 295 North 170th Street Village Pointe Shopping Center Omaha, NE  68118
column13: Everything was set up upon our arrival just as I requested. Wait staff was helpful and attentive.

I was really hoping for a delicious dining experience (based on all the very positive ratings) and came away disappointed. The food here is BY NO MEANS bad, but it is not great. There are plenty of restaurant's in town that have much better food, but perhaps this is where you go if you are not interested in driving past 156th Street. Also, the decor could stand a bit of a (or significant) makeover.On a positive note, the service was impeccable.

column4: Hilton Omaha 1001 Cass Street Omaha, NE  68102
column13: I stayed in the Hilton Hotel for meetings, I never left the building much. This restaurant was convenient for breakfast and very quiet. I ordered the breakfast buffet and had the cook to order omelet. The selection of food is quite extensive. I would eat here again.
I thought the food was excellent and the service was very good as well. We had a couple of extra people show up with our party of 8 and they rearranged our dining area immediately. Very good job.

Great place. Enjoyed the wine, the food and the atmosphere. The Groupon we used was a little confusing but they did a good job helping us through how it worked. I will definitely go back. Great place for a Girls Night Out or a Date Night.
Great place to entertain clients. Great food and service.
Nothing bad to say at all about this place. One of the best pizza places around.
Excellent food. Great service. The mushroom risotto was fabulous! Highly recommend.

column1: Sage Student Bistro - Institute for the Culinary Arts
column13: The group enjoyed the food and service a great deal. The atmosphere was pleasant and quiet for this type of meal. We really enjoyed it and will return.

We have eaten at other "Chop houses" and enjoyed an isn't ament atmosphere. Single Barrel was more like a country dance hall. We enjoyed the food, but felt that it was over priced. We will not be returning to your restaurant. We can get a good steak and a noisy dining room at Texas Roadhouse for less money

column1: Spencer's for Steaks and Chops - Omaha
column13: Our third visit to Spencer's. All three have been special occasions and all three were very special and outstanding in every respect.

We shared an anniversary dinner with friends at Spezia. The relaxed atmosphere encourages good conversation. Our waitress was wonderful, very attentive and had good suggestions for food selections. Our dinners were excellent.
I love this restaurant ! Hope the new location doesn't change things!

column1: Stokes Grill and Bar - Old Market
column13: Love this place. Delicious food, good service, pleasant atmosphere. We always take out of town guests to Stokes! It's always the first place our out of town children request going

Service was sub-par. Had to keep asking them to take away items and also replenish silver ware. Service was really slow. I don't live there but the people I took were clients and they do live in Omaha and they said they would not be coming back. Not what I would expect for the price. I had the salmon and it was really oily. Would suggest the restaurant pay attention to the details.

column1: Timber Dining Room at Lied Lodge & Conference Center
column13: My husband and I took our daughter, son-in-law, and 5 young grandchildren for Sunday brunch. There was something for everyone. Even the vegans were satisfied. The staff was very attentive and the buffet was always well attended. The dining room is beautiful.
Wanted to try something different while in Omaha. Food was good and hot but service slow. Still overall was OK. Would recommend this place for the food and location only.
Food was good but a little overpriced

We were excited to dine at the restaurant, and were overall pleased. The food is amazing and the beer is out of this world, and was well crafted. The building is so cool, and the dining experience was amazing. The wait staff is knowledgeable and punctual, and we will be returning.

Some of the best dishes I've had in a long time! Their house-made charcuterie is truly spectacular and I am so pleased that our server recommended their delicious and unique sweet potato soup. Our server was excellent and not overly attentive, which, to me, is preferable when I'm having a nice meal with my husband. It was such an overall enjoyable dining experience and I will definitely return!

The service was fine, the food was not good, especially for the price. Not one of us in our party of 8 enjoyed their meal. The lasagna was dry and bland. The salmon special lacking the asparagus/crab that it was supposed to be stuffed with, along with dry polenta and a very small portion of vegetables. The pasta carbonata was too spicy to even eat. The pasta/meatballs were dry and bland as well. The prices for our entries were $16-$26 which was too expensive for what we got. Even if we would have paid less, we wouldn't have been happy with the food quality. I'm very surprised by all of the positive feedback that this restaurant has received. For being such a well recommended restaurant, it wasn't very busy on a Saturday night.
This was our first visit. The food was terrific and the service was fabulous. We will definitely be back.
Our salads were overloaded with dressing. There was a pool of dressing at the bottom of the plates. The waiter came off of as smug and arrogant. We won't return for a while. Very disappointed.
We had a wonderful meal at Zurlo's. The food truly was incredible, and the chef came to our table to answer a question we had about his preparation/recipes. We definitely will return.

I have enjoyed dining at Amerigo's over the years. The interior of the restaurant is a bit dark due to the blinds being closed. Some outside light would be welcome during early evening hours. The food was cooked as ordered, and the taste of the food was greatly improved over my last visit. The waitress was excellent.
Enjoyable place to sit and enjoy wine, eat, and just visit
we can't say enough positive things about the Castle. our fish dinners were perfect and the shrimp w|crabmeat salad was supurb.
I'm from the Washington DC area known for fine dining experiences. Char competes with any of them.

column1: Chicago Steakhouse - Goldstrike Casino Hotel - MGM Resorts
column4: 1010 Casino Center Drive Tunica Resorts, MS  38632
column13: Exceptional service and outstanding food!!!

I was taken to CQ for my birthday dinner date this past weekend, which was the first time I've heard of/been to this restaurant. Being on the 9th floor, the panorama view of the gulf was simply breathtaking!!!! To add to that, the food was gastronomically outstanding along with their customer service!! I'll definitely be revisiting this restaurant.

What a wonderful experience. We enjoyed oysters, fried soft shell crab, red fish, penne pasta with pasta gravy, the filet, and of course wine and cocktails. Every bit of it was delicious. Katrina, our server, was knowledgeable, attentive, and fun. Chef Leflore and his staff are incredible.
Limited but wonderful menu. Unique tastes. Could tell that a great deal of care went into preparing the food.

column4: Hilton Jackson Mississippi 1001 East County Line Road Jackson, MS  39211
column13: The food was fantastic - and I MEAN FANTASTIC! I was with a group from work attending a business meeting in Jackson.

column1: Jia - Beau Rivage Hotel - MGM Resorts
column13: Had my birthday dinner at Jia and the wife and I were pleased beyond expectations. The food and staff were superb. We highly recommend the Mississippi and Lobster rolls. The entries were first class as well. I had the butter fish, which was recommended by our waiter, and my wife had a filet. Again, both dishes were outstanding.
Absolutely great southern food. A must try dining experience. Can't wait to come back!

The food was just okay. I will not be back. Prices were very high for the quality had the snapper special which was probably the best meal at the table, but served at $10the too much. The steaks were dellicious but for the price, not worth it. Do not get the sea bass. It is a big disappointment. The duck gumbo was great. A roux base. Go if you got an expense account. But tailors grocery is a right next door. Go there instead.

column1: Memphis Q - Beau Rivage Hotel - MGM Resorts
column13: Food & Restaruant was a disappointment. We won't go back again. Too pricey

Mint will never let you down. The food and drinks are top notch. The atmosphere is sophisticated yet laidback. You don't feel rushed and can socialize with those at your table with limited interruption. We love coming to this place.

To badthis fine restaurant is about to close the doors on the 27th of October. The food was unparalleled in that area.my wife and I had our wedding reception there and everyone talks about how great the food was. I will miss going there but have good memories, too bad I can't eat the memories.

Stayed up the street at the Hilton Garden Inn (my wife eschews chain hotels) and wanted to dine nearby. Made a reservation based on proximity and online reviews. Hilariously, as we were orienting ourselves, a man (the Parlor Market bartender, it turns out) stops at the pots in front of our hotel to clip some fresh basil! The restaurant is superb - a lively atmosphere, but intimate enough that you can drop in for any reason. Take a date. Celebrate an event. Or just relax, as we did. Chad is a wonderful waiter, with serving selections and Jackson Mississippi hospitality. The menu is great to start with, and my wife zeroed in on grilled oysters. I opted for selections from the specials. And don't pass up dessert!

column1: Sophia's Restaurant at The Fairview Inn
column13: I have eaten at Sopia's Restaurant several times, and have enjoyed it every time. I usually go there for business lunches. There is enough room between tables that people can't really over hear you, but it's quiet enough that you can speak in a regular tone. The food is always amazing! The setting in the Fairview Inn give the feeling of dining in luxury in the early 1900s. Keep it up!!!

column1: Stalla - Beau Rivage Hotel - MGM Resorts
column13: Great food, even better service. The tomato basil soup is fabulous!!
So good!!! Food was excellent and I cannot wait to go back!!
We love Tien for the food, the staff, and the ambiance. Always a great experience!
Great place, romantic, quiet and the food is great
FABULOUS MUSIC......FABULOUS. Every Saturday night Vasti Jackson and his band play at Underground 119 and they are just great. The good food and lively atmosphere are a bonus.
Outstanding food, great selection to satify any taste, freindly knowledgable staff.
The steak and appetizers were great! I understand that our server was a trainee, but she did an excellent job. Very attentive without being intrusive. High marks for all.

While everything at 801 Chophouse was ok nothing was near the quality you can expect at the Omaha location. The service was very good but none of our normal dishes had near the heart put into them as Omaha.

Absolutely no complaints. We had a group of nine and were even seated early for our reservation. Waitress was excellent and food was spot on from the melt in your mouth steaks to the awesome BBQ ribs. If you come to Decorah, you should not miss having dinner here !!

column4: 1312 Locust Street, Suite 102 Des Moines, IA  50309
column13: Downtown is usually desolate on the weekends, but this place was packed! The brunch was a good value, and I have never seen so many options on a buffet. The hot dishes were hot, the cold food was cold, and all were fresh and delicious! To top it off, our server (Ken) was perfectly pleasant and attentive. This was an all-around great experience, thank you!
Thank you Bass Street for an incredible meal!!! Much needed comfort food needed on a rainy night...loved the meatloaf and potpie:)
Great food but it took almost an hour for us to get our food. The server had to apologize for the length of time it was taking for our food to arrive.
Love the food, love the wine list, ADORE the service. I just wish it was quieter.
This is one of our favorite restaurants to go to when we visit Des Moines! It never fails to deliver EXCELLENT food and fun!

As always, the food was fantastic. Service was great, and the staff was very friendly. We were dining for my finances birthday, and they even comped her a piece of cheesecake. The wine list was second to none, and the mixed drink specials were awesome as well. And for a high end steakhouse, the pricing was extremely fair.

column4: 5513 Mills Civic Parkway, Suite 100 West Des Moines, IA  50266
column13: Probably the only thing that decreased the evaluation was that the table was not ready for us when we arrived and it was quite a while before it was ready. We waited at the bar which was okay - not normally a preference though, but had to check again if the table was getting ready.

column4: 109 East College Street Iowa City, IA  52240
column13: Fortunately had a reservation for Friday. Two couples ahead of us probably wondered why we got in and they had to wait another 2 hours. It's always difficult to choose as so many selections are excellent but I settled on the Steak DeBurgo and it was absolutely excellent. I wish there were more wines by the glass to choose from however. Offering flights, i.e., Cabs, Merlots, etc. were be a wonderful addition. The waiter was very attentive without being bothersome. Overall an excellent experience.

column4: 212 South Clinton Street Iowa City, IA  52240
column13: Prime rib was not hot, and steaks were overcooked. Kitchen was slow.

We had a group of 9 people. The watress mentioned that she couldn't do individual tickets, which can really be a hassel. but she did a great job of giving us our totals so there was no problem. that was nice.Karen Lyness
Our server was pregnant and very cheerful and fun! She was very nice to put up with our rambunctious group and patient with our needs. We loved her!!
Liked the new menu. And our server-Betty was awesome. She makes the typicaal lunch experience much more enjoyable!

The ambiance was nice and quite, understated decor with excellent food. We ordered the BBQ shrimp and crab cakes as appetizers upon our cab drivers recommendation and they were excellent. Two of us ordered the lobster, just out of curiosity as to how a place in the middle of America could get fresh lobster and they were superb! When we are in Des Moines again we will absolutely eat there again.

column4: 600 Star Brewery Drive Suite 200 Dubuque, IA  52001
column13: This was not our first visit. We have enjoyed the Star Restaurant on our past visits. The atmosphere was good. It took us three attempts to find a decent table. 1st under the steps. Next under the cool air vents. Final spot was a booth. Our last move had us moving our drinks and table service. Our server was polite but absent most of the evening other than taking our order or serving our order he may have stopped one other time. Requested wine list but was not asked about ordering until meal was complete. Food was good. Asparagus VERY hard. One stalk was similar to a twig.
Food initially was not very hot. Server (Morgan)took care of the problem very well.

column4: 227 Second Ave, SE Cedar Rapids, IA  52401
column13: Absolutely loved everything we ate at dinner. The risotto was suburb and highly recommend it to everyone. I am not from Cedar Rapids but will definitely go back the next time I'm in the city.

First two courses amazing. We sampled 6 appetizers and all were top quality, delicious. Entrees equally good food, prepared extremely well, showcased D. Ferneau talents. Dessert course was average - we sampled all options and the creme brulees were a runny egg white texture. Waitress was very good. Decor and atmosphere are not what we prefer. Liked the "scene" better when it was just Ferneau.
Food is incredibly delicious and it's affordable!

column4: 111 West Markham Street Little Rock, AR  72201
column13: Free valet parking is a big plus
overall my food was good but not excellent. it definately was not unique in taste but presentation was nice. most dishes were quite pricey so i don't think the food was worth the price.

column4: 2300 Cottondale Lane Suite 102 Little Rock, AR  72202
column13: This is one of those paces that is a gem. The building it is in looks like a typical office structure, but once inside the restaurant, you realize this is fine dining. The view along the river is fine and there is a nice outdoor seating area. This heirloom tomato salad was sumptuous and filling. The fish was excellent and the veal was tender. I look forward to taking advantage of it the next visit to Little Rock.

This was a special occasion and we weren't disappointed. We were seated close to the noisy bar(not a good place to be). Our waiter took good care of us and we appreciated his service. The food was great. The noise level was high and ambiance low, for an upscale restaurant, but I would recommend it. We will go back there.
We love this place! Great food and atmosphere!!!

We really like Lulav and have eaten there at least 6 times in the last year. Great food. Service on week nights can be slow, leisurely if you are not in a rush. We had the lamb steak and short ribs. Both were excellent.
Always lives up to expectations. Friendly, relaxed (but talented) staff, great food, good wine. Worth a visit.
Great place, service oriented.

column4: 2 Riverfront Place North Little Rock, AR  72114
column13: Nice restaurant, quiet when the musician is far away from the table. Food great and half price before 6 is a bargain. Waiters are attentive and prompt with the bill.
Fantastic food as always. We asked for a wine recommendation and were given probably the best wine we have ever had. Nothing but great things to say about this restaurant.

column4: 2703 Lakewood Village Drive North Little Rock, AR  72116
column13: Bartender was very helpful and made great recommendations for food and drink.
Best food/fine dining in Little Rock, Arkansas

column4: 411 Main Street North Little Rock, AR  72114
column13: The food was spectacular, even on a super busy night! There were several large birthday parties going on and the place was packed. Which is great to see at a small locally owned establishment! The specials were amazing, along with some great cocktails!

This is a very nice neighborhood type of place. Small but quaint. My wife had the roasted chicken which was outstanding. I had the salmon, which was good although I have had better. We will definitely eat here again when in Little Rock, AR.
Great food. Filet was delicious. Service was excellent. Chad had them put an extra touch on our anniversary dessert.
took a friend from Chicago to dinner at the restaurant. She agreed that it could compare with anything in the Gold Coast area of Chicago.

We had the best service and the food was excellent! It exceeded my expectations. We had a party of (7)and all our dishes were very flavorful. Truely a place you want to go for special occasions or just for a good dinner.

Unique atmosphere, but we felt that the food was over-priced for the quality. Its somewhere to try once, but I doubt we would be back again. There are many other restaurants with better steaks for the price. Having said that, the service was excellent.

We usually come every third Thursday for dinner with 6 of our friends. We usually are impressed with the food and extensive wine list, however on this trip we were celebrating my mothers birthday, and the food was just bad. We all ordered the $30 prefix. The first two courses were great, but the main course cordon blue chicken was just awful and dry and defiantly not worth the price. The desert course was also bad, a cold apple strussel. I am not sure if the chef has changed or quality has been dropped, but I was disappointed. This was my go to restaurant when looking for good food, but I might need to reconsider.
A Hidden Gem in downtown Sevierville. Great food, service and wine. Beautiful, romantic, decor
As good a brunch as we could hope to find.
Our only 'problem' was the noise level. It got unpleasant.

This was our second time at Chato, the first time we were with another couple and had an excellent meal, with outstanding service. Our second visit was again with another couple and our experience was just as good. The menu is great and the specials were excellent. On both visits we have shared entree's and the kitchen happily obliged by splitting and presenting the shared dish. We've found the service to be attentive without hovering and the servers well informed as to what the chef was doing that was special or unique. The wine list is solid with some good French wines and the "usual suspects" from California. Chato is a little more expensive than its competitors but is also unique in its approach to classic French brasserie fare.
Great food! First time visiting Knoxville and used Open Table to reserve. Cheese board was great, salmon was excellent. I would go back.

We had the BEST meal at Easy Bistro. Our server was fantastic and he was very enthusiastic about the food, which made us excited. He was exactly right. The brisket was phenomenal, the duck was outstanding with a crisp outer shell, and the scallops were heavenly. We enjoyed some fine wine from the reserve list. Our company was the best too!

Noone to great me at the entrance. I went straight to the bar where there was the bartender. I was not really impressed by the food. Maybe it was not the best night. Will give it a try another time, to check.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Knoxville
column13: My wife and I both had the Filet Mignon, I had a larger cut. They were good but I expected better since they only use Prime Beef. I was expecting to be blown away, i just felt the filets were average at best. Sides were generous in size, prepared and presented nicely. Service was very good and attentive.

We were so glad that we visited Gourmet and Company for our special night out. The food was delicious and the service outstanding. The restaurant has a lovely ambiance, just perfect for a romantic, quiet dinner.

The food is good and they have enough varity to accommodate different taste. Service was very good, never had problems in the few times visited. Pricing is moderate when compared to other local restaurants of the same category. Parking can be an issue downtown, but they are located next to a parking garage. They will validate your parking, which adds to enjoying the overall experience.
Took my wife here on a date. They were able to recommend a Margarita that my wife loved and the food was very good. We will probably go back sometime.
Excellent concept - great for parties or romantic evenings
The service was teriffic and the food great. The presentation was good, all cooked to our request, changes to thedinner side were accommodated.
It was a our 4th anniversary, so we wanted romantic. I wanted live music, he wanted a wine list. We both got what we wanted, the food, the music, everything was lovely!

The main problem was the poor service were received. I ordered a drink form the bar, which was served in a narrow glass and had heavy condensation on the outside. When I was drinking it, it slipped from my fingers and spilled all over the table and myself. This of course, was an already embarassing situation. A waiter then came over to assist in the cleanup, but he made some very rude comments, including "this is what happens after you've had 9 drinks" and "when I leave this table, I'm judging you." While I do believe he was trying to lighten the situation, it made me feel worse, and made my husband upset. I had not been drinking that night, and it was a simply accident handled improperly.

This location has some nice river views and the atmosphere is relaxed. The food is consistently very good. It's a steak house, so the menu emphasizes that. If there was a little more variety on the menu I might call the food outstanding. The wine list is respectable with reasonable range of pricing. The service is outstanding - attentive and friendly, but not intrusive.

column4: 1120 Houston Street Suite A110 Chattanooga, TN  37402
column13: We were huge fans of Hiroshi's on Main and very disappointed when he closed his restaurant. A few months ago Sekisui opened at the old Table Two address and we were hesitant to try it since the Sekisui on Market had not been our favorite sushi place.
We had a wonderful experience dining at Sisters. It was my friend's birthday and it certainly was a special dinner.

Very Friendly and engaging waitstaff. Gracious and helpful hostess. We asked for romantictable for to, and they got us an upstairs lounge/booth...perfect. Food was inventive,well prepared and finely presented.
We were visiting from Birmingham, Alabama. St. John's was recommended by a friend from Chattanooga for a special evening with my wife for dinner. It exceeded our expectations.

column4: 1216 W. State of Franklin Johnson City, TN  37604
column13: The food was great, the atmosphere was great.
Good food and good service. Always a nice place to go with family or friends.

although we had a reservation at B.B. King's Blues Club and got a second confirmation one day before there was a privat event this evening until 8 p.m. which we didn't know. They asked us to come back at 8 p.m. and gave us a discount on the bill. At first we were disapointed because we were hungry. But the food was delicious and the live music was great. We enjoyed it very much.

The food was wonderful. The cheese selections were extensive, and the waiter very helpful in picking out a few kinds that we really enjoyed. The grilled endive and ridiccio salad was delicious, as was the carbonara. Will definitely return, though the prices were a bit on the high side, so this will be a special occasion restaurant for sure.
Fantastic food-fresh, local ingredients prepared and presented beautifully. Creative dishes and funky and fun atmosphere. One of our top meals during our stay in Memphis/Nashville area.

My wife and I enjoy Benihana and she choose it for our 20th anniversary. They treated us well and seemed to go beyond for the "speical" occassion once they found out. The food was cooked to order and the sushi we ordered was fresh and abundant... as usual we didn't walk away hungury.

The ambiance was very good. The food was not. The dressing on the salad was very bitter. I ordered the chicken with balsamic glaze. The glaze was sour and ruined the chicken which by the way would have been very good without the glaze. My first choice was to order the Filet but the only choice of potatoes I had was french fries. The waiter was not surprised when we expressed our disappointment with the food although he never inquired why.
Always a great experience and great food!!

We had a horrible waiter. Our appetizer/soup did not arrive at the same time; waited 20 minutes for that. Then, all the other tables got their food, but us. Those diners came way after us. We waited another 30 minutes for our main meal after having to remind/wave to the waiter.
Great tastes. Great value. Been there 3 times and each and every time, food has been fantastic.
Friendly ambience. Lots of young adults. Excellenent service. Will go back anytime.
Outstanding food and service. Wonderful variety.
Been to this restaurant many times, when we are in town. Never disappoints, food is great, and such imagination with ingredients. Definitely recommend.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Memphis
column13: We always enjoy Flemings. This time the staeks were not all that tender. My wife had the filet skewers and I had a ribeye. Very tasty but a little tough.The rest was great.

Flight was fabulous! From the moment we entered we were treated as if we were the only ones there, which we most certainly were not! Our wine, appetizers, entrees and desserts were perfectly prepared & presented, as well as delicious, we had a perfect table in the front window so we could watch life on Main St, and our service was efficient and attentive. We had an exquisite dining experience at Flight. Can't wait to visit Memphis again so I can return to Flight!
Nice space and nice people. Convenient for dinner before performance at Theater Memphis. Might have ordered wrong things but found the food disappointing. So, mixed bag but good potential.
Always great. Never disappoints.

Our two couples went to Itta Bena before a show at the Orpheum. We ordered off the special menu they had for those attending the show. 3 course meal for $35 and all three were excellent. Very attentive service and a very pleasurable experience. We will be back.
We had a wonderful time. Service was great.
Always fun! Great place to celebrate birthdays!

We have been coming to this restaurant for three years and hands down Sunday evening was our WORST experience. We sat for almost 10 minutes before we had to ask if we had a server... The place wasn't even crowded. We ordered appetizers and half way through they brought out dinner which we had them take back. You could just observe by watching around us how "off" everything was. Majestic has the BEST hamburger and we hope to come back but I don't know. We have brought friends and groups to dine here by will hesitate in the future. What's going on? New chef? New owner? HELP.

What a wonderful find. We arrived in Memphis late and went to McEwen's based on the previous Open Table reviews. We were not disappointed. The food was imaginative and very delicious. It was so good, in fact, that we ate there both nights we were in Memphis. The atmosphere was grown up but not stuffy, it was definitely not a loud, touristy place.
We always have a good time at the melting pot. Made same day reservations for two and were seated promptly. Wine was great service was even better.

seated promptly in a nice back booth. salads good. my food was good. my husbands, however, shrimp and grits, was horrible. shrimp was chewing and grits were lumpy and like paste. dessert: buttermilk pie was good. chocolate creme brulee' was inedible. they put something hot in the mix. (choclate and cayenne pepper or such? not a good mix. i don't think we will be coming back unless the food improves greatly.

column1: Paulette's Restaurant at the River Inn of Harbor Town
column13: Seemed to be very busy. Wife and I waited 30 minutes just for a menu. Must have been a bad morning for the staff, certainly wasn't typical.
This is one of the best restaurants in Memphis. The food is so creative and delicious, with many local items. Had speckled trout from the Gulf for the first time - was wonderful. Don't miss it!

column4: 6120 Poplar Avenue, Regalia Shopping Center Regalia Shopping Center Memphis, TN  38119
column13: Ruths Chris in Memphis never disappoints with professional service and high quality food. This visit was for a birthday celebration with family, and we were served by Sonia (who is always #1 on my list). The current "Classics" menu is outstanding and the 6 ounce filet and Caribbean lobster tail was tasty and appropriately priced. I highly recommend this restaurant due to outstanding service and high-quality excellent food. The only negative I could think of would be that no member of management checked on us like normal during this particular visit, but I can understand when Sonia is the server since he or she knows there should be no complaints! A++
Love it!!!

Was hungry for Japanese food after an 8 hour drive. Found this on Open Table. I would definitely consider it to be a casual dining establishment. No need to get dressed up, and probably no need for reservations. Granted, we went to dinner early (6:30 p.m.) and there was plenty of seating available (booths, bar, sushi bar and tables). The food was good and so was the service. The food was reasonably priced and fast. My mom and I had 'early bird specials' which are served 5-7 p.m. and were the equivalent of a great lunch special. (Think sushi/nigiri plate with soup and salad for $9.99). It was a nice meal, relaxing, - no frills and affordable.
Best sushi for the price in town. Cozy and comfortable always consistent.
It was just my friend and I grabbing something to eat late. It was a great night we had.
Food was great.. service was great. Love the place and we will be going back.

column4: 1250 North Germantown Parkway. Ste.105 Cordova, TN  38016
column13: The food is especially good, Hot and spicey items are really HOT and SPICEY. Good food and great wine.

Went to lunch with a friend. We got there when they opened at 11am. We were the only ones in the place other than employee's, which is understandable as it was a Tuesday. Pleasantly surprised to find that they offer a lunch special .. meat and 3 vegies .. My friend had the special, Hamburger Steak with gravy, onions & yams, mashed potato's with gravy and cucumber salad. She normally doesn't each much and I was astonished that we didn't need to go for her left overs. There were no left overs! She truly enjoyed every bite! I had the grilled chicken sandwich and WOW! I eat a lot of grilled chicken and Nobody can beat this sandwich. It was guaranteed the best grilled chicken sandwich that i have had in a very long time.I will be back !!
Nice atmosphere. Very warm and intimate. Food was outstanding, especially the desserts.
Great experience. Food was very good. Service was great. They great care of my wife's gluten free dietary needs. Hopefully we'll be back.
The new Farm Fresh menu is the best. Try the ravioli!
The food and service were great. I had the steak and it was seasoned and cooked perfect. We will return next time we are in Nashville.

Food was great except for the Beef Tenderloin, instead of medium it was medium well. Other than that it was delicious and the piano playing was an added benefit to the ambiance. We will definitely be returning when we are in Franklin.

We have eaten there before and always thought it was great but after spending $75 for just 5 of us; we think there are better options out there.....for the same or less money. Just too costly for what you truly get....consider competitor restaurants and their value; we probably won't be going back....They don't even pack up your leftovers for you which would be a classy move; Mazianos at least does that.....

Their menu has always been fun and the quality of the food has gotten a lot better in the last few years. I was really impressed and loved everything I ordered. The cabanas are great for large groups. If you are a Vandy student you can pay with your meal money!
Great service; excellent stacked salad and pasta/scallop dish.

For a chain, Cantina Loredo has a nice menu full of flavorful choices. Given that this particular restaurant in located in the trendy "Gulch" area of Nashville the ambiance inside is completely lacking though - drab, uninteresting etc. However, the wait-staff was excellent (Derek) - always attentive with a full understanding of the food and drink menus.
Excellent, as always. Great food and service. Wine list is very pricey, and even the corkage fee ($25) is high. Make sure the bottle of wine you take with you is a good one!

Worst place I've been to in a while . Server was trying to get us in and out and there was no one there waiting for a table . Shrimp n grits /blah . Lettuce wraps tiny and blah. My Caesar salad was literally the innermost TWO pieces of romain aoprox 6 in long and 1 inch wise with what looked like vinegarret on it. Won't be going back.
veggie pizza very nice. menu makes me want to return often. not boring, for sure!
Simply an excellent place to go in Franklin - perfect size - excellent food and drink options and the 3 meals my party had were great - will certanly go again!
THe food was terrible...our waiter was more worried about other tables than ours...it was my daughters birthday and not very fun!!!!!

My mom and I chose eat because of their advertised pickled fried chicken. Upon menu inspection, we discovered that pickled fried chicken is only served on mondays. We informed our lovely waitress, Jessica, who asked the chef if he had any he could make for us. The chef sent out several pieces of chicken, in addition to a side of Mac n cheese. It was delightful. Everything else we ordered was phenomenal. The meal would not have been nearly so memorable had we not been waited on by Jessica. Eh really went above and beyond.

F. Scott's is not just a wonderful restaurant, it is a wonderful experience. The staff was attentive and friendly, the food was delicious and unique, and the music was a perfect backdrop. We will definitely return.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Nashville
column4: 2525 West End Avenue Suite 220 Nashville, TN  37203
column13: Great steak (get the rib eye), great wine and great service .... all as usual!!

The restaurant is located in an industrial neighborhood south of downtown, but don_—Èt let that deter you. There is valet parking on site and we felt welcome from the moment we walked in. Inside, this older warehouse or light industrial site has been nicely transformed into couple of attractive dining rooms and very unique bar area.
It was a very enjoyable experience. The food was wonderful and the service was excellent.

We went on a Saturday night and it was quite and not busy which was nice! The food was declicious if a little over-priced for Nashville and the service was excellent as well---attentive, but not over the top.

We had friends visiting from out of town and took them to tour the Belle Meade Plantation. It was nice that the Harding House was there to have a nice lunch after our tour. Menu selection was nice but we felt it was a bit pricey. The convenience was great. Service was nice.
terrific place, never disappoints

We enjoyed ourselves. Everyone was friendly and the service was great. My only complaint was that when we were seated I found it very noisy. There were a few people behind us that were loud. I asked about a seat change and told that there wasn't any because the place was already booked with other reservations. I felt a little effort could have been made to see if there was another space. I have a hearing problem and that combined with noisy group behind us, and music, it was a little overwhelming . Anyway I chose to ignore the noise and we did have a good time. The people behind us did quiet down. The food was great and now that I have been there and know the lay-out of the place, I will ask for a booth next time .
Great night. Food was fantastic. Fillet and shrimp !
We love your special nights. It's very courageous for a chef to create a totally different - and delicious menu as a 1-off!
First visit; party of six; experience enjoyed by all!

A bunch of us took our great boss out for a luncheon, as we always do in October. I polled the 7 of us with various restaurant locations and Macke's won. Only one of us had ever been there and the rest of us heard it was great and wanted to try it. Everyone, without exception, enjoyed their food. Our server had that innate ability to know when to show up and when to let us just relax and enjoy our food. He made us feel like we were his only customers. Thanks for a great experience in helping make our boss feel special!
The restaurant has an eclectic feel, - bookshelves and knick knacks. Loved the 5 course dinner and the chocolate Elvis was delicious!!

Maggiano's has been a favorite of mine for many yrs. However, after recently finding out about several food allergies (including wheat/gluten, corn and tomato) I was a little nervous about visiting Maggiano's again. Our server was wonderful. After informing him of my numerous allergies he invited the chef to visit our table and work out the details of my meal in person. Although I am no longer able to enjoy the pasta dishes at Maggiano's, the sides and salad were exceptional. The chef even prepared me a very special gluten free version of the strawberry shortcake type of dish. It was amazing! Our experience on this visit was so great that I've already made another reservation for this weekend when family will be visiting from out of townn!
Service was great, timely, not intrusive. Wine suggestion was good. Smoked brisket was awesome.

We have been to Mere Bulles for dinner & several brunches and each visit was memorable. For dinner we had filet mignon and ribeye steak - cooked exactly as ordered. Brunch has something for everyone, even the kids. The creme broulee french toast is incredibly decadent and is a must try!!! If it was on the evening menu I'd have it for dessert! Last, but certainly not least, the service has always been great. We look forward to going again soon.

It looks so unassuming from the street, but the restaurant itself is a gem. We had wonderful, thoughtful service, and we loved the brie and lobster macaroni and cheese with scallops. We will come back!

This place is AWESOME! Found it on YELP and checked it out. Many choices of fresh pasta are available as well as raviolis and several sauces. When our server found out we were there for the first time, he took time to explain the menu and specials...very helpful (thanks Jeff!) Great bread and pureed bean dip (sounds different, it's awesome!)I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back.They have a special on Monday...if you buy a drink, you get a free pasta...that includes a coke. Go there! Enjoy!

My husband and I were in Nashville for our 22nd wedding anniversary. We asked several people where would be a great place to celebrate our special night. Morton's came up every time with fantastic reviews. Roy was able to book the reservation on line and view the menu. Once we were seated, we noticed our name was printed on our menu wishing us a happy anniversary. My husband had the shrimp and crab cake and I enjoyed the filet, shrimp and scallops. We shared the chocolate pudding and sou-flee. Meghan, our waitress, took excellent care of us. You made our night very special and we would certainly do it all over again. Before we left, we were given a picture to remember our night. From start to finish this was a wonderful experience.
Looking for a fabulous dining experience... It's The Palm
The food was creative and delicious!

Very good food and service! We tried two of the noted specialty dishes that are "always good", and the server didn't steer us wrong. The Red Pony BLT wasn't anything like it sounds.. . .great ravioli topped with some great lobster (bacon & tomatoes of course) and a great sauce. The shrimp & grits that my date had was fantastic, too. The atmosphere is very nice and romantic. .. .the only problem is that our "table for two" was like sitting with people at two other tables on either side of us. Oh yeah, I would have liked to have seen more "by the glass" wine selections, too.

One world, AMAZING!! I took an ex-girlfriend on our first date to rekindle our relationship and Ru San's was a place that set the mood for an amazing evening! The food was outstanding and the menu had over 500 items and we wanted to try them all. We will be back and our friends are already invited.

A large party seated nearby was sooooo loud that we asked to be moved into the foyer as we approached the end of our meal. Acoustics in the small interior rooms are such that noise level is maximized. But I love the place.

column4: 2100 West End Avenue Loew's Vanderbilt Plaza Hotel Nashville, TN  37203
column13: This is a great place for a group - we had 25 people in a private room. The service was very good and our steaks were great. I ate a a competing restaurant two weeks before - this was far superior. We will definitely be back.
Saffire never disappoints- always my restaurant of choice!
The steak that was served to me had lot's of fat and our desert was not that good, we did not eat it because the bronnie was so dry. Normally everything is great.
Great spot in Green Hills for lunch or before a movie at night. Food is very well prepared and fills a much needed niche in the area.
Soup and dessert were good, Mahi Mahi didn't taste fresh (it was the "catch" of the day) and it was overcooked. Too expensive for the quality of food. Disappointing.

We had family in town and decided to take them to a noon Titans game. I made brunch reservations at The Southern. We were able to park in the Pinnacle building, have brunch, and walk across the pedestrian bridge to the stadium. It was so easy. Our brunch was delicious. Service wasn't very quick because they were so busy, but we had given ourselves plenty of time to eat before the game.

column1: Speaker_—Ès Bistro at the Sheraton Downtown
column13: I didn't hate it. It just didn't add up. The server was adorable. But, compared to so many other fantastic choices in Nashville for dining, it was overpriced for a dinner that wasn't memorable at all.
Very good food. Menu with specials enticing. Bread pudding to cry for. Excellent service!!!
Great place for date night. Service was good, food was fantastic. Portions were just right for tapas (more than expected). Looking forward to trying more dishes.

column4: 3821 Green Hills Village Drive Nashville, TN  37215
column13: The food was absolutely delicious at Table 3 from the beet and goat cheese salad to the pork shoulder with white beans.

We have been to Tayst a few other times and the food has always been excellent; however, we especially enjoyed our selections this visit. Our waiter was exceptional as well. Clearly, we are very sorry they have chosen to sell as they have offered a unique dining option for the area.

Able to get same day reservation. Appetizer, main course, and dessert were terrific. Waitress was great. The only negative was it felt like we were sitting in a major draft and almost wanted to coats back on.
Not sure what has happened here..change of owner? Food quality is down, sushi bar moved to kitchen, bartender and special drinks...gone.Not worth a return trip now, sad because it is close by
Excellent food and tremendous service.
Butternut squash appetizer and PEI mussels were wonderful! Service is always great and we love the ambience. They are always ahead of the curve with wine and drink selections as well!
I recently enrolled at Vanderbilt University and Zumi Sushi is my go-to sushi place. I love the atmosphere, the experience, and most of all the sushi! I would highly recommend to anyone.
sevice and quality of food not up to review ratings

Our food was fantastic. The Grana Padano ham carpaccio had us all but licking the plate clean. My black Halibut was perfectly cooked, and her Prime NY Strip was nothing short of transcendent--a real surprise in a non-steakhouse outfit like Avo. The derby ice cream sandwich was lackluster and tasted bought, but other than that the food impressed. Oh, and the Burly 2007 cab they had at half-price was nice and smooth.

column4: 6801 Cahaba Valley Rd. Suite 106 Birmingham, AL  35242
column13: Really enjoyed the food and the ambiance. Overall a wonderful night!
Food was really good - lots of selections at various price ranges - with a great beer selection and full bar. Definitely recommend.

The ambiance and atmosphere of this restaurant was fantastic. Free valet parking for dinners and beautiful decor inside. Service was great as well. Only complaint was that the dinners missed the mark by a bit. Three of us had dinner, one had the grouper, one the pork hock and one the KC steak. All of the dishes were good, but the herb touches overpowered all three dinners. Mine was the rosemary in the mashed potatoes, my son's risotto and the pork hock also had too strong a taste that detracted from the real flavor. My suggestion would be to use a much lighter hand in seasoning. The menu is quite unique and the beet salad was great, as was the carrot and turnip hash. Loved the place overall, but just a bit disappointed.

column4: 501 Rice Mine Rd N Tuscaloosa, AL  35406
column13: On vacation with my niece and treated her to lunch for her birthday. She requested to sit outside. Food was delicious. Service was great. View was beautiful! Outside noise from lawn mower, weed eater, and blower was disappointing. We arrived around 11:30 and it would have been nice if we could have heard each other talk but with the landscaping crew on grounds right near the outside deck it ruined the atmosphere.

My husband took me there for my birthday. The food was very good but the server must have had too many tables because it was the worst service we have ever had at an upper scale restaurant. He was very pleasant but we were unable to get his attention for anything. He did not even check to see if our wine glasses needed refilling.

I had a horrible experience! I got there on time for my 8:15pm reservation for a party of five & they seated at least half a dozen groups of walk-ins before us! The bar was too crowded to even order a drink while we had to wait! Stating that the diners at "our table" were finished eating, but had not left yet & didn't end up seating us until after 9:00pm & most of the patrons had deserted the place. Not only was our table not set up with proper place settings (even by the time they brought our appetizers), but prior they ignored taking our order making us wait even longer to eat. At which time of course there were a limited amount of entrees still left, forcing us to not be able to enjoy what we'd gone to that particular restaurant to eat!
Unique menu using local food. Chef is very creative and always updating menu.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Birmingham
column13: The dining experience was simply outstanding.

column4: 445 Providence Main Street, Ste 101 Huntsville, AL  35806
column13: Went here with another couple before a downtown show. The service was attentive and the food was excellent. Only problem was inability to save room for dessert! I highly recommend this place.
Service was okay this time. My steak was suppose to be medium rare and it was too rare. But by the time we got the food I was hungry to go ahead and eat and didn't want to send it back.
I believe waitress can be a littler nicer...
There were four people in my dinner party. The restaurant was not crowded, but it took almost one hour for our food to arrive from the time that we ordered.

As always the Ruth's Chris chain is the pinnacle of Steak Houses. The ambiance and service is always impeccable, and the quality of the steaks is outstanding. The only issue is the price point of this particular restaurant which also serves as the in-house restaurant of the Embassy Suite Hotel in Huntsville. Huntsville and the greater Madison area has numerous Steak houses that are of a comparable quality (albeit a slightly lower tier) to Ruth_—Ès Chris but with a much lower price per dish. While I love Ruth_—Ès Chris, I have a feeling that we will only return to the Huntsville restaurant for special occasions, or wait to visit our favorite branch in Boston's Old City Hall.
A very nice fine dining experience...

column4: 3161 Cahaba Heights Road Suite 113 Birmingham, AL  35243
column13: Satterfield's is what fine dining is all about. First impression was notable beginning with valet service at the front door. We were seated immediately at our reserved table complete with white linen. The menu choices were excellent, delectable foie gras appetizer, arugula salad, she had some of the best red snapper she's ever tried and I had succulent venison (not gamey at all) for our main courses. Of course we shared and neither of us felt cheated with our selections. Dessert consisted of coffee, beignets and chocolate cake. We cleaned all of our plates. Our waitress was quite knowledgable and informative and so was the bartender who knows how to create unique beverages. A romantic dining experience with excellent food and service.

column4: 700 Montgomery Hwy Suite 178 Vestavia Hills, AL  35216
column13: one of our favorite sushi spots!!
Love to eat here...always friendly and great food! I highly recommend Shamrock, Rose, and Thistle for general dining or any special occasion!

Starting with what was done well, I found the steak well prepared, the scallops very tasty, and the french onion soup was one of the best I've had.None of the experience felt like it was worth what I paid. My wife and I would have had a better experience at Firebirds, Ruth's Chris... there's a dozen other places we could have had better food, and cheaper price.
Very good food and service. It's hard to consistently be so good at both lunch and dinner but they seem to do it day in and day out.
My husband and I almost always go here when we want a steak. They are seasoned just enough and cooked how we ask.

column4: 4790 Main Street, F108 Orange Beach, AL  36561
column13: We chose this restaurant because of the proximity to the water. The view was wonderful even though they are adding a deck outside and there is large equipment outside the window. The food was a mix for our table. My husband and I split a seafood platter and I didn't care for the sauce but he liked it. The other couple said their food was just OK. I would try this place again and maybe order something different.

column4: 365 The Bridge Street NW, Suite 125 Huntsville, AL  35806
column13: A little hard to find but worth it. Freindly staff and a great rib eye.

column4: 4453 Lake Ave South White Bear Lake, MN  55110
column13: quaint resturant with great food and service

column4: 3291 South St. Croix Trail Afton, MN  55001
column13: Food was excellent! The service was very good. They even prepare a few dishes at your table side. Our table chef, Kaitlin, was very friendly and eagerly answered our questions about the food she was preparing.We look forward to a return trip to the Afton Inn.
We are always a little cautious when it comes to buffet/all you can eat; but Aji did it right and had a great selection to choose from on the All you can eat menu!
Third and last attempt at Al and Alma's. Overpriced, low-quality, clueless service in every aspect.

Clearly,this restaurant has some of the finest chefs the twin cities has seen in a long time. Everything is good and done to perfection. We will continue to come back for as many times that they can stand to see our faces

We visited Andiamo on a Friday night. We had reservations, but still waited 15 minutes.It was extremely noisy in the restaurant.The restaurant was very cold, due to air coming the front door every time it opened and closed. My husband didn't really care for his chicken parmesan, but the entre I had, a pesto chicken and broccoli dish was really good.

Everything was fantastic! The service was amazing, food incredible and belly dancing was entertaining. When we went it was for my dad's birthday, and we had an age range of 16 months the 57 years, everyone loved it! We will def going back again!

Food was good - not great. Lot's of construction noise due to work going on above the restaurant. Service was lackadaisical, which was disappointing because this was a birthday party for my wife. Took forever to order, even though there were not many people there. Worst part is they screwed up my bill. Admittedly it was a little more difficult because I used 2 debit cards and an American Express card to pay the tab. But the bottom line is that I was over charged by $50 and am still waiting on the card company to settle the problem with the restaurant. Way too much pain and grief!

column4: 4365 Pheasant Ridge Dr. NE Blaine, MN  55449
column13: Waiter never told us it was happy hour. Told another couple who came in it was. Then it was too late to get happy hour prices for our wine. I had to ask the waiter a second time for my wine. Ordered the fish and steak. Potatoes and green beans were luke warm at best. The fish and steak were wonderful. Had been here once before with a work group and everything was great, so maybe they were having a bad day?

Had our 14 month old son with us. staff was helpful in selecting a table so we would not be a bother to anyone and respected our desire for a quicker meal to not prolong the meal (and have our son become "that kid" in the restaurant).
Great ambiance by the fireplace!

We ate at Axel's on a Friday night and it was very busy. I was able to make reservations on Open Table an hour before we arrived which was great. We had a wonderful corner booth which would have seated 6 comfortably so it was very nice for the four of us. They have a happy hour from 4 to 6 that we were in time for and we would definitely go back for that...special drink prices and we had two of their woodfire pizzas which were half off. We had the brushetta pizza and barbeque chicken pizza. Both were excellent and we had leftovers. Our waitress was very attentive and very pleasant.
Four Course dinner for two can't be beat.
Service was excellent at the beginning: friendly and very prompt (with drinks and appetizers); but we had to wait a half an hour for our entree. Otherwise good.

I would say overall, this was good, not great. Their small plates and toasts are a definite highlight. As is the very clever ability to buy half or quarter priced bottles of open wine. The creativity is clearly in the appetizers, as the entrees were underseasoned and not as inventive.
Chose this restaurant because of the many positive reviews. Nice atmosphere but average service and food at best. My wife had a filet and i had the pork chops. Both meals were just average.
THE FOOD WAS WONDERFUL. I WILL BE COMING BACK AGAIN VERY SOON TO HAVE ANOTHER WEEKEND BRUNCH
Eat something before you go. Barbette served tasty food in your typical snobby French restaurant portions. Even after an app, main course, and desert we were still hungry.

column4: Marquette Hotel 710 Marquette Avenue Minneapolis, MN  55402
column13: Wonderful variety in menu. Nice portion sizes. Moderate prices for downtown Minneapolis. Valet parking a bit expensive.
Fantastic place. I was very pleased with my visit
It is currently being remodeled so the restaurant is not visually appealing. The food is still great and we look forward to returning after the remodel to see the improvements.
We enjoyed the food and service. The atmosphere is old style local dining/bar. Nothing fancy, but we had an enjoyable time and would return if we were I that part of the city.
Big Bowl has a Gluten Free menu and even a Gluten Free beer, so that was a bonus for me, and apart from liking abig a bowl anyway, I will go more now they have the GF menu.
The beef lettuce wraps are the best.
We were a few minutes late for our reservation, but got seated right away. Food and service were outstanding as always.

column4: 1935 West Wayzata Blvd. Long Lake, MN  55356
column13: Friendly service, cozy atmosphere, delicious, trendy food.

We went to Blue Point on a whim, because my wife was craving seafood. We were pleasantly surprised! I don't particularly enjoy seafood, but the Seared Yellowfin Tuna was fantastic, and my wife's Halibut was perfect. They had a great beer list, the service was superb, and we will definitely be returning! Prices weren't for the faint of heart, but I felt like it was worth every penny!
Our waitress Taylor's first night..............great job!! Made celebrating a couple of Birthday's more than fun!!

column4: 11 Cesar Chavez St. Saint Paul, MN  55107
column13: Since my very first visit to this establishment some years ago, I have always felt that Boca Chica is the best Mexican restaurant in the Twin Cities, period!!! I enjoy that they serve not only traditional Mexican fare, but also some non-traditional Mexican fare. Trust me, there's not a bad item on the menu. For a refreshing surprise, be sure to try their Kalua Colada. You will not be disappointed!

The wait staff was attentive, very nice, and polite. The food was good and arrived at an appropriate time after we ordered. Only negative was they did not have the wine we ordered, but our server was very apologetic. We would definitely go again.

I had the Pork Belly w/ tomato jam, although cold it was good. My friend had the short rib philly of which she felt the seasoning was missing. The resturent was to dark, the music was horrble, and the seating was uncomfortable and impartical. I will not return.

I eat here quite a bit with my daughter and decided to have a large group for my birthday. Our waitress was quite forward and therefore coming off a bit rude. Which was quite embarrassing for me to invite friends and family and be treated in such a manner. Spaghetti with meat sauce did not have much flavor. Shrimp Florentine was good with great garlic flavor.
Delicious! Had a great time celebrating my son's birthday.

column4: 12650 Elm Creek Boulevard Maple Grove, MN  55369
column13: An excellent resturant. The atmophere was amazing and the waiter was awesome. 5 star x2!!
Buca has fabulous food and huge portions. They seem to be very busy each time I have been there so I know to expect that.

Buca always does a good job. Food is always excellent. We brought a coupon in for a free garlic bread ($10??) and were told because of small print, the coupon was only good for one day and for carry out. Somehow when you drop $250 for dinner, you'd think they could work in the free bread. Guess I need to get glasses.
Great burgers. Best sweet potato fries and onion rings. Burgers are a bit pricy, but they are worth it.
Server pretty much ignored us because we aren't drinkers. Paid for coffee but only got one cup, no refills. Food was great as usual.
All the meat was fantastic, but the appetizers and salad not so much.

I reserved a table at Cafe Levain for my birthday dinner with family. I asked when making the reservation that we have a nice table. When we were seated, they put us right by the service station. Thankfully, my mother insisted we be sat somewhere with less traffic so we could have a nice, enjoyable meal. The server seemed annoyed. The food was good, but with strange pairings. Overall a good meal, but I would probably pick other restaurants in Minneapolis over this place.
Was very good BUT....I felt it was OVER PRICED.

column1: Charlie's at the Water Street Inn
column13: We went to Charlie's during a night away in Stillwater. The wine list was priced extremely well and the waitstaff was attentive and friendly. We got a later reservation and found that we were two of very few customers at that time. Instead of being romantic it was a little awkward as they didn't have music or anything playing. It was incredibly quiet so all we heard was our own conversation and conversations in the kitchen. It felt a little strange. Overall, the food and service was good...just a bit awkward.

column4: ES Bloomington 2800 American Blvd. West Bloomington, MN  55431
column13: excellent meal and lot of choices and perfectly cooked.great price on bottles of wine.

Generous portion on the potato curry. Large spring roll, perhaps just a tad too much noodle action, but tasty all-around. Good service. Somewhat dark in the bar area. I hadn't been here maybe since 2007 because I ended up finding better Thai spots. But after the other night, I think I'll be back.
Excellent service and food as always! : )
Food and service was good. A little late getting seated for our reservation but they did come around with appetizers for those of us waiting.

For the best experience at Chino, bring a group of friends and request a booth in the lower level. Order a variety of small and large plates served "tapas style" (arriving in no particular order) and some fun exotic drinks. Then sit back and relax.
Always a pleasant experience, with fine food & experienced staff. Consistent.

column4: 1607 Park Place Blvd St. Louis Park, MN  55416
column13: A bit loud, hard to have a conversation with a group or my husband...but good food selection and drinks are good too.

Very eclectic, but surprisingly wide menu covers a large number of the variety of cousines present in India. All of the dishes we ordered were authentically rendered, and well spiced. As noted elsewhere portion sizes are smaller, but the quality more than makes up for it. The dum pukht dishes are by fa the best in the twin cities. Highly recommended for those who love Indian food.

The food did not live up to my expectations. My husband's steak was very good but the scallops I had were overcooked. The chocolate molten lava cake that was brought out for desert was cold, and the tuna that others in the party had ordered was flavorless. Overall disappointed.
Food was good, but service was very slow. Not sure if they had an off night, but the tasting menu took a long time between courses.

Love the food here. For some reason it's one of the few restaurants where I don't feel heavy at the end of the meal. I don't know if it's the oils they use, or just better quality ingredients, but it feels like eating at home, only better!

column4: 3520 W. 70th St. at France Avenue (in the Galleria) Edina, MN  55435
column13: Lovely place, but it was noisy, difficult to talk over background noise.

column4: 1603 West End Blvd St. Louis Park, MN  55416
column13: LOVE that they have gluten free menu items!

column4: 3291 St. Croix Tr. S. Afton, MN  55001
column13: Food was good but wine choices were expensive and very limited.Lots of families eat here so it wasn't very romantic, at 8pm on a Saturday night it felt like we were at a daycare center!The tap water they put on your table in containers is HORRIBLE.I ordered a pasta dish, which was good, but you didn't get any bread with it.

Great Jazz and better food than last time. Be prepared to practically sit in the next table's lap! We had a 4 person table next to us and they put 5 people in it and 2 were very large so one of them was partially sitting at our table! I understand wanting to seat as many people as possible but its getting ridiculous.
Great for a pre-theater dinner. The lobster gnocchi and the sea bass were delicious. I highly recommend either option!
Lunch was absolutely terrific! Not much else to say except thanks for the excellent food!!!

The food was very tasty; We ordered steak, but if we went back, we would probably order pizzas, as it is a woodfire grill!The service took a little longer than anticipated and seemed a bit cold shoulder-ish. Could have been a bit more personable, especially since we ordered four courses-appetizer, soup/salad, main dish, dessert.
Very disappointed in overall menu selections. We ordered steak salads - kitchen forgot a couple of menu ingrediants and steak very tough. We need a good restaurant in our area but this isn't it.

The food rating was for my table as a whole - my companions liked their entrees; I was indifferent about mine, which was a stuffed pork chop (it was fatty and stuffing was indiscernable) and a sweet potato "terrine" which was very thin slices of sweet potato stacked together - undercooked and flavorless, unfortunately. The desserts - a flourless chocolate cake and a chocolate creme brulee - were spectacular and the highlight of the meal. The cocktails were also creative and delicious.

The website describes the menu as "chef-driven." Though the dishes sound appealing, no one in our party was satisfied with what they ordered. The margaritas were tasty. The table side guacamole (merely stirred at the table) was more onion than avocado. The beef in the fajita was very tough and should have been more flavorful. The tres leches cake was a disappointment since it was obviously not made on site and neither the cake nor the frosting were anything special. We dine out a lot and were excited to try a new place but were ultimately disappointed.

Actually, the food was very good. Flavor profiles were interesting and the prices were very reasonable. Service was "immature"- our server seemed new to the business, although he was very friendly, enthusiastic and had a great smile. There didn't seem to be anyone in charge which would have helped most of the service glitches

column4: 5331 West 16th street St. Louis Park, MN  55416
column13: Our group of 4 was so excited to have all of our favorites again. They were spot on! Just as delicious as we all remembered! The service was excellent as well, thanks to Bryce. Thank you Figlio for coming back into our lives. Please don't leave us again.

I was a bit hesitant to go to a hotel restaurant, but didn't want a chain and there are almost no other choices in this area. Was very pleasantly surprised. Food and service were great. The only problem was that I was too full for desert! Would definitely go back
Great service! Our waitress was really on top of things before, during, and after our meal!
We enjoyed dining at First Course once again! Love the Thursday night specials even though we did not all order from that menu. Keep up the good work, love having you in the neighborhood.

column4: 276 South Exchange Street St. Paul, MN  55102
column13: Brunch was just okay. Perhaps I just had higher expectations of what it would be like.

The food was decent. It was not great. It was expensive. I am a college student; I don't have tons of cash to be taking my girlfriend out to expensive places. But when I DO (for instance, for her birthday), I expect a QUALITY dining experience.

Gather was great! My husband and I were there for lunch several months ago and loved it. Because it is only opened on Thursdays for dinner, it took me quite a while to get back at night. Happy hour is great-- $5.00 small plates (all delectable), great deals on wine and beers, and one specialty cocktail-- all for $5.00. Great mocktails as well. The large plates are a gourmet dinning dream, without being "over the top" on dollops and drizzles. We had the Buttermilk marinaded Chicken and the fish, and loved both. The scene is fun and energetic-- feels like a Big Girl City Place! The wait staff are excellent. We will make more of an effort to think of them on Thursday evenings. They will be open several additional nights each week in Dec.

Giannis was excellent. The salad at the table was great, but wished I had remembered to ask for dressing on the side, as there was way too much dressing.. The warm cream cheese on the inside of the hash browns was the best. I had the beef tip appetizer and it was perfect for me after all the salad and hash browns. Loved the combo of the beef with the pea pods, very fresh. Wished the server had put the leftover sauce in my to-go box, because it was awesome. We'll definitely go again
Beautiful scenic. Views of golf course.
IT'S VERY LOUD and busy, but when the server did come, she was very friendly and very helpful.
Overall a good experience, but noise level was a bit over the top for seniors.

My sister and I had lunch here last week. We are both pretty picky eaters and our waitress accommodated everything! She was very pleasant and friendly. The food, as always, was fantastic. We will be back.
Small and intimate. Wait staff very friendly and helpful. Be sure to make a reservation on Saturday night.

Disappointing...I was looking forward to visiting the Happy Gnome after hearing about it and the great beer selection they have. They do have an excellent selection of craft brews but they are expensive. If I was only commenting on the bar I would give them a good rating, excellent on selection and fair on price. But this review is about the restaurant.We were seated by a hostess who didn't have a clue when it comes to customer service. Our food was tasty but served lukewarm. The wait staff seemed harried though their were empty tables near us. We won't be back.

This is one of the best restaurant experiences we've had in a long time. The food was amazing... There wasn't a single thing that we didn't love. This menu seeks to take comfort food to a fun/funky new level. The tartare as a starter was a wonderful blend of flavors, sights, and textures. The tater tot hot dish is a must... It is not what you think it is - it is a deconstructed version and the "tater tots" are really more like Spanish croquettes filled with this amazing porcini cream.

column4: 289 East Fifth Street Suite number 104 St. Paul, MN  55101
column13: I've been wanting to try this restaurant for sometime. It exceeded my expectations! The choices on the menu were outstanding and everything we tried was delicious and the presentations were really nice. Definitely will go back.
Food was unique and amazing. The bloody homer was delicious!

Not very private, considering you sit with two other couples, but the experience was nice and the food was very good. The service was excellent, the staff is very attentive and noticed the minute I was low or through with my drink.

We've eaten at Jensen's many times. It is an old style supper club - great food and service. The filet mignon and walleye combination has been a favorite of ours and other couples with whom we've dined.
This is a great place to have a celebration!

When we arrived they had trouble finding our reservation. We were able to be seated anyway. Views of the city are spectacular. Loved the revolving aspect. However service waz extremely slow. Took a long time for someone to take drink orders and then another long wait for our drinks. And then another long wait for orders to be taken and then another wait for our food. Once food arrived it was barely warm. However the taste was good. Our server found out we were there for our anniversary and we were offered acomplimentary dessert. But we ultimately were charged for the dessert. I will not be going back.

column4: 631 Snelling Avenue South Saint Paul, MN  55116
column13: Very nice local restaurant. We celebrated a birthday and they had a neat custom of taking a picture of our small group and presenting a print in a little paper frame (with their name on it). Food was great and service excellent. Will return.

Went here during restaurant week. The food was really good. I had the red tai clam chowder, lasagna and carrot cake. The chowder was wonderfully spicy. The waiter was attentive without being annoying. We will definitely go back. Only downside is it is on the outskirts of downtown, so remember to bring cash to make parking easier.
The food was great but the service was a little slow, I think it was due to the restaurant being so busy. The waitress was nice and very appraocable, but it just took a little while to get everything
This is a great place to have a tasty dinner before the Guthrie without paying an arm and a leg for your meal. The service is great when you're on a time schedule.
Excellent food & service in a very nice atmosphere.
I wanted to go there for the longest time, and finally made it. Just what I have expected. It was dynamite!!! I loved the food&service; the wine was exceptional!!

We love La Chaya. We go here to celebrate birthdays, anniversaries, etc. The food is fantastic - especially the chocolate cake - and we are always pleasantly surprised by the wonderful combinations of flavors.

column4: 3442 Lake Elmo Avenue North Lake Elmo, MN  55042
column13: We celebrated our friends' anniversary. The wine was great; the ambiance was perfect; the food was outstanding; the chocolate covered strawberries were the perfect touch! Thank you.
We absolutely loved The Lexington! We will definately come again. The food was awesome!
Great casual dining and a convenient location for the Ordway or the Excel Center.

column4: 5377 W 16th St Saint Louis Park, MN  55416
