column13: I loved that although the restaurant was crowded we never felt rushed. We were able to have our coctaails and enjoyed a leisurely dinner.

column1: Frank O'Dowd's Irish Pub and Grill
column13: Thanks for such a wonderful weekend! Your staff was wonderful, friendly, fun and helpful!

column4: 900 N Michigan Ave 5th Floor Chicago, IL  60611
column13: Fun Sunday sitting at the bar watching the bears game. Shared a pizza and split a veal dish. Bloodies are spicy and good, the Barbera was smooth and perfect to go with the day, and we had a great time joking with the bartender. I'd do it again if around on a Sunday!
Fantastic Italian Food and more!

column4: 15 East Oak Street Barneys New York Chicago, IL  60611
column13: After reading the other reviews on Open Table I was excited to try Fred's for the first time. We went early on a Saturday evening before a concert. The restaurant is beautiful, unfortunately that's where my praise ends. We sat for over 5 minutes before our waiter came to take our drink order, then waited almost 15 minutes before he came back to take our dinner order. I asked if there were any specials, since none were mentioned. Our waiter left again for over 5 minutes to get a paper with the specials, which he read to us, seemingly he had no clue what they were. I ordered a beef tenderloin, medium, which was rare. Unfortunately I didn't get the chance to send it back, as our waiter never returned! Such a dissapointment!!

We were there at 7 pm on a Saturday night and the restaurant was never more than half full. The appetizers were decent but the entrees were mediocre. Twenty minutes after we ordered, we were told that the kitchen only had enough for one of the scallop entrees that were ordered - the other person had to choose something else. They also ran out of beer glasses. They gave us one that was supposedly "just washed" but still had yellow liquid in it. The beer was warm. In fact, we waited for some of the ordered beers so they could "chill" it for us. We don't expect and don't like beer ice cold, but also not warmer than room temperature. It felt like the place was either just opened or on the verge of closing.

My wife and I and two others visited FGT on a Saturday evening. We were running a little late for our reservation time but when we arrived we were greeted very warmly and sat us immediately. I was a little surprised that it wasn't as crowed as expected. However, there are two additional levels so maybe more people were upstairs. We had a front window seat so watching the Galena vistors like us, walking by was nice. Smiles and waves were evident. The food we ordered was great. Try the pork chop dinner. Yummy. If you can, ask for Rebecca as your waitress. She was terrific. Be aware! There are no elevators available for upper level dining. If stairs are a problem, request lower level seating. Have fun!

Very contemporary the atmosphere. Only two wait staff for the restaurant. Service was ok, nothing great, food was nicely presented, nothing great. Ok place to go if you are hungry, some of the rolls were very generous in size. If you are looking for sushi in this area.. ok go. Would I go back... not sure...
Had a great dinner with a very nice view. In the middle of city, not so traditional steak house.

We had been here once before and the food and dessert were phenomenal. Ths recent vist left us wondering if they had changed chefs. The serving sizes were smaller. The bread was too hard to eat. The menu had changed and was therefore limited. Our waiter recomended the rabbit, which I ordered, but was very unimpressed with -- from the flavor of the rabbit to the grilled radicchio. The desserts came and again we were unimpressed. I ordered the brandy soaked sponge cake wth mascarpone. The cake seemed dry and the mascarpone tasted like typical cake icing. My boyfriend ordered the tiramisu which tasted more like tres leches cake. We were there for our anniversary, but it didn't feel special.

column4: 4051 E Main Street St. Charles, IL  60174
column13: nice place but they didnt have any record of my reservation
First time and loved it. We'll be going back for sure.
We were very pleased with our dinner.

Top class atmosphere, energy and service. Portions are more than worth the price. Fried ravioli was large and in charge. Meat sauce was so good I wanted to bathe in it. Chicken parmesan and lasagna were beasts. Broiled mushroom plate could feed 4 but only needed two. Tiramisu made me cuss it so tasty. Our server was on top of his game and made the night. Definitely hit up this classic spot.

column4: 18 W. Station St. (a.k.a 18 W. Railroad Ave.) Palatine, IL  60067
column13: Our reservations were honored on time. The staff was friendly and didn't make us wait after being seated. They were friendly and accommodating. It's a little pricy, but the food was above average. Dinner was relaxed and we did not feel rushed to leave. I would definitely recommend them.

Gilt is my FAVORITE! Excellent wine list and old fashioneds. Dessert menu will change everything you previously thought about dessert (brownies a la mode with hot fudge and your choice of 3 in-house made ice creams....carrot cake....etc). Balsamic and garlic toast, brussel sprout salad, broccoli with parmesean, and mussels also all wonderful. Come here, make it your new favorite place.

Had a wonderful dinner last Saturday. Our waiter, Timothy, gave excellent recommendations and every course was excellent--grilled portobello mushroom on arugula, linguini with clams, creme brullee, to name a few. Will be headed back soon!

We were seated right behind the hostess station, and my husband's seat was almost bumping up against the host's. We thought for having to wait for 4 months to get a reservation, we could have been afforded a little nicer of a table.

They try to source their ingredients locally if possible. I had the braised short ribs with mashed sweet potatoes - delicious!! Also they have a nice selection if martinis. I tried the mango martini, and it was wonderful.

When we arrived at 12:00 noon at the cafe entrance/ host stand there was no one there. Some staff were doing chores and chatting and just sort of looked over at us... finally one of them from across the room yelled over something like, "You want a table?" When we said yes they finally walked over and said, "Are you hear for breakfast?" We said, sure... They said, "Sorry that's finished now." So why on Earth did they ask us about breakfast if they could not even serve it? It was just weird. Anyway we had lunch. Food- Burger ordered medium was well-done and dry. Caesar salad was good and huge. They were not busy at all so no excuses. The staff is just not properly trained. Note- this Cafe & Bar is actually in a pretty basic hotel lobby.

The Goldmoor Restaurant is the place to go for a relaxing and delicious dining experience, with the beautiful Mississippi River view from your table, incredibly elegant and delicious food, and attentive friendly wait staff that don't rush you out the door. The atmosphere was refreshingly quiet so you can have a nice dinner conversation. The food selection is not as lengthy as other restaurants, but the quality of the dishes we ordered was exquisite. We had a pork belly appetizer served with bamboo rice and a curry sauce. We each enjoyed the Goldmoor's Specialty dinner, Beef Wellington, cooked to perfection. The price of the dishes is remarkable considering the quantity provided. Definitely plan on taking leftovers home with you.

If, as Virginia Woolf famously said, "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well", then Goosefoot is the place to dine to allow oneself to be a most loving, well-rested genius. Second time at Goosefoot and the experience was every bit as awesome as the first!
The food is Great. I've had almost everything on the Menu.

Unfortunately, I was disappointed and I REALLY like Graham from the Top Chef. We had very high expectations for the his restaurant and I was looking forward to be blown away - but that wasn't the case. On the positive:cocktails and service were excellent. We opted for "beggining menu" and here is how I felt -butternut "soup" - slightly cold, okay flavors, tiny portion; lamb - micro-portion, low temprature, not aromatic, edamame salad was average; my dessert was chocolate cake with ice-cream (plating not interesting) and the cake tasted as something that I could have made on my own (I am not a good cook). We paid 220$ - too much given the execution :( and were left hungry. Graham needs to come back and check on his restaurant and chefs.
Every dish was exceptional. Worth the 300 mile drive.

column1: The Grill on the Alley - Chicago
column13: It's a steak house in a big city. That describes the ambiance. We wanted a great hunk of meat and tht's what we got. Chicago prices can be daunting but we got what we needed with a nice bottle of wine, a great desert with wonderful service. I will return next visit. And, given the option of sitting at Midway waiting out the hurricane or getting a room in town and a steak house dinner??? Need I say more?

Reservation for Saturday, November 3, 2012 at 6pm for 5 people. We had two people that are gluten free and the server indicated it would not be a problem. Orders were placed and substitutions were made for items that contained wheat / gluten. Unfortunately, there was a breakdown in the system and one of the gluten free dishes arrived with couscous. We also received the wrong vegetables. The vegetables were replaced but the meal was never seen again and our experience went down from there having to flag down the server for drink refills and followup on the drinks and the meal. We eventually canceled the meal as everyone was already done eating and it still had not arrived. I doubt we will go back.
We come in from Indiana occasionally for a special dinner and have each time been thoroughly satisfied. This was our third time at GT.

Although I have eaten here a few times in the past, this was by far the busiest and noisest visit. Even though we had booked a table, we still had to wait nearly an hour before we were seated and were almost going to leave and eat elsewhere. However we were given a free round of drinks as an apology, but the service was a little slow for the rest of the evening - perhaps due to the large numbers of rowdy parties in the restaurant that evening.

I've been ordering Hachi's via GrubHub for years and this is the first time I have actually dined at their charming restaurant. By far the best sushi in Logan Square and a real find! Make sure you ask for the fresh wasabi as it is a game-changer for sure! The hamachi and jalapeno is another treasure, as are the seared scallops. Pieces and rolls are both excellent!

column1: Hands On Modern Thai and Sushi Bar
column13: BYOB - Great, great Thai and sushi - I highly recommend this place!
We enjoyed the turkey burgers, turkey chili, and salads. The fries and home-made potato chips were delicious. We've always thought of this as a dinner local, but will be back for lunch again.
We chose Harry Carayâ€™s based on their great reputation and we will return due to the great food and service. We thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant.

Very friendly staff. Our server Will provided the best service I have had in years. Friendly, knowledgeable and interacted just enough. Portion sizes were on the larger size and food was fresh. Will go back again.
Service was mixed. We waited almost half an hour to get a cocktail. After that long wait service was good.
We had a great experience at Harry Carry's Tavern. The atmosphere, service and food were great! We will definitely return when visiting Chicago again.
I had chicken and broccoli and while the chicken was quality and very good, the broccoli was very small. I thought it was way too expensive for what I got.
Very eclectic menu offerings, generous portions & good service.

We chose the Friday night special entree, bouillabaisse. It was one of the best bouillabaisses we ever had, and we have had it quite a few times because we almost always order it if it is offered. Our waiter came up with an exceptionally good wine pairing that complemented the food. A memorable experience.
Great,high quality food and good service. Portions were generous and the pricing fair.
Excellent food. The hamburger is the best in Chicago.

column1: Hot Woks Cool Sushi - Willis Tower
column13: Excellent Asian food and service in a beautiful space.
Great food, and very loud. My out of town friend wanted someplace energetic, and he got it.

Our second visit to this place this month. This time we tried the pasta specials. My wife had thew Gnochi, I had the Carbonara. Absolutely fresh, homemade pasta. The Chef stopped by and introduced himself. Very friendly staff. We will definitely be back often.

column4: Upper Randolph a180 North Field Boulvard Chicago, IL  60601
column13: Food was superlative. Service was excellent. Left satisfied -- not overly full -- and eager to return.
Food was good. Service was adequate but not great. May go back.
We have been here before. We love Indian Food! Food is pretty good and we noticed improvements in service quality. We always come back.
This place is a mill for Chicago Indian food not real food from India...The Nam was just bad more like an herbal butter bread. The place was packed but not fit for foodies. I will never go back.

The unassuming entrance will throw many off, but once you see groups of people coming in and out of what seems like an apartment entrance you will understand why. Great atmosphere, great food, and great service. The temperature was a bit on the warm side and my son did not like it one bit. This is due to the fact that the kitchen was busy that particular night. Otherwise, and excellent find and great experience.

Great food. Service was excellent and it's a great foodie experience. Portions are smaller, so if you have an option between the 6 course and the 10 course, don't shy away from the bigger option. Menu changes every 6-8 weeks all centered around a different theme. Wine pairings are usually included with the price of the meal, so you don't really need to order any additional wine. There are no entree ala carte options, FYI.

column4: 28 E. Center Ave Lake Bluff, IL  60044
column13: This restaurant had mixed reviews but we decided to give it a try and we are really glad we did. We are a mixed group, some vegan, some carnivore, some organic/local foodies and my Mom who is non-seafood or super spicy. This restaurant was able to accomodate all of our tastes very well. We each had a marvelous meal and my husband said he would definitely go back again. Nice wine list and the desserts were great too!

column1: Italiasia-The Best of Both Worlds-Holiday Inn
column4: 350 West Mart Center Drive Chicago, IL  60654
column13: We felt well taken care of and the food was very good!

column1: It's Vegas Baby! - Blue Chip Casino
column4: 777 Blue Chip Drive Michigan City, IN  46360
column13: We were a party of 6. We had five different entrees since two of us ordered the same thing. ALL of us raved about our food and we each shared with each other to prove it! The garlic mashed potatoes are to die for. Portions of everything are good size too.Our waitress was attentive. The restaurant was busy, but we were not rushed at all. Prices were fair. We all said we would definitely go back.

There were three in our lunch party and it was the first time for all of us. We found thethe setting to be unique and very pleasant although a little noisy. The service wasattentive not hurried and the food most enjoyable. The crab cakes were moist and flavorful.The potatoes left you wanting more.When the waitress learned that one of us was having a birthday she offered dessert that could be shared compliments of Ivy.We found the setting,food,and service all to be recommended. I look forward to returning.
Great food, excellent service, and have recommended to others already. Dined there many times, however the reservation cuts down on the long wait.

column4: 1816 N Clark St, 13th Floor Chicago, IL  60614
column13: The views are amazing, the drinks were good, the food was just ok but my guess is that most people are not dining at The J. Parker, they are having drinks and enjoying the view. A plate of sweet potato fries, flatbread or a couple bowls of spicy nuts would have been better and easier for us to share than what is offered. Overall, I highly recommend it as a place for a drink, reservations are very tough to come by on a weekend night so plan ahead!
The food was excellent and the waitress was very attentive. It would have been nice for the lights to be a little dimmer for a more romantic atmosphere.
Good Indian food , good service

We were celebrating 30th wedding Anniversary and requested a seat near fireplace but were seated in a booth away from fireplace. So much for ambiance and romantic dinner. Broccoli soup bland and not much broccoli in it. Salad on the small size and not much more than lettuce. was really looking forward to a special dinner out but, was disappointed. The rib eye was delicious though.

column4: 1702 W. Algonquin Rd. Mt. Prospect, IL  60056
column13: By far one of the best steaks I've had in recent years. (11oz Filet Migion). The appetizer and desserts were equally good. Service at the table was fantastic. It was noisy, but not so bad that you had to shout across your own table. We had a 6:45 reservation, but weren't seated until around 7:20 due to a larger group taking a bit longer than expected. Parking is tight at this location, but valet service is available.Would definately return to this restaurant.

While the menu, food,. presentation & service are lovely at Jane's (albeit overpriced), we found it to be "less than" for a special occasion or romantic meal(which is very present in the physical rooms) because it was so loud. We went w/a 6 p.m. friday rez and were seated in the "other room" - w/a loud mouthed young man & his quiet date; a family with two children; then another family with a child came; then another. it was a Den of Din - a cacaphony - plus music. made conversation difficult and was kind of a buzz-kill for a romantic "special occasion" meal. now we know. felt we weren't "hip enough" at first - but we felt we weren't exuding "entitled enough" to be there. don't know that we'll return.
Took my boyfriend here for his birthday. We had both been wanting to try Japonais for some time and we were not disappointed!! Food was outstanding! There was not one item that we did not like!
the Chilean Sea Bass is always wonderful..and who can resist the beet salad that tastes so good and makes you feel healthy for eating it.Great desserts too!

column1: Joe's Seafood, Prime Steak & Stone Crab
column13: Nice dinner out for a special occasion. Service was superb as they catered to our every need.
The food is always GREAT ! Possibly the "carver" at the beef station needssome training in craving the delicious beef!!

column4: 2601 N. Main Street East Peoria, IL  61611
column13: The food was very good, the waitress was excellent! Will be coming back again & again :)

column4: 4450 N. Prospect Road, Suite S1 Peoria Heights, IL  61616
column13: Had a phenomenal wine pairing seven course dinner, with outstanding service by Marcus and his colleague. Spoke with Josh, the owner and chief chef, and his dedication to "farm to table" approach goes well beyond the message conveyed by the extensive list of local farms on the menu. And, I was very much impressed by both the excellent selection of South African, Argentinian and US wines presented in the pairings. Portions were right sized, with an outstanding array of unique flavors, and were beautifully presented. And the sturgeon was wonderfully prepared, with a moist yet firm flesh.

column4: 8 W. Burlington Ave La Grange, IL  60525
column13: This restaurant is a real GEM! The food is EXCELLENT and delicious. The service was excellent, and it has a great intimate ambiance. The chef was very accomodating to our request for a dish that was not on their menu. There wasn't an empty table on Friday evening. My only regret is why I waited so long.
Best Sushi place we have eaten at and we like sushi. Very interesting menu and helpful staff. Went for lunch. Nice soft decor and music not techno like many Japenese places these days.
There were only a few other tables full, so it was a bit quiet. The food was amazing and everyone loves a BYOB. Would definitely go back.
Fantastic! The best vegan food I've had anywhere in the country.
The atmosphere, food and service at Keefer's Restaurant was outstanding. There was a high level of energy in the restaurant which made dining a fun experience.

column4: 900 N. North Branch Street Chicago, IL  60642
column13: We forgot to fill out the comment card, but we had a very pleasurable, delicious experience at Kendall Dining Room for lunch last week. The food was excellent, and the service was very good. Thank you.
Every aspect of our eating experience at Kiki's was excellent. We will return often.
I love this place! I always get treated great and have great food.

Very good second experience at KIN. Good food and attentive service BYOB makes this especially affordable. My only suggestion would be to turn up the lights somewhat...could be I'm just getting old! Not many diners in both visits, which is a shame but makes this a great place for a large, animated table of friends to have a lively time
Great food. Went with friends and didn't feel rushed at all. Let us sit for a couple hours.
We went for brunch, and everything was great - just a VERY ODD LOCATION directly next door to the strip club, VIPs...

The intimate size of the restaurant, the atmosphere, the friendly staff are all only surpassed by the delicious food served.The bar is a fun place to have a drink before dinner. Great bartenders whose attitudes create a vibe throughout the bar.The dining room is not your usual "corporate" steak house size. It is small enough to make your dining experience feel more personal. Yes ... Kinzie Chop House is a steak house and it is in Chicago ... so there are tables of business associates having a fun time. But there are also locals like us who return time and time again.The wine list is superb. Ask to be seated at Rafael's table. He has a great knowledge of the wines offered and always recommends something new we haven't tried.

Best: Zen-like atmosphere of decor.Worst: very un-Zen-like vibe of the staff. Hurried/harried. All niceties out the window. Wait times are long. Example: hostess told us our table wasn't ready and to wait at the bar. No bartender to order a drink. When table was ready, the very rushed hostess hurriedly walked to the table, glanced back to see where we were, decided we were too pokey and tossed the menus on table and rushed away.Best: consistently good sushi. Better than the Orland Park alternatives. Good beer selection.Worst: Wait times for food can be long. Drinks are mediocre-margaritas, atrocious.After 4 visits: great food but expect service issues. Never a great overall dining experience. Mixed feelings each visit!!

I had sushi the time I went, which was great. What interests me about Kohan even more is that I discovered that Kohan offers a wide selection of Korean food. Korean food is a bit of a rarity in Chicago - at least near downtown - but it is great and Kohan's offerings looked enticing. They even have in-table grills! I'm excited to go back.

Myself and a very close friend of mine dined there for the first time. We had a wonderful dining experience. My friend loves sushi so he was in heaven. The waiter made some recommendations and he was right on point. I will definitely be going back
the rolls are inventive and the fish is pretty fresh. if you're looking for simple maki rolls, go elsewhere as most everything is covered in sauce.

column1: L. Woods Tap and Pine Lodge
column13: Quality food and service every time we've been. It just keeps getting better. Great fresh Ingredients. Great drink selection.

column4: 2300 N. Lincoln Park West Chicago, IL  60614
column13: Excellent service. Everyone tailored to our every need and accommodated all allergies with delicious alternatives. Will definitely come back again!
As always, delicious food and great service. Our server, Roberta, was kind, knowledgeable and made our dining experience wonderful. We love this place and it's truly a gem of Lincoln Square!

This was my second time to La Casa and I have to say that it was not nearly as satisfying as the first. The food was good, but not remarkable as it had been roughly six months earlier. Service was "okay." One got the impression that our server was busy doing other things. Exactly what wasn't clear, because the place was nearly empty. I'm not about to write off La Casa but have begun to re-examine my reasons for going. Without doubt I was initially drawn to the combination of Kosher and Mexican food. Query what might be done to "keep 'em coming back." Perhaps specials, or notes on the menu, or a singing cantor. You get the idea. The restaurant business is tough. One needs a "hook," possibly several, to fill those seats.
Both of our meals were really good!
My pasta dish was on the cooler side.

The food was great, but they need to correct ventilation in the restaurant. We came home and our clothes reeked of oil smoke from the kitchen -- this is totally unnecessary and they should have adequate exhaust fans in the kitchen.

We were looking for a place close to the 16th Street Theater and happened upon La Notte Cafe on the internet. It looked good so we gave it a try. What a pleasant surprise. Great menu, wonderful food and a nice atmosphere. Too cold to eat outside but they also have a nice outdoor dining area. Our server was excellent but a mistake was made with my wife's dish. She ordered Chicken Parm and got Veal Parm instead. Not sure who made the mistake but within 5-10 minutes the staff corrected the problem. We were a bit rushed due to the theater tix so didn't have a chance for coffee/dessert but will certainly give La Notte a try again. We enjoyed it and it was relatively easy on the wallet.
We enjoyed the food, the service was good and the people were very friendly.
This restuarant never disappoints! Food and service is always excellent!

We were pleasantly surprised by this little gem near UIC. The paella was delicious as was the empanadas. The guitar music was nice background to dinner after a UIC Flames soccer match. We highly recommend it if you are in the area...a wonderful break from Taylor Street and Italian food.

column4: 123 E. St. Charles Rd. Villa Park, IL  60181
column13: Great food, friendly and casual ambiance in the western burbs. Great menu options. The sea bass and Zuppa di Pesce were the star dishes! We also tried out their volcano pizza for an appetizer which was a great show! It was a dome shaped pizza and was lit on first, very cool and tasty!

Our first visit to this restaurant. We liked it, however there was a mixup with the order that had to be corrected. The food was good and the cost was ok, too. We like coming to Oak Park and will likely come back.

Our second time at Las Palmas and, again, a terrific meal. The menu had changed a little since the last time, but was still amazing - hard to choose among all those wonderful-sounding dishes. Started with a terrific salad with jicama, mango, and pepitas. Main courses were a salmon with sangria reduction and a skirt steak with great sauce. Creative "sides" are not really on the side but are integrated into the dishes. Too full for dessert - too bad. Service is friendly and helpful. The place is pleasantly decorated and comfortable. Portions are generous and prices are very reasonable.
The food was great! I will forever be a fan!
Outstanding- lived in the region a number of years ago, and this will kee me comming back, it is now on my "must-visit" list, teh web site does not even bvegin teh explain the experience!
we made a reservation for lunch and told they were serving brunch menu until five oclock. I did feel like eating breakfast items from the menu and left the restaurant:(
when you want to relax, savour good, nice ambience and very excellent service, go to Peninsula

column4: Palmer House Chicago 17 E. Monroe Street Chicago, IL  60603
column13: They just got a new chef... Food was good but lacked spice andFlavor. Scallops were slightly cold in the center...needed flavor.
Very classy atmosphere and ambiance. Food was delicious and the beer was excellent! We have been here a few times before and will defiantly be coming back for many more great dining experiences!

I was visiting Chicago for a day. And luckily Lula's is right off of the Logan Square stop on the Blue Line. I walked into an eccentric cozy cafe. The staff was nothing but welcoming and I got the sense that all the employees had great pride in the restaurant. The food was delicious. I went out of my norm and ordered the Pozole, and it was fantastic! Along with my hot apple cider--it was the perfect combination. I highly suggest you stopping into Lula Cafe, but I would suggest putting in a reservation, it started to pick up as I was leaving. Cheers to stumbling upon a charming restaurant!

The food overall was delicious, with a great brunch selection. I ordered tea and pear beignets and they were both wonderful. The service was not good. Maybe they were short staffed, but our waitress kept coming by and commenting that she needed to get more coffee for refills, but never actually did. Also, the biggest problem is that the food came out warmish-cold, but it still tasted good (saving grace).
A bit hard to find, but worth the effort. We'll definitely go back.
Their lunch is great and reasonably priced. HUGE portions! Just wonderful all the way around.

Absolutely excellent. Serious food, at a seriously reasonable price. Great service, nice atmosphere, good place. They appear to have mad space for private rentals as well. Cool beans. I will be back. Definitely.
The food is always heavenly! Best Italian restaurant in Illinois!!!
Love the classic pasta deal! It's always a great meal. Tried the chicken potato soup this time - it was wonderful. Almost a meal by itself. Looking forward to next time.

Loved Maggiano's. The occasion was my mother's birthday. Our waiter Pete treated us very well. The chef came out and gave us a free appetizer because it was our first time there. Very nice. I will definitely come back! I recommend Maggiano's to anyone who loves Iltalian food.
my experience there was great...Took my fiance there for my birthday and I will be back. My fiance was very pleased for it being her first time being there.

This is our favorite new restaurant in Peoria. They have a menu that offers wonderful steaks, seafood, and the chefs special southern flare offerings. The bar with many special bourbons was happy to make crafted cocktails for us. Service is always attentive and friendly. Wednesday's there is a no corkage on wine. They have transformed a wide open space into a restaurant with upscale charm. Menu changes seasonally which improves the quality and freshness of daily specials. Steaks perfectly cooked and side dishes were all delicious.

column4: 115 West Campbell Street Arlington Heights, IL  60005
column13: Upscale mexican fare with an imaginative menu. Go here with the expectation of getting creative, tasty, unique dishes and you'll be thoroughly pleased. Start w/the guacamole and a variety of sangria choices. All four of us were very happy w/our selections; Ropa Viejo, Pechuga Azteca, Arroz Con Pollo (uniquely created) and Puntas de Cerdo al Chipotle. Best (upscale) or any type of Mexican cuisine in the area by far.

We really enjoyed this restaurant.....the waiter was very accommodating, helpful, and friendly and the food was delicious. It was stylish in appearance and there is a sizable room set apart from the main dining area if you wish addition privacy. I would definitely return.
The food was wonderful as usual and our server Helen was great!

Our server was excellent. The wine servings were generous. The beef wellington was outstanding as was the chilean sea bass. It was great to see the excellent vegetarian offerings and the local produce.

Last Wednesday (10/24), my wife and I celebrated our anniversary with a fabulous Italian dinner at Mandile's. Service was excellent, our server, (Andy) was very attentive, and the food was second to none. Ah, and the Limoncello infused cake was the best part of the night.

column4: 21 W. Goethe Street Suite 1-A Chicago, IL  60610
column13: Perfect family dinner and we know Italian!
Great spot to meet with Lake Foresters in a club style ambience and a good meal under the new chef's direction.
The food was fantastic, the ambiance was perfect, the staff was wonderful. I will definitely go back to Mart Anthony's!

column4: 990 N  Mies Van Der Rohe Way Hilton Suites Hotel Chicago, IL  60611
column13: The Five Course menu is, when all is said and done, closer to a fifteen course tasting menu that comes in five distinct waves. The fish is fresh, of course, and various and delicious but the beef and mushroom dishes are also exquisite, and the platings are breathtaking. A great selection of beers and sakis to pair. The service is impeccable. The staff friendly and informed. The chef, fantastic! Masaki is definitely a place for a special occasion. From the foodie point of view, a visit to Masaki is in itself a special occasion.

The service was horrible. They wouldn't let us order off the menu so we had to eat the buffet and the buffet was constantly out of items. Nobody would refill our water so we had to get up and ask 3 times! We had to ask 2 times to get napkins and there wasn't enough silver wear for everyone. They ran out of bowls and there were a handful of paper bowls left. The food was not bad but the service was awful.
We thoroughly enjoyed Mastro"s. It is one of the best restaurants in Chicago. Food is great, service superb and it has ambiance. We've never been disappointed at Mastro's ..

column4: 9 E. 31st ST La Grange Park, IL  60526
column13: The food was excellent, but dining in left something to be desired. We were seated at the bar area at a small high top that didn't even have a light above it. (We were told it would be a 20 minute wait for a normal table - even though we said we were in no hurry and would have waited for a normal table in the restaurant area, the hostess walked us over to the bar area without really listening to us.) We had extreme difficulty reading our menus due to the lack of light. We also had a very unpleasant dining experience due to an inebriated older gentleman at the bar - he was literally yelling to people all the way at the other end and had no regard for other customers. We told our server and the hostess about him, but no one did anything.

It is such a cute place and the menu is so interesting.We were (4 of us) the only ones for a while the 2 other tables came. However, the service of food was so very slow.One problem, my husband ordered a pork chop, which was very thick and needed time to cook. I ordered fish, and the fish probably cooked as long as the pork because it was so very dry.Good appetizers and nice wine selection.Overall, OK.

column4: 144 South Oak Park Ave Oak Park, IL  60302
column13: If I lived closer I would definitely be a regular here. I had dined here twice before and loved it so I took my boyfriend here for his birthday. He's quite the foodie and was just expecting your average Mexican food, but he loved it. He said it was the best carne asada he's ever tasted. The service was great, our waitress was super informative and made great recommendations. This was my first time there during the weekend, so we got to enjoy the live music after dinner at the bar. The band was great. All in all a wonderful experience and worth the 45 minute drive from Lakeview.

I rarely get into the city, so my sense that it is a touch expensive may be off. But it was good food, served nicely and well. It is not a Tru or L2O, nor does it aspire to be. Within what it does, it does it very well. My wife and I had a great dinner, were served promptly yet not pushy, and overall enjoyed the experience quite well.

column4: One East Wacker Drive Chicago, IL  60601
column13: The food was good and moderately priced for a Downtown seafood restaurant. Service was good and the server was friendly and helpful. The restaurant was wide open, not as cramped as some places. I liked the booth we were seated in. It had individual chairs instead of the usual bench like seats. Good sized bar area and there is a happy hour from 3:30 to 6pm. Nice selection of seafood and various fish dishes. Noise level was acceptable, lighting was adequate. The specialty drink list needs a few more vodka based martinis and possibly a few rum drinks as well. Will definitely return one of these days.

column4: 3001 Butterfield Road Oak Brook Promenade Oak Brook, IL  60523
column13: The food is always superb at McCormick & Schmick's. We come to the restaurant for their steaks as well as their seafood and we have never been disappointed.

column4: 4999 Old Orchard Center Old Orchard Center, Suite G8 Skokie, IL  60077
column13: Quality fish with interesting sides, could have used a little more seasoning to my taste. Perfect portion size. Waitress was adequate, but never cracked a smile. Rest of the staff was very attentive helping elderly in our party with coats, chairs & walkers.

column4: 821 W Burlington Avenue Western Springs, IL  60558
column13: Good place to eat. I've been there many times. Unfortunately, we got lost behind a huge order (think a table of 20)and our meal of salad and entree took 90 minutes. Still highly recommended.

Went here for the first time on Sunday... Picked this spot to celebrate my boyfriends birthday. Place was great! Only complaint I have was that I made reservations for 2 and the table they sat us at was so tiny!! We were literally 2 inches away from tables on either side of us. Not good when you want a little privacy or a romantic setting. Way too crammed in there!

LOVED it especially the naperville teacher discount :) It was a bit noisy. Everytime I go there for dinner on the weekend it is very loud and almost difficult to hear others from our table talking :/ Other than that we love it there!!!

column4: 233 S. Wacker Drive. 67th Floor Chicago, IL  60606
column13: The food was very mediocre, considering the high expectations of a private club in a prestigious location, which was quite disappointing. Service was also quite amateurish. There were only 2 other tables occupied on a Friday night, which was perhaps testament to the level of food/service.
Food was very good but there were too many flavors that went to opposite ends of the spectrum, translation "Aggitta". Portions were small (typical french)and a bit pricey. Server was excellent.
Beautiful restaurant,great food, and vibrant atmosphere!
It was okay - nothing to write home about. Very noisy and not private at all. Good only for a quick meal.
An excellent spot to take a group. Absolutely fantastic service.

column4: 2 Mid America Plaza Suite 100 Oakbrook Terrace, IL  60181
column13: Everything was great from the food to the service. The wine, entree, and dessert (Mike's ice cream pie) were all magnificient. Complimentary valet parking is nice.
We enjoyed our 49th wedding anniversary by dinning here.Prime rib and top sirloin were excellent,served in a cozy setting.
Great food, great mimosas, great service. Definitely recommend.
We enjoyed our meal even though getting there was a challenge. The town was setting up for a special event and many streets were closed. A good place to celebrate a birthday with friends.
Some of the best Thai food in town. Best lunch menu values.
Loud, fun, energetic. Good margaritas but Mercadito's are better for the same price. Good food. Skewers are served from a hanging stand to be fun and different.

My husband and I thought the food was undistinguished, especially the salad which was completely generic and uninteresting. We were pleasantly surprised, however, by the piano and opera singers who entertained us. Not enough to make us want to return, however.
Montarra consistently provides one of the best dining experiences in the northwest suberbs of Chicago.
The food at Moon Palace was ok, just ok, no spectacular dim sum or flavors. 11:15 was too early for brunch, and even noon was probably too early for brunch or lunch.
We had a great time. Good food. Fun menu. Great Service. Great beer selection.

I spent 14 years in Chicago entertaining clients at the top steakhouses in the city, including Morton's other locations. Unfortunately this experience fell short of our expectations. When ordering stuffed shrimp @49 a plate one expects more than a two bite shrimp. We had a party of 11, with two being children, and our bill came to $943. Three of the adults did not consume any alcohol. That was NOT a $1000 experience. We opted for the private room (21% gratuity)for a 70th birthday which included decorations. The "decoration" was a $1 bag of confetti on the table.

I was extremely pleased with the food at Moto. It was well worth the trip in from Massachusetts. I was a little disappointed that the waiter ruined the surprise (I was going to wait until the end of the meal to tell my husband we were pregnant!) but the second we were seated we were brought congratulatory champagne, so the cat was out of the bag! I also wish they could have accommodated a wine "taste" for me. Being pregnant, I would have loved to have tried the wine sampling, but obviously could not do full pours of everything.The ambiance was wonderful. A bit "men in black" ish with the headpieces, but very professional and informed staff.
As usual, the food was excellent, the liver pate is to die for. Mark the Matre'd was sociable as usual. Remembered us from the last time.
was here for my birthday and I loved it. The waiter was great and brought over a complimentary dessert which was really nice.Good food & service as always!
Fresh and wonderfull with great service, simply said.

Wonderful food, they must of been understaffed, it took almost 10 minutes for a server greet and there were a coupon communication issues with ordering, probably b/c it was too loud for him to hear us. Regardless, everything was corrected and it was a great meal.

The restaurant is beautiful! However, the food was just ordinary at best. It's small plates, so its understandable the portions are small. I had the fois gras, halibut, steak, potatoes, and sunny side up flatbread. The flat bread was the best thing we tried. Everything else was things you could find other places equally good and better prices/servings.
Food was good. I found the wine list lacking.

column4: 222 W Merchandise Mart Plaza Chicago, IL  60654
column13: I'd definitely go back to Nick's. The service wasn't bad, but it also didn't have me jump for joy; it was ok. What really sold me on this place was the food (I had a buffalo chicken sandwich) and the ambiance. I bet this place is a good place to dine/hang out at the bar after work.
The service was fabulous. Debbie takes special care of her guests. The food as expected was super.
This is our 2nd time at Nightwood for brunch and it was just as delicious as the first. We brought my parents along and they enjoyed it just as much as we did. Needless to say, we'll be back.

The Nix is a restaurant located in the Millennium Knickerbocker Hotel. Though the menu is not extensive, this is not to say that I could not find something that interested me. It is typical American fair, including steak, hamburger, fish, pork, and chicken dishes. Truly, the hamburger was the most tempting plate (which is somewhat large and topped with bacon and a fried egg). However, the highlight of the dining experience revolved around the pierogi side dish which was made with the typical mashed potatoes and small amount of cheese. Our server convinced me to order them the Polish way (with a side of sour cream and a small sprinkle of parsley. They were great, including the slightly sweet coating of sugar and vanilla I detected on them!

column4: 800 North Michigan Avenue Seventh Floor of the Park Hyatt Chicago Chicago, IL  60611
column13: The brunch menu varied. Although the chicken was slim, the buttermilk fried chicken with chive biscuit was tasty. The greens on the side, bitter. You can leave those on the plate. They siad the menu changes often, so it could already be off the menu. I don't recommend sitting near the kitchen because the dining room smelled like a deep fryer. My service was very nice. The belini wasn't worth the price, so go for the mimosa.

It is great everytime we go. We were a party of 4 with a six month old. Very accommodating, everyone's meal was great, everyone's wine was tasty and their cherry infused manhattan is very good! The wait staff are always friendly and knowledgable
Excellent food and service. Highly recommend it!

column4: Navy Pier, 600 E. Grand Avenue Chicago, IL  60611
column13: It is very good for special occasion for special evening to remember. Food was quite good, but I rather have more fish dish selection. But atmosphere and out side of Chicago night line is excellent view! And you could certainly enjoy beautiful fire works in the end of the cruise finale at Saturday night! Thanks for the memorable cruise dinner!

For a person concerned about healthy eating and fresh vegetables, I loved the way the Rama chicken was served - with steamed vegetables, chicken and peanut sauce served separately. This isn't how I remembered it from Thailand, but very healthy way to serve it in upscale US.

column4: 201 Des Plaines Ave Forest Park, IL  60130
column13: Nice beer list, friendly service. Brisket was outstanding
This is a great sports bar. Busy with great service & amazing food!

I never have wrote a review for a restaurant but this establishment did such an outstanding job that I felt it was called for. The food was fantastic. I had a ribeye and my wife had salmon. Both entrees were well prepared and tasted great. The server was knowledgable and courteous. We will definetly be going back again. Thanks One ELeven Main.

As with most Thai places, it has an extensive menue. Food was good. Reasonable prices. Service was so so. The manager was very attentive because she had to make up for the server being a little overwhelmed, even though there were few tables.

A group of us have been on a hunt for the best thin crust pizza in Chicago. One of our top picks is Paisans. Their thin crust and sweet sauce makes them a regular spot for us. Can't go too long without a Paisans pizza fix!

This is a very good restaurant. Although if you plan on going during a busy time don't expect good service. We have been here twice on a busy Saturday night and both times the service has been poor, hostess have been rude and reservation times have not been honored. I would reccomend going on a week night. They have a better control of the dining room then. I highly reccomend their crispy pizza it's awesome.

column4: Drake Chicago 140 East Walton Chicago, IL  60164
column13: The service was great. Constantly refilling our tea pot with hot water.

column4: 323 East Wacker Drive At the Swissotel Chicago, IL  60601
column13: My boyfriend and I went to The Palm Restaurant because I received a postcard in the mail advertising their great debate surf and turf plus soup or salad and desert for $49.50. The lobster bisque was very tasty. The presentation was impressive with chunks of lobster in a bowl and the soup slowly poured over it. The ceasar salad wasn't anything special. We both ordered the filet mignon medium rare with the lobster tail. The lobster tail melted in our mouth with the melted butter. I thought my steak was pretty tasty. Though, my boyfriend's steak which was the same cut had no flavor. For desert we got the pumpkin creme brulee amd the molten chocolate cake. The molten chocolate cake melted in our mouth. The creme brulee was cold.
The food and service was wonderful.
We had a wonderful time... only down fall would be the music was way too loud - we could not hear one another. I recommend the music be turned up after dinner hours.
We love the fabulous food, good service, ambience of the wood paneled bar and especially the piano music!! This is definitely a Neighborhood Gem!
Great food and fun for my birthday group.

We had a Living Social deal that led us to this little gem. The dinning room is quaint but attracted a lively crowd as the night went on. The food was definitely the highlight-for a light appetizer I recommend the Capresee Tower-delicious fresh tomatoes and fresh mozzarella-a perfect portion for a two to share. Main courses did not disappoint-we had the NY strip (only complaint was the asparagus was salty) and the Seafood Linguine with garlic lemon sauce and it was delicious. The website stated the restaurant opened at five but when we arrived at 6 p.m. the dinning room was not set and the hostess had to ask permission to seat us because they "weren't ready" because of a wedding reception occurring in the adjacent banquet hall.

People Lounge was surprisingly perfect for a nice date night (dinner and a show). We made reservations and were taken to our table immediately. I had read that they had communal seating, but they have obviously chosen to move away from that, which I think was nicer for a date night with my boyfriend. The tapas we ordered were delivered to our table quickly (maybe a little too quickly) and were absolutely delicious. Specifically both types of empanadas and the bacon-wrapped dates were amazing. My only complaint is that the plates were a bit overpriced for the portion size. We got only 2 bacon-wrapped dates for $6, which felt a bit of a rip off. The mussels however came a-plenty in a delicious Belgian broth. Overall - we liked People Lounge!
Eclectic and original food. Attentive and knowledgeable servers. A little pricey.

column1: Pete Miller's Seafood and Prime Steak - Evanston
column13: Wouldn't go back on a Saturday night...waited over an hour after reservation time to eat. Then took an additional 45 mins for the dinner to come out...steaks were ok, not the best. Waitress was very nice tho

column1: Pete Miller's Seafood and Prime Steak - Wheeling
column13: We have had several good meals previously. Saturday the food was just fair. My Salmon was not good......and to top it off the meal was very expensive.
First time dining here - and we will go back! Food well prepared, and location is convenient to shopping downtown.

column1: Piazza - The Hyatt Lodge at McDonald's Campus
column13: We certainly enjoyed this find. Food was good and the service was outstanding. The restaurant is tucked in a very wooded serene area. Plenty of windows highlight the tranquil area. Our dinner was relaxing and never rushed.
I have been here twice and every time i go, i love it more and more. everything we ordered was awesome. this place rocks!

Piccolo Mondo has been one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants for years. We've held business luncheons and celebrated birthdays and office holiday parties there -- always with a successful and memorable outcome. The food delights, and the staff is friendly and attentive. This restaurant has a warm, old-world feel, and I especially enjoy the picturesque view of the park with the museum in the distance. So, when I wanted to introduce my new-to-Chicago niece to the Museum of Science and Industry and Hyde Park, Piccolo Mondo was the perfect dining experience to end the day.
The food was remarkable! Great service and romantic atmosphere. We will definitely be returning soon!
Food was outstanding and service was excellent however, it was very noisy and hard to hear our dinner companions

I went to Pikk's for my birthday with 7 of my friends. The food was amazing. The service was horrible. The waitress was rude and condescending. We waited after dinner to talk to the manager who was no where to be found. I have since emailed the restaurant and a few days later I haven't heard any response from them. Although the food is delicious, the fact is that Pikk's customer service is atrocious.
Food was terrific. Really enjoyed the place. Lots of young families there prior to our 6:45pm reservation (and just clearing out). Crowd makeup changed then. All good.
First time to the restaurant and was delighted in the menu choices and quality of the dishes sampled. I've had better sushi and the ratio of cooked items to raw was too much in my opinion.
SLOW SERVICESLOW FOOD and it was fairGOOD DEAL ON WINE--1/2 price on bottles

column4: 93 South La Grange La Grange, IL  60525
column13: Great atmosphere. We loved the food. We both liked the menu options including Vegan, and gluten free. We went in the morning so noise was not an issue.

Though the restaurant says it has vegan options, there are not that many(maybe five items, or so), while there are quite a bit of options for vegetarians and meat eaters. Ambiance was great and the restaurant has comfortable booths that wrap around a round table, as opposed to one on each side of a table.

It was all-around just OK. Seems a popular lunch spot given its location across from large office complex. Ambiance is unremarkable but more sit-down than expected from the outside decor. Service was so-so, as I waited a long time for anyone to ask if they could refill my drink. Little waiting for entree, however . I had the chicken di prima. OK chicken slathered with poor quality cheese. Might return but only by necessity, due to limited local dining choices.
Great choices so you can feed the light eaters to the big appetite. Tuna tacos were really good. Buffalo wing chicken tenders are really spicy, beware.
Enjoyed the Lobster Tacos, a great appetizer or light lunch
The location is great, the decor and atmosphere is wonderful. I wasn't impressed with the food. The rest of my party seemed happy, but nobody raved. Service was delightful as well.
A happening place but you must be comfortable with community dining. It was a bit too close for my comfort but the delicious food made up for the seating arrangement.
The food was very good, but this very large space had nearly no one there...very strange
Food was delicious, particularly the carrot soup. Dessert (chocolate-pear bombe) was a little disappointing; somewhat dry and the combination of flavors seemed a little odd. Service was excellent.

column4: 2056 N. Lincoln Park West Chicago, IL  60614
column13: Always a great place with great atmosphere and good food.
Raj Darbar is my favorite Indian restaurant in Chicago. The food is memorably good. The service is attentive. The value is good.

I went here before an event at the Allstate. I ordered the Artichoke and Spinach dip from the appetizer menu and a side of sweet potato fries. The Dip was amazing! You had both pitas and chips to dip. It was extremely filling. I also ordered a side of sweet potato fries was really yummy as well. One of the acquaintances I went there with ordered the garlic fries and oh boy were those delicious! Overall, it was a freat experience and I am amazed by how delicious both fries were.

We dined with two children and the restaurant was very busy for a Sunday night. They have a very nice kids menu at reasonable prices. The entrees were deliciously prepared as well - not too much food but not too little either. Our waiter was prompt in keeping us updated on the status of our food which was appreciated when dining with two kids.
As always, an enjoyable dining experience. The food was quite good and the service of a very high quality. Riva's continues to be one of my favorite restaurants.
We loved it! Opera after dinner.
LOVE the ambiance and decor at RM, everything is so beautiful. If you are champagne fan, you NEED to come here!

Surprisingly limited beer on tap for a brew pub, which was a disappointment because that's why we chose to go there. The food was standard chain fair, which is what we expected. Unfortunately our waitress was quite unpleasant, inspite of efforts on our part to be friendly and engaging.

column4: 16156 South La Grange Road Orland Park, IL  60467
column13: Food and beer just great and a lot of fun being at such a high energy setting. Looking forward to going back soon!
Service was good overall, but the entrees were a little slow.Food was very good.
We will definitely be going back. The food was creative, delicious, and was served quickly with a smile. Add in the fact that it's BYOB and it wasn't even expensive!

My friends and I tried Rockit for brunch this past Sunday morning, overall it was good. We will defiantly be returning! We all tried something different, The omelette, breakfast burrito, and waffle of the day (this had a cherry compote topping). All were every good and large portions. My boyfriend LOVED the hash browns! We also took advantage of the drink specials (what the heck it's brunch right!?) mimosa's and bloody mary's were $5! Rockit was great on customer service, the manager kept checking in on us as well as our waitress and even the bus boys! Our server was ok but maybe she had an off day. They had an acoustic guitarist that ROCKED! We will be returning for brunch and also to try out the other items on the menu!
We went for a prime rib special and were not disappionted. One of us had a different steak suggested by our waiter and that was equally good. Good value all around.
Great as always! Highly recommend!
Interesting and delicious rolls! Great BYOB

We had a great dinner. The menu offers a great variety if food. I had pork chop on the regular menu. It was perfectly prepared. My husband had a veal dish that eh thought was the best he ever had. The portions were generous; my son and I shared a great caprese salad. Service was very good and the food came out in a very timely manner. This is not a quiet place but it had good ambiance, lots of energy. We would go backin a heartbeat.
Outstanding service, we had a large group and our server Erin was spot on - the room we were in was a bit noisy, food was served in perfect timing, and hot. Definitely a great spot!
Food was good. The veal dish one of us had was very good. Our server was attentive, prompt, and not intrusive.

Overall good food, but not as good as I expected. We came for the steaks! Specialty bone-in fillet was a triangle of meat thinner on the edge than by the bone. This made my medium rare order hard to do as it was too rare by the bone, and it was hard to cut. Some fat and grizzle was in their specialty steak too. The small fillet was a good size and I think the better steak. The server checked almost immediately after delivering the steaks which was too soon to get an accurate opinion on how good their meal was.
Love this restaurants - some of the best steaks in Chicago but noise is just too much. They could easily buffer it down with minor work to the ceiling, but they don't.
Our waiter and other service staff were outstanding.
Continues to be a great dining experience!

column4: 100 W. Main St. Saint Charles, IL  60174
column13: Our server was polite, prompt and fullfilled everyone of our requests. Food was delicious, done to perfection.

column1: Ruth's Chris Steak House - South Barrington
column4: 100 West Higgins Road Suite U-1 South Barrington, IL  60010
column13: My husband & I usually dine at Ruth's Chris for special occasions (b-days, anniversary, etc)...however, I was disappointed to see that the prices have been raised once again. It seems hard to believe that a side of mashed potatoes should be $9.00.Also, the Ruth's Chris at the South Barrington Arboretum offers valet parking. The valet parking sets up cones to reserve their spots in way too many spots. We really like the restaurant, but the prices are really becoming an issue.

column4: 4441 West Irving Park Road Chicago, IL  60641
column13: We have been there many times. A great value, good food, service and place. Good martini's, too.

We love Sai Cafe - so nice to have it right in the neighborhood - an easy walk - and Mr. Bee, the sushi chefs, and the staff are always so friendly and nice. We come here so often - as a couple or as a family - that we have the menu memorized!

column4: 567 West Lake St. Suite A Chicago, IL  60661
column13: Food was pretty good, by NY standards, and the atmosphere was also pleasant. Pretty much exactly what we wanted: a laid-back meal of good, slightly more interesting than usual food choices (although they lacked a certain kick/edge)However, I have to mention that the waiters were a tad overbearing (friendly, but should have given us more space), and perhaps because the kitchen was closing, messed up our order: everything came out one by one, first an entree, then two appetizers, and then they realized they hadn't put in the order for our second appetizer, which we got by the time my gf was done eating. This wasn't very professional, but we were there to have a laid back meal anyhow, and weren't on a tight schedule.

We ate early, around 6PM on a weeknight. The place was loaded with kids and very loud. The music was also loud and had an annoying beat. After a time we got used to the thumping base and we were able to enjoy our sushi. Better than average sushi.
Love this place. We have celebrated special occasions here and really enjoy the dining experience at the Saloon Steakhouse.

Just a fantastic experience. Some of the review's I read talked about feeling "rushed" or some nonesense like that. My experience was nothing like that at all. Server was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Food was outstanding. Just a really great meal overall.

column4: 17 W Campbell St Arlington Heights, IL  60005
column13: Wait staff were friendly and helpful. Enjoyed the experience.

Take the escalators up to the upper level of the Renaissance Convention Center. The front of the restaurant is flanked with floor to ceiling glass and there are comfortable luxurious seating next to the glass. The tables are spaced in a nice roomy fashion.

I've come here a few times before and always had a great time. So, after receiving a $15 coupon for my birthday 3 friends and I decided to come here for my birthday dinner. We had the worst waiter I've ever had in my life. He was extremely rude to us, at one point I asked for more bread and he literally looked at me and walked right past. So, apparently no extra bread even for customers who spent plenty of money. Bottle of decent wine, appetizer, 3 soups and 4 entrees. Felt like we were inconveniencing him by being there. Will never come back, especially for a special occasion.

My only suggestion would be to increase the portion sizes on a few of the entrees. I had the spinach gnocchi & my portion was too small. My uncle had the ravioli & he thought it was too small of a portion.
This is a wonderful Bucktown restaurant! Food is delicious, incredible mixed drink menu and exceptional staff! Love it!

Dined here before a United Center event and had very good food. Hubby and I shared four appetizers - three were fantastic and one was just so-so. We highly recommend the Sawtooth Wings, the Wild King Salmon Rolls, and the Bo La Lot - lots of flavors - wonderful crunch to the wings. The only disappointment was the Bo Bia - kind of dull. Also, had a nice cocktail list and wine menu. The room is pleasantly spare and romantically lighted (i.e. not too bright) We will definitely return.
Consistent very good food and very good service.Romantic booths.
Great place for both adults and to enjoy a meal without sacrificing food/service quality. Impressed given it's Clarendon Hills location. Will definitely be back.

Food was good, service was attentive but not annoying. Scarletti's has a good selection of dinner dishes and my dining experiences there have been good but not outstanding for a mid-level Italian eatery. I chose the Short Rib entree which unfortunately was dried out on one end (the rest was juicy and tender). I think a little more attention to detail in the kitchen could really "raise the bar" for this restaurant. For Downers residents it has a great location and is a great casual dining establishment.
The food there was outstanding and the prices were extremely reasonable. My boyfriend and I had a great experience there.
Our server Chad was fantastic! It was our first time there and he took time to explain the menu.
It was an excellent meal! Great atmosphere and amazing service! A great find for someone who's never been to Chicago before.
Our overall experience was very good to outstanding.

This is an undiscovered gem in the heart of Oak Park! My husband and I stumbled upon it as it has a very low profile from the exterior, but now have been back twice within a month and are planning to go as often as possible. The decor is subtle but classy, wait staff did an impeccable job, and the food was amazing! I had Basil Salmon which was rich in flavor, perfectly sized and prepared, and value priced. A wonderful twist of Asian flavors. Loved it!

It had been some time since we had dined here and it was truly a disappointment. Service was good and it is a lovely environment. Big party just outside was noisy. But the disapointment was food that can best be described as ordinary. Not up to standards of other Peninsula restaurants
Delicious as always. Excellent service. A great place to dine.
Great place... friendly servers. Will definitely be going back.

column4: 250 W Schick, Hilton Indian Lakes Resort Bloomingdale, IL  60108
column13: Dinner was no way worth the price! We have had better food at a chain restaurant, rice cold. Veggies cold. Tuna pre packaged and cold dnd over cooked! My pork chop was tough and over cooked. You should frock to stakes I guess but wouldn't know since I didn't order one. The ambiance was very noisy and you body romantic? McDonald's is less noisy. Our waiter was very good but did come to table early but then disappeared for a short time. Bar was ok but the waitress behind bar wears a pierce in her lip? What are you thinking when you charge 30 for a plate of cold food. You let people in wearing ball caps and sweats I mean really where is your class! I can see that attire if you serve hot dogs and burgers but 30 dollar pork chops.
A lot of great choices for special makis, great price, BYOB, good attentive and quick service but they do not rush you out. What else do you need?

column4: 80 River Oaks Center Dr Suite 101 Calumet City, IL  60409
column13: The Spice Scallops and Shrimp was bit too salty , but that is a personal preference, and the scallops were cooked perfectly. The Siam Platter was excellent.

column4: 4 E Phillip Rd Vernon Hills, IL  60061
column13: Food was good but not memorable. The pot stickers were very good but the rest of the food needed more flavor. The ability to choose a half order versus a full order allowed us to try a variety of dishes. Because of this option, we will return. Service was excellent!!

I've been to Sola for both dinner and brunch. While dinner was nice, brunch was really the star. The service was excellent on both occasions, but for brunch, the staff went the extra mile to help make my daughter's birthday special. I would highly recommend Sola if you are celebrating a special occasion.
The service was good not the food

column4: 2318 N Mannheim Rd. Melrose Park, IL  60164
column13: Amazing food! Service great. A+++++
The portions are larger than I anticipated (awesome). I really enjoyed my salad and the coconut shrimp. My friend raved over the salmon.
We arrived on time. Showed them our Open Table reservation on our phone and was informed they do not work with or honor Open Table. You should remove them from your site. Very confusing.

This is a tasty, casual neighborhood spot for eating out with friends and family. Enormous portions ... enough to take home and make a second meal! Very reasonable prices, and daily specials are a bargain. Very friendly service.

column4: 980 North Michigan Ave Level 2 Chicago, IL  60611
column13: Fabulous place, but so expensive.

Our server was not the best. We often had to call him over, especially when our cheese plate came to the table but there was no explanation of the different kinds of cheese. It took awhile to get the check and then pay. I have been going to Stained Glass since it opened, had a wedding shower in their private room, but this time I thought the experience did not fit the price tag.
Only decent restaurant in this hotel. Food fair, quantity excessive, service a bit too solicitous but friendly.
Thr food was excellent, the beer choice was great and the service was fabulous.

This is my second time at Sugar Toad. The first time was incredible!!!! The second time was not so good. The first time was for Valentines Day. My friend and I were bummed - we didn't have dates so we treated ourselves to dinner. The food was divine & the whole experiene was the finest in my entire life! Every part was perfection! Then the second time we came on Saturday for lunch. We looked on line before making reservations & thought the lunch menu was nice. When we arrived, it was a totally different menu & very limited. My son had chicken & waffles - both were over done and a huge disapointment. I had a OK hamburger & our special guest had OK hash. Disappointing expensive, mediocre lunch. Highly recommend weekday vs. weekend!

Have been to Sullivan's before and enjoyed it. However, this time, both service and food were just OK. Ordered cedar planked salmon. There was no infusion of the wood into the fish as the plank never smoked, and the fish was served more like seared tuna than salmon. If that is how the restaurant chooses to serve it, fine, but I feel that customers should be asked how well they would like the fish cooked. I had to send it back twice.
Positive: My food was very good - I enjoyed the King Crab Legs, shrimp cocktail, crab cakes and seafood bisque. Also, their wine list is very good - Duckhorn, Caymus, Joseph Phelps and beyond.

The quality of the food here really was top notch. However, the ambiance was just so bad. Plus its really pricey. If you put that sushi in a better atmosphere i would understand the price. All things considered we likely wont be back here much. But seriously high quality fish and presentation, probably some of the best I have had.
If you've never had sushi before, this place is a good one to try. But for someone who had sushi before, this place is ok. I've had better sushi somewhere else.

I went there this past sunday, 11/4/12, for brunch with my wife. The restaurant was smaller than what I expected but that actually added to the feel of the restaurant. It feels like you are dining in a country house/cottage. It felt very warm and cozy. We ordered the fried chicken and waffle, pulled pork hash, and the three cheese mac. Before the food came out, we were given this great starter of sweet potato bread with sweet whipped butter. Delicious. It had the consistency of really good cornbread. All the food was delicious. Even at $24 dollars for the fried chicken and waffle, it's worth it. And I loved the mac n cheese. I want to go back for dinner now.
Loved the 11 course meal. Only the last course of the dessert--the red bean--wasn't to my liking. The texture and too sweet taste was not for me. The other courses were superb.

This was our second visit to Talley's and it will not be our last. Good, varied menu and good service at reasonable prices. Nothing over $25 (most under $20) that I can recall, except maybe the specials. The scallops may be the best thing on the menu. My wife tried them the first time and ordered them again on this visit. The pork tenderloin was very good, but I'll try something else next time. Good reviews for the grouper and salmon in our party of four. We went on a Saturday night and it was fairly loud -- lots of children, not all of whom behaved. It was much quieter on our first visit, which was during the week. So if you like it quiet, skip the weekend. If you're bringing the kids, go on a Saturday night.
The food was bad. The service unhelpful. The delivery left a lot to be desired.
Really small portions, but low prices too.
Eva provided excellent service and recommendations and the food was delicious. We had the stuffed salmon and the lamb baked with vegetables. The lamb was the best I ever had.
The experience at Tatami was OK. The only blemish is OpenTable refusing to give me my points for fullfilling a reservation. I have a hard time understanding your justification for lying.

Read all prior reviews and Check Please and was expecting something great. Well I was not let down. it is only three days later and I have highly recommended to four friends. Thanks for great experience

I had dined at Tavern at the Park a couple of times for business lunches, and wondered how it would be for dinner. I went there with my family, and had a truly wonderful time. The decor is very pretty with very pleasant lighting and comfortable tables.
Flavors were spot on. The three of us ordered about 12 small plates total, two bottles of wine, and 3 desserts. Food and service was amazing!
Both traditional and no-traditional Spanish tapas...very good! Service a little slow. Reservation time is not a guarantee, both times I have gone, we still waited 20+ minutes.

Menu was innovative and appealing. Have been looking forward to going to Taxim -- I really wanted to love this place and I am sure it would have been a much better experience with a little help and enthusiasm from the waitress as to the ingredients and dishes.

This was my first experience at Terra and one of the reasons I chose it was because that had a parking area adjacent to it, however, when I arrived at 6:30 PM, the parking area was completely full. ( It can only accommodate 10 cars.) There was no valet and I drove around the block 3 or 4 times before the hostess told me I could park at the business next door. They wanted to seat us in a second room, where only one table was filled, but we asked to be in the main dining room, which was much more pleasant. The food was very tasty and the server as pleasant but the service was very show.
Great spot for really fun asian inspired dishes. Cocktails are fun, with a great selection to choose from.

column4: 780 Village Center Drive Burr Ridge, IL  60527
column13: Always a fabulous time, with delicious menu items and top notch service!!
Always a great place to join with groups, couples, or small crowd. Service is great and so is food.

i have been to a lot of sports bars in the area. but i have never been to one where patrons where so loud and obnoxious that other patrons were telling them to comedown. and management did nothing.And next to all of this was a little girl about 4 years old sitting on the edge of the bar.IF THIS IS YOUR TRADEMARK,NO THANK YOU

I love Trattoria Gianni! The new patio is fantastic for outdoor dining. The food is phenomenal! I had the gnocchi della nonna and my friend had the Conchiglie del Mercante. Both of which were phenomenal. The mozzarela on the gnocchi was so fresh and delicious. THe sauasage on the Conchiglie was so savory.
Great value. Great food. Excellent staff.
We had dinner at three different Italian restaurants during our visit to Chicago last week. The first two were very good but Trattoria No. 10 was hands down the best Italian food we have ever eaten.
Cute little restaurant. Great place to go before Second City.

We all had great unique delicious entrees and our bruschetta and calamari appetizers were great too. Our drinks consisted of a cocktail, chianti red wine and Peroni beer. Also our desserts was fantastic, my wife and me had the hazelnut gelato dessert which was so good, my dad had the cannoli and my stepmom had the tiramasu. some of us had coffee and espresso with our dessert all was fantasic. This was at least my third time being here and this time was just as good if not better than the last! Trattoria Trullo was a great dinning experience overall, the food and service was great, we celebrated my dad's birthday and it was great for everyone in our party including my 9 month old son who enjoyed trying some of our dishes and making friend
Trenchermen was fantastic. Very cool space, everyone having a good time, food was very good, especially the chicken thighs and the apple donuts.

I love Mediterranean food and this place is fantastic. The hummus and baba ghannoush are so fresh and taste great! It's also BYOB which is great. We have been twice since it opened and have not been disappointed. If you like Turkish/Mediterranean food this is a must try.

Though a neighborhood restaurant, the quality, taste, and appearance of the food was comparable to, if not better than, other Thai restaurants in fancy locations with higher prices. The ambiance may have been on the plain side, but the cooking was great!
We were stuck in a back room with very little atmosphere. Our server was very knowlegeable and attentive but we won't go back
This is becoming our favorite BYOB. Quiet and relaxed atmosphere with very reasonableprices.

Regardless of which of their restaurants I go to the experience is always great. This past weekend we had a very fussy eater and they basically catered a special dish for her. You can't go wrong here. I need to add that the singer in the bar area was fantastic!
Food was great. Waitress, not so much. Took a long time to get our drinks. Seemed distracted or too busy with other customers.
Always great Italian food. Goo waiters who know their stuff and stay out of the way without disappearing.
I always enjoying having dinner here as the food is delicious, the service is GREAT!!
I brought six of my out of town colleagues here for a dinner meeting. They all loved the food and atmoshpere. We had a wonderful experience.
Salmon special was superb. 4 of had this special at the managers recommendation and we were not disappointed.

We made our reservation at Ukai Sushi before seeing a play down the street. We ordered several pretty traditional rolls: Godzilla, Ukai Dynamite, and a fried asparagus crab roll. Every one of them was done perfectly and tasted really fresh. We also got a bowl of pork ramen soup which I could have passed on, but then again I'm not a big fan of miso based broths. The byob (wine) aspect of the restaurant is really nice, but there's also traditional teas and soft drinks to order.
The Food was excellent! It's BYOB! If you need to keep something cold, ask for a bucket with ice.

Not sure if I would recommend to a friend. We had terrible service. An almost non-existent waitress. We ordered the BBQ platter for the table which we found odd that she didn't bring out before our sushi. When we finished our sushi she asked would we like anything else to eat. We then reminded her of our BBQ platter which she had obviously forgotten about. We then had a 25 min lull in meal due to her putting in the BBQ order. Not once did she apologize for the delay. A simple apology would have changed our attitudes. She stayed away from our table for the entire 25 mins. Finally our platter came out, again with no apology. When my husband explained the situation to the hostess on our way out - no apology again.

For a moderately priced restaurant adjacent to a hotel, I wasn't sure what I'd get. But everyone must try the mussels on the appetizer menu. Best mussels I've had in ages. The chilean sea bass dish, rolled in nuts and a stream of passion fruit puree, was very tasty. The wine list is not extensive, but there are several great selections. Our server was very nice, a gentleman.
